story:
Coming in early 2019...

Pond Farm Brewing Co. will be a 15-barrel brewery and taproom in downtown San Rafael where both locals and visitors can enjoy delicious beers in a casual, fun, and family-friendly setting.

 

The Beer

We’ll brew on-site and serve a variety of beer styles, such as:

  • Hoppy West Coast favorites such as IPAs and pale ales
  • Lagers - we love ‘em and think you will too. We’ll have classic light and sessionable lagers, as well as darker lagers like Trevor’s award-winning Schwarzbier
  • Seasonal beers, like stouts in the winter or a spring saison
  • Stronger beers such as Imperial Stouts or Belgian Strong ales
  • Experimental brews which will be fun for us to make and fun for you to try!

 

The Food

When we first open, we’ll offer small snacks in the taproom. You can also bring in your own food, whether it’s from home or takeout/delivery from a local restaurant. We’ll also occasionally have food carts in our beer garden.

Long-term, we plan to build out our kitchen to offer you a fresh, seasonal, and delicious menu featuring pizzas, salads, and other bites made from as many locally-sourced ingredients as possible.

 

The Space

Bright natural light fill our taproom and our high ceilings give it a nice open feel. We have seating for about 120 inside at our poured concrete bar, long communal tables, countertops along the front windows, and in our back brick room (which is also be an event space for private tastings and craft nights). A small area is set aside for kids, we're installing an indoor bike rack for about 20 bikes, and our brewing area is visible from inside the taproom. We have a couple TVs for catching your favorite games and outside we have a beer garden for enjoying our awesome San Rafael weather.

 

Who are we?

We’re a husband and wife team who both grew up in Sonoma County but now call San Rafael home. We live about a 10 minute bike-ride from the brewery with our 2.5-yr-old, Jack. We’re so excited to bring our dream to life in the community where we live.

When we’re not working on the business we try to get outdoors as much as possible. Whether it’s hiking, camping, or cycling, we have a passion for adventure and activity.

We made a point not to take on partners or investors in order to ensure we’re able to run Pond Farm the way we want to, sticking to our values and never compromising on quality. But, we are really excited to open up crowdfunding because we get to share our business with the most important people to us: you!

 

 

What We Need

We’re aiming to raise at least $30,000, which will go to:

  • Sound system
  • Soft-seating area
  • Indoor bike rack
  • New sliding windows connecting the taproom to our beer garden outside
  • Countertop seating along the front windows

If we exceed our goal, we really want to invest in a Crowler machine so we can send you off with 32oz. of freshly-canned beer right out of the taproom.

Everyone told us a project like this would take twice as long and cost twice as much as we thought and that’s proven to be true (and then some)! Luckily, we planned for overages.

However, late in the game we ran into some large and unexpected construction overruns we really didn't have control over. Ouch. This has pulled money away from what we’d set aside for decking out the taproom with the items listed above. We still want to make all of that happen, and that’s why we need your help.

 

 

Our Story

When we met in San Francisco in 2011, one of the first things we connected over was our shared love of good beer. Hikes and bike rides were almost always followed by a stop for cold beer and then we started homebrewing together. Trevor had been homebrewing for years prior, but with a new eager taster to impress he started brewing more frequently. In every apartment and house we’ve lived in together, we’ve dedicated a significant amount of space to brewing equipment. We even brewed all the beer for our wedding in 2014!

The idea to open our own brewery and taproom started out as a daydream that we liked to talk about when we were stressed or tired of our day jobs, but slowly we both came to realize this was more than that - it was something we deeply desired and that we felt confident we could turn into a reality.

The first major step we took was when Trevor left aerospace engineering in 2015 to become an intern at Fogbelt Brewing in Santa Rosa. We wanted to make sure that he still loved brewing as much once it was a job, not just a hobby. He quickly moved up to Assistant Brewer, where he got extensive experience not just in brewing at a commercial scale, but also inventory management, bottling, canning, and sales. He loved it. When we moved to San Rafael in 2016 we thought - yes. This is the place. We need to build our taproom here! We got started on a business plan.

In early 2017 we came across a listing for the Wooden Duck furniture store building on 4th St. When we walked inside to check it out, we instantly knew it was the right space. Bright, natural light poured through the front windows and skylight and the high ceilings reminded us of a large beer hall. We were thrilled to find that there was an outdoor patio since we’d been hoping for a space that would allow us to take advantage of San Rafael’s fantastic weather. Our offer was accepted in June 2017 and the journey to turn 1848 4th St. into Pond Farm Brewing Co. began.

 

 

The Name

Our name is inspired by the former artists’ colony tucked in the hills of Sonoma County in Guerneville called Pond Farm, which not only has a family connection but also embodies our core values of quality, creativity, and community.

Pond Farm Workshops began as a school and residency for artists in the 1940s but by the mid-1950s it had converted to Pond Farm Pottery under the direction of Bauhaus potter Marguerite Wildenhain, one of Pond Farm Workshops’ first residents. Marguerite was a renowned potter and known for her passion and discipline for her craft.

In 1973, Trevor’s dad moved from Iowa to California to hone his ceramics skills under the tutelage of Marguerite at Pond Farm. Also living in Guerneville at the time was Trevor’s mom, who grew up in Armstrong Redwoods State Reserve above which Pond Farm was nestled. The two met, got married, and 2 years later Trevor was born and raised in the area nearby, hearing stories of the idyllic Pond Farm and its community of craftsmen and women.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If a monetary contribution isn’t feasible for you right now, we’d still immensely appreciate your help to spread the word about our project.

  • Share this link on any social media channels you use
  • Tell your local friends and family that we’ll be opening soon
  • Once we open, come check us out and leave us a review on Google, Yelp, or Untappd

 

 

Perk Details

In addition to the warm-and-fuzzies you’ll get knowing that you’re bringing us one step closer to our dream and you one step closer to holding a pint of Pond Farm beer in your hand, we’ve lined up some awesome rewards for you to claim as a thank you. Check details and photos below.

You can also always make a donation without claiming a reward if you’re feeling just that generous. Or, if you want to contribute a higher amount but claim a reward that's listed for less, just let us know - we'll be happy to accommodate.

Some items we expect to have before Christmas (as marked below), but if you’re hoping to give one of the rewards as a Christmas gift and it won’t arrive in time we are happy to get you a printable image and certificate that you can include in a card. We'll be setting up a few pickup times before Christmas when you can swing by the brewery to get your rewards.

If you need us to ship you an item, please select the (Shipped) option when choosing your perk. If you choose the (Pickup) option, that means you'll come to the brewery in San Rafael to pick up your item(s).

Now on to the good stuff...

 

Sticker - $10

For your donation of $10, we'll hook you up with a 3" circular sticker so you can show off your Pond Farm pride.

***Available at the brewery for pickup before Christmas! Stocking stuffer?***

 

Logo Pint Glass or Logo Tulip Glass - $20

Have a little piece of our taproom at your very own home. Choose between our 16oz pint glass or 13oz Belgian-style tulip glass. Best if used with Pond Farm beer you've brought home in a growler!

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

Handmade Logo Coffee Mug - $35

We love beer, but we also love coffee and tea and these hand-thrown ceramic mugs are simply gorgeous. Fun fact: they're made by Deneen Pottery, the company former Pond Farm potter Peter Deneen created. Choose from one of three colors: Powder Blue, Navy, or Coral. Durable and dishwasher safe.

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

 

Logo T-Shirt - $35

Sport your love for Pond Farm in our classic logo t-shirt. Available in both men's and women's cuts XS - XXL and a variety of colors (see options below).

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

Logo Trucker Hat - $40

Comfy, functional, and stylin' - whichever design you choose, this snapback trucker hat will quickly become a wardrobe staple.

 

Limited Edition: Team Pond Farm Tee - $45

Available only through our crowdfunding campaign, snag one of these limited edition baseball tees to mark yourself as an early Pond Farm supporter. We'll be sporting them. You know you want one, too. Unisex sizing.

 

Unisex Hoodies - $50

The perfect midweight sweatshirt for all occasions. Offers a fitted body with contrast french terry interior, contrast natural-colored exposed zipper tape, and thumbholes! Available colors: Olive Green and Navy Blue. XS - 3XL

 

West End Bundle - $85

Rep your shirt in the neighborhood and then come in for a beer! This perk gets you a logo t-shirt plus a 10-beer punch card good for any beer on tap (excluding special-release beers).

***Available for pickup at the brewery before Christmas!***

 

Swag Lover's Bundle - $95

This gets you a sticker, pint or tulip glass, logo t-shirt, and trucker hat because we know you love us that much. Sport them all at once for extra street cred.

 

Logo Bike Jersey - $100

Ok, we'll be honest. This was one of the items we were most excited about making and we can't wait to wear it on a ride in our beautiful Marin County! This full-zip jersey has 3 rear cargo pockets, an additional zippered pocket for valuables, and reflective piping for visibility. Men's and women's cuts; XS - XXL.

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

Thirsty Cyclist Bundle - $150

After enjoying a long ride (or a short one, we won't judge), you'll want to reward yourself with a cold one. This perk gets you a logo bike jersey and a a 10-beer punch card good for any beer on tap (excluding special-release beers).

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

Growler + 10 fills - $200

This gets you a fancy new logo glass growler as well as 10 fills of any of our beers on tap normally offered in growlers.

***Available now for pickup at the brewery***

 

Super Supporter Bundle - $250

This bundle gets you one of our limited edition Team Pond Farm tees, a glass growler plus 10 fills, and a pint glass or tulip glass you can use at home to drink all the beer you're getting.

 

 

1-yr Membership to the Pond Farm Stein Society - $300

Don't miss out on this limited opportunity! BONUS: we're throwing in a 64oz glass growler and pint glass or tulip glass for anyone who gets their membership through our crowdfunding campaign.

Membership to our Stein Society gets you:

  • Your own 22oz. stein glass with your name on it, along with “Original Member 2019” to mark you as one of our early supporters

  • Free stein parking - We’ll keep your stein washed and ready for you in the taproom

  • Beers you drink from your stein will be the price of a pint (16oz.) - that’s 6oz. for free!

  • Invite to our annual exclusive Stein Society members party, which will be held in the summer or fall when the weather is nice so we can be out in our beer garden

  • Early access to special release beers

  • Ability to fill growlers with specialty beers not normally offered for growlers

  • Discounts to brewery events

  • 10% off all merchandise

  • Free beer on your birthday (or within 1 month of your birthday)

  • Stein Society ID card (includes a member number which you’ll need to redeem Stein Society benefits)

  • ​Other cool stuff we haven't thought of, but don't worry - we'll spoil you!

More details on our website!

**If you're looking for this perk card under Select a Perk, it's at the top of the page as our featured perk!**

 

Brewers for a Day - $750

Take a peek into the world of a brewer with this hands-on experience, and bring a friend along. First, you'll work with Head Brewer Trevor to select a beer style to brew; then, schedule a day to come in and get your hands dirty. You'll act as assistant brewers for the day, helping with all aspects of the brew. And we mean ALL - it's important for brewers to sample the finished goods throughout the process... you know, for motivation and, um, quality control? You each can either choose to come back for a growler from the batch you actually brewed once it's ready, or take home a growler of the beer of your choice that day. We'll also send you home with a t-shirt and a logo glass.

 

Private Beer Tasting Party for You and 10 Friends - $1,000

Host your own beer tasting party in our private brick room and invite up to 10 friends to join you. We'll provide samples of all of our beers for everyone as well as small bites. One of our owners will lead a sensory evaluation and answer questions. Also, everyone will head home with a t-shirt and logo glass!

Note: this perk not redeemable until several months after opening - we want to make sure we have a full lineup of beer for you! We'll work with you to find a date that works best.

 

Private Crafting Party for You and 10 Friends - $1,200

We’ll be teaming up with local artists on the regular to put on craft nights in our brick room, but you have the opportunity to schedule a private crafting event for you and 10 of your friends. Choose from several craft options such as card-making, leather working (make a custom journal or passport holder), box-making, personalized aromatherapy body scrubs, build-your-own terrariums, personalized etched beer glasses, etc. If there is something specific you’re interested in doing, we can try to make it happen! Of course, beer to sip on while you craft is included and we'll send you each home with a logo pint or tulip glass.

 

Founder's Barrel - $1,500

Soon after opening, we'll start barrel-aging beers and this perk offers you the opportunity to have your name on one of our barrels in the taproom for life. When a barrel turns over, we'll affix your name plaque to its replacement so your mark will always be present in our space. In addition, this perk gets you:

  • Your first glass of each new barrel-aged beer we release for free
  • Ability to get growler fills of barrel-aged beers not normally offered for growlers
  • An invite to our private soft opening party for you and a friend
  • Our eternal gratitude

 

Private Beer Garden Party - $5,000

Gather up 35 of your friends for your own private party in our outdoor beer garden! Cafe string lighting overhead and plants all around, this will be THE place to be on a warm San Rafael evening. Beer and small bites included in this event.

 

The Big Kahuna - $10,000

The ultimate package. Claim one of every merch item we're offering, PLUS a lifetime membership to our Stein Society, and everything included in the Founder's Barrel perk. 

 

 

PLEASE NOTE: Perks that involve purchasing or consuming beer are restricted to those 21+. We will verify ID when you come for your beer.

Stein Society ID card (includes a member number which you’ll need to redeem Stein Society benefits)
​Other cool stuff we haven't thought of, but don't worry - we'll spoil you!
More details on our website!**If you're looking for this perk card under Select a Perk, it's at the top of the page as our featured perk!** Brewers for a Day - $750Take a peek into the world of a brewer with this hands-on experience, and bring a friend along. First, you'll work with Head Brewer Trevor to select a beer style to brew; then, schedule a day to come in and get your hands dirty. You'll act as assistant brewers for the day, helping with all aspects of the brew. And we mean ALL - it's important for brewers to sample the finished goods throughout the process... you know, for motivation and, um, quality control? You each can either choose to come back for a growler from the batch you actually brewed once it's ready, or take home a growler of the beer of your choice that day. We'll also send you home with a t-shirt and a logo glass. Private Beer Tasting Party for You and 10 Friends - $1,000Host your own beer tasting party in our private brick room and invite up to 10 friends to join you. We'll provide samples of all of our beers for everyone as well as small bites. One of our owners will lead a sensory evaluation and answer questions. Also, everyone will head home with a t-shirt and logo glass!Note: this perk not redeemable until several months after opening - we want to make sure we have a full lineup of beer for you! We'll work with you to find a date that works best. Private Crafting Party for You and 10 Friends - $1,200We’ll be teaming up with local artists on the regular to put on craft nights in our brick room, but you have the opportunity to schedule a private crafting event for you and 10 of your friends. Choose from several craft options such as card-making, leather working (make a custom journal or passport holder), box-making, personalized aromatherapy body scrubs, build-your-own terrariums, personalized etched beer glasses, etc. If there is something specific you’re interested in doing, we can try to make it happen! Of course, beer to sip on while you craft is included and we'll send you each home with a logo pint or tulip glass. Founder's Barrel - $1,500Soon after opening, we'll start barrel-aging beers and this perk offers you the opportunity to have your name on one of our barrels in the taproom for life. When a barrel turns over, we'll affix your name plaque to its replacement so your mark will always be present in our space. In addition, this perk gets you:
Your first glass of each new barrel-aged beer we release for free
Ability to get growler fills of barrel-aged beers not normally offered for growlers
An invite to our private soft opening party for you and a friend
Our eternal gratitude
 Private Beer Garden Party - $5,000Gather up 35 of your friends for your own private party in our outdoor beer garden! Cafe string lighting overhead and plants all around, this will be THE place to be on a warm San Rafael evening. Beer and small bites included in this event. The Big Kahuna - $10,000The ultimate package. Claim one of every merch item we're offering, PLUS a lifetime membership to our Stein Society, and everything included in the Founder's Barrel perk.   PLEASE NOTE: Perks that involve purchasing or consuming beer are restricted to those 21+. We will verify ID when you come for your beer.

story:
In November 2016 I had a dream.

To create an organic tea company that would give all profits to save wildlife. Very soon that dream will come true when animalltea becomes a reality with your help.

animalltea started life as “Panda Panda Tea” during a 2016 trip to Sichuan Province, China.

Home to fiery hotpots, tea houses and Giant pandas. Volunteering  at a panda sanctuary I got to wear a blue jump suit, smash up bamboo and pick up panda poo. 

On that trip, I realised two things.

First, no one could understand why I would pay to pick up panda poo (tourists took photos of me in the enclosure because they thought I was a prisoner being made to work).

Second, noone could understand why I’d want to give money away to wildlife:

“Pandas have loads of money!" .... "Why don’t you help kids get an education?"

So I did what we do with dreams. I put it away. Waiting for someone to give me permission.

That person was my 4 year old.

One night, reading him a story full of animals he looked up and asked “Dad...Are there any of these left?”.

It seems ‘permission’ is wondering if the stories your son will read his children will be full of animals. Or not.

If you have those dreams too, then join us at animalltea to help write a happier ending.

 

 

What is animalltea?

animalltea is a social business that exists for the support of organic tea farmers, the protection of wildlife and the creation of a sustainable business. Our teas come from growers who value and promote biodiversity. Our profits fund effective wildlife conservation. Our business creates jobs and even supports the work of conservation artists and filmmakers.

 

Our teas

Our teas are selected for their flavour and character. We only sell 'clean' teas. All are certified organic except for one which is grown with 100% natural fertiliser by a tea estate switching to organic farming.

Lwiro Dawn - Breakfast Tea

A breakfast blend of black teas from Satemwa Farm in the Shire Highlands of Malawi. Lwiro Dawn has a rich and velvety mouthfeel. Served black it has hints of grape, malt and caramel. A splash of milk brings out notes of vanilla and chocolate. Perfect at any time of day.

Sangha River - Organic Green Tea

A deeply vegetal organic green tea from Jeju Island, South Korea. Sangha River is picked in summer and steamed to bring out a vivid green colour and a hit of umami. It is rich in the mouth, has a fruity aroma and has notes of sea-breeze and mineral soil. Well-balanced, soothing and with no trace of bitterness.

Pride of Niassa - Organic Wild Rooibos

Sun-baked ochre needles produce a golden red brew that glows like an African sunset. Our organic wild rooibos from Wuppertal is more complex and flavourful than the dusty cultivated rooibos you find in a teabag. Caffeine-free, low in tannin, Pride of Niassa gives a smooth sweet liquor tasting of apple, honey and clove.

Pongo’s Paradise - First Flush Darjeeling

A biodynamic first flush Darjeeling from the Selimbong garden. The liquor is the colour of champagne and is delicate, fresh and fruity with a floral fragrance. A classic spring harvest black tea from the first certified biodynamic tea garden in the region. Expect golden raisin, white grape and notes of lily.

Credits: Top photos -  Les Jardins de Gaïa
Bottom photos - Anette Kay – Satemwa (Malawi)

 

Our partners

Our profits help to fund the work of four projects on the frontline of conservation. Each has a different focus and approach. Each has been chosen for its impact and effectiveness.

Sangha Pangolin Project
Central African Republic

Pangolins are a shy, scaly anteater found across Asia and Africa. Despite being protected under international law, pangolins are poached for bush meat and for their scales which are used in traditional Asian medicine. These reclusive and gentle mammals are now considered the most trafficked wild animal in the world.

At Sangha Pangolin Project, Rod and Tamar Cassidy and their team, rehabilitate injured and confiscated pangolins before ‘soft release’ back into the wild. They also run research and monitoring programmes with local Ba’aka trackers to learn more about pangolin behaviour and ecology.

 

Lwiro Primate Rehabilitation Centre
Democratic Republic of Congo

Lwiro Primate Rehabilitation Centre is a true lifeline for our closest cousins - the great apes. Lwiro provides sanctuary for orphaned chimps and monkeys whose parents have been killed by poachers for bushmeat. Orphans are found alone in the wild or confiscated from the illegal pet trade.

Once rescued, Itsaso Guinea and her team of expert vets and keepers, rehabilitate these traumatised orphans. They learn again to laugh, to play and to be part of a new family, so that one day they may be released back into the wild.

 

Niassa Carnivore Project
Mozambique

Lions face many threats from human conflict across Africa. Along with other large carnivores (leopards, African wild dogs, hyaenas) they are snared for bushmeat and illegally hunted for their bones, teeth and claws which are sold as trinkets in Asia. 

The Niassa National Reserve is home to over 1000 lions, 44 villages and the Niassa Carnivore Project which works to help these lions and local communities co-exist sustainably. Their holistic approach puts equal emphasis on effective anti-poaching and effective long-term community development to increase income, food security and education.

 

Aaron ‘Bertie’ Gekoski
UK

Aaron Gekoski is an award-winning environmental photojournalist, film-maker and TV presenter, specialising in human-animal conflict.

Aaron's work regularly appears in the international press and has won numerous awards including the coveted Wildlife Photographer of the Year and Nature Photographer of the Year. 

Aaron has spent years documenting animals in captivity and his latest documentary exposes orangutan tourism.

 

 

How will we use the funds raised?

The funds we raise will make up the first set of orders for animalltea ,  putting us on the path to our full launch in January 2021. Funds will cover the dispatch of orders and replacement stock. They will also be used to help create our new website, and invest in better packaging for retail.

What do I get and when?

Our perks include both teas and tea tastings. All tea orders will be shipped on December 18th 2020 but we can't guarantee they will be delivered on time for Christmas. Check them out here: 

 

 

Connect and share. 

Please follow us on Facebook & Instagram for news on our projects and teas.

Sharing this campaign with your network is so important to us. You can help us reach an audience we would otherwise have no access to and put us in touch with potential new members of the animalltea community.

It’s these small actions that when taken together can help us create a sustainable future for ourselves and our wildlife.

Thank you for your support. 

James Thirlwall and Julie Peltriaux

@animalltea

 

Partners

 

From left to right: Lwiro Primates Rehabilitation Center, Niassa Lion Project, Sangha Pangolin Project, Aaron Gekoski

 

Who is behind animalltea?

Our founder, James Thirlwall is a qualified tea sommelier who has worked in the speciality tea industry for over 8 years. He has run a successful organic tea company and been listed in The Guardian as one to watch in ‘the new tea revolution’. James has lived in Japan and travelled extensively through the tea gardens of China. He is now the Head of Business Development for one of the UK’s leading independent tea companies.

Our community and social media manager, Julie Peltriaux, has studied digital marketing and communication to use her skills to support organisations and businesses that promote eco-responsibility. She has worked with Sangha Pangolin Project to help them finance a new survey project. With a focus on conservation, social business and eco-friendly solutions in the digital space, she hopes through her work to promote online practices that are more respectful of the planet.

story:
6 Steps to Perfect Artisan Bread

Convenience

Using the LoafNest is so easy and practical. It takes less than 5 minutes of handy work to get the most amazing bread.

 

LoafNest fits well with your busy life and lets you make your own excellent bread. With the improved no knead recipe and LoafNest, it is so convenient to make amazing quality bread.

There is no kneading, no floured worktops to clean, and no proofing baskets to manage.

The Healthy Alternative

With LoafNest, it’s possible put in the ingredients that you trust in your bread and forget about preservatives, emulsifiers, stabilizers and other additives.

This loaf Has 3 Whole Carrots! LoafNest Carrot-Cumin (Caraway) Bread

Make vegan-friendly breads easily! Normally it is just flour, water, salt, and yeast. Since YOU decide what goes in your bread, you can be assured that the bread you make is vegan-friendly free of preservatives, additives and artificial flavor enhancers.

Simple White Loaf With Sesame Seeds - No Preservatives or Additives!

LoafNest recipe uses less than 1/6th the yeast of a traditional bread recipe: slow food made easy.

Loafnest is perfect for those with those sensitive to commercial bread or r for people who have difficulty digesting bread or other gluten rich foods

Enjoy Creative Freedom

LoafNest gives you free reign to let your creative juices flow. You aren’t constrained by limits of traditional baking.

You can use much higher amounts of water or other fluids (vegetable juices, dairy for example). The sky's the limit for herbs, spices, grains, veggies, cheese or other flavorings. Just mix them in or throw on top before baking. Use anykind of flour or combination.

Taste and Beauty

European style bread is made easy with LoafNest kit.

Olive and Garlic Loaf Made with LoafNest

 

The bread you make is full of deep flavor, crunchy crust and an airy crumb that is soft, moist and chewy but not tough. The crumb is airy, flavorful and shiny.

TThe results are so flavorful and delicious, you will never buy supermarket bread again.

LoafNest Sunflower Whole Wheat Loaf

LoafNest is designed so that you always get a good oven spring. Your breads will come out looking irresistible!

The non-stick perforated liner gives a texture on the bottom of the bread similar to professionally baked bread.

Consistency

LoafNest removes the uncertainty from bread making.

LoafNest is designed to bake excellent bread. LoafNest’s improved no knead recipe makes the process simpler. Robust and forgiving for small errors in measuring, count on LoafNest for that perfect loaf.

Creative LoafNest Loaf with Green Beans and Red Kidney Beans

Although we give you a recipe for assured good results, LoafNest is designed to let you experiment!

You can use LoafNest to make almost any recipe that would benefit from high humidity and high heat baking. 

With LoafNest’s non-stick perforated liner, bread easily comes out of the dutch oven. It peels off effortlessly from the bread while leaving a beautiful texture on the bread.

 

LoafNest liners are made with perforated glass fibers reinforced silicone. Perforations allow better heat transfer, allow moisture to escape at the bottom, giving a crunchy crust and give that professional baked texture on the bottom.

  • Two handles on top for safer two-hand operation.
  • Offset handles are inspired by butterfly and clover leaf. 
  • Tracks inside the top layer prevent condensation from accumulating in one place.
  • Casserole can be used also for bread storage.
  • The unique shape of the loaf makes it possible to have uniform slices for sandwiches, while remaining round enough for that artisanal appearance.

LoafNest revolutionizes home bread making by bringing high-heat, high-humidity professional baking environments to home kitchens. With the patent pending combination of classic cast iron and the state-of-the-art easy peel liner technology, LoafNest brings artisan bread making to everyday life.

Specifically designed cast iron heavy casserole stores and releases heat quickly to give an amazing oven spring to the loaf.

Flexible non-stick easy peel liner helps to seal the moisture in, making a crunchy crust and soft crumb. It also gives nice texture to the bottom of the bread, similar to professionally baked artisan breads.

Cast iron stores and releases heat same way as a baking stone used by traditional European bakers. Cast iron is robust, durable and simply looks gorgeous.

 

With proper care, it will last generations. LoafNest Dutch Oven is designed for making bread or used a traditional dutch oven.

LoafNest Enameled Cast Iron Casserole adheres to EU and US standards for food contact safety.

LoafNest cast iron casseroles are made in China by a reputable manufacturer who also supplies some of the top brands in Europe and North America.

Dimensions: Product dimensions are approximately 30 cm x 15.5 cm x 14.5 cm ( 12 inch x 6 inch x 5.75 inch) 

The inner size of the LoafNest is 23cm (~9 inch) long, 14.5cm (~6 inch) wide and 13.5cm (~5.5 inch) tall. The actual loaf will have same length and width and height between 4-5.5 inches depending on the recipe.

Weight: Approximately 5.5 kg (~12 lbs)

Color: Pantone Blue 286C with a gradient shade of Pantone Light Blue 0821C. [Colors are approximated] for the Casserole and black color for liner.

Dutch Oven: Thick cast iron. Colored glossy enamel coated on outside. Black matte enamel inside.

Liner: Glass fiber weave coated with food grade temperature resistant [-40°C to +260°C (-40°F to +500°F)], oven safe silicone.

 

 

Cast iron is heavy and LoafNest is relatively large. This makes the shipping quite a challenge. We have optimized our logistics that allows us to provide economical shipping to backers in a limited number of geographies.

For EU/US regions we have optimized shipping for 16 Euro. This includes all applicable taxes and duties. 

LoafNest is designed with secured offset handles to prompt two hand operation. When handling the hot casserole, securing all four handles together gives more stability. All our materials are food contact safe in line with EU and US regulations. 

The NYT no-knead bread recipe and My Bread by Jim Lahey

Flour Water Salt Yeast by Ken Forkish

Modernist Bread by Nathan Myhrvold and Francisco Migoya

Baking bread is as much a science as an art. Recent books like the 5-volume 'Modernist Bread' are an indication of how complex and wonderful the science of bread can be. We have worked hard to translate the best of the bread science into LoafNest to make it simple to use, to deliver consistent results, tolerant for errors in recipes, versatile for various types of breads, and to make beautiful and tasty bread for everyday use. Here is the science behind how we do it.

Hydration: the proportion of liquids in a recipe has a strong influence on the structure of the bread. This ratio is called hydration and typically expressed as a weight percent of flour in the recipe. For example, a 50% hydration recipe has 50 grams of water for every 100 grams of flour. Too low a hydration makes the bread end up dry and tough. Higher hydration is generally preferred for and high hydration breads (e.g. ciabatta) are known for their rich soft texture and taste. However, too high a hydration typically makes softer bread but after a point it causes the bread structure to collapse which makes a very dense bread. Of course, it also makes it very difficult to handle since the dough would be very runny. Only with a very strong protein structure can a high hydration bread hold its structure during baking. You can achieve this by adding flour strengthening agents (as done in many commercial bakeries) or by allowing more time for the protein structure to develop. With LoafNest, we recommend the long fermentation and slow yeast activity process to allow for the proteins to hydrolyze to a higher extent, to form stronger and longer chains that can help bread retain its structure even with high hydration, which is typically used in no knead methods. With the silicone liner to hold the dough during the baking, it makes it even easier.

Crust formation: Crust forms on the bread when the outer layer reaches a high temperature and goes through changes like Caramelization and Millard reactions. This creates the wonderful golden-brown color and the flavor. The texture of the crust comes from the gelling of starch on the surface as it hardens. A higher humidity of air around the bread as it is baking does not let the bread surface dry as it bakes. This gives a thin but crunchy crust that we associate with artisanal breads. LoafNest retains the moisture inside by forming a seal on the rim using the silicone liner while thick walls of cast iron provide high heat to the bread. This very effective moisture trapping allows for crunchy and thin crust.

Consistent baking temperature: Unknown to most home bakers, the temperature you set on your own is not necessarily the temperature experienced by the bread. We are not talking about inaccuracies in temperature setting. Even an oven with perfectly calibrated temperature will not ensure a consistency of temperature for bread baking simply due to the variation of humidity in atmosphere. Ever noticed how on a humid day you feel warmer with the same temperature that is fine on a dry day? The same thing happens to the bread. If the air is dry it experiences a lower temperature than that of air temperature. In thermodynamics this is called the wet bulb temperature. Since LoafNest seals moisture around the bread, the air will become quickly saturated with moisture and hence your bread will always experience the same temperature that you intend.

Oven spring: The large cracks on the surface of the bread (called ears/ oven spring) are distinguishing feature on many artisanal bread. On some breads like baguettes they are distinct part of the identity of the bread. Location and number of these ears is controlled on some breads by scoring with sharp a knife. These ears are formed when the outer layer of bread is partly hardened but inner of the bread is still expanding. This expansion of bread is called oven spring. When oven spring happens at the beginning of the baking before the outer layer is fully hardened, it can lead to wonderful ears. But oven spring requires a lot of heat input into the bread and most ovens can not provide heat fast enough. With specifically designed high thermal mass of cast iron casserole, LoafNest re-creates condition similar to a stone oven. This gives a great oven spring every time.

With the patent pending combination of classic cast iron and the state-of-the-art easy peel liner technology, LoafNest brings artisan bread making to everyday life.Specifically designed cast iron heavy casserole stores and releases heat quickly to give an amazing oven spring to the loaf.Flexible non-stick easy peel liner helps to seal the moisture in, making a crunchy crust and soft crumb. It also gives nice texture to the bottom of the bread, similar to professionally baked artisan breads.Cast iron stores and releases heat same way as a baking stone used by traditional European bakers. Cast iron is robust, durable and simply looks gorgeous. With proper care, it will last generations. LoafNest Dutch Oven is designed for making bread or used a traditional dutch oven.LoafNest Enameled Cast Iron Casserole adheres to EU and US standards for food contact safety.LoafNest cast iron casseroles are made in China by a reputable manufacturer who also supplies some of the top brands in Europe and North America.Dimensions: Product dimensions are approximately 30 cm x 15.5 cm x 14.5 cm ( 12 inch x 6 inch x 5.75 inch) The inner size of the LoafNest is 23cm (~9 inch) long, 14.5cm (~6 inch) wide and 13.5cm (~5.5 inch) tall. The actual loaf will have same length and width and height between 4-5.5 inches depending on the recipe.Weight: Approximately 5.5 kg (~12 lbs)Color: Pantone Blue 286C with a gradient shade of Pantone Light Blue 0821C. [Colors are approximated] for the Casserole and black color for liner.Dutch Oven: Thick cast iron. Colored glossy enamel coated on outside. Black matte enamel inside.Liner: Glass fiber weave coated with food grade temperature resistant [-40°C to +260°C (-40°F to +500°F)], oven safe silicone.  Cast iron is heavy and LoafNest is relatively large. This makes the shipping quite a challenge. We have optimized our logistics that allows us to provide economical shipping to backers in a limited number of geographies.For EU/US regions we have optimized shipping for 16 Euro. This includes all applicable taxes and duties. LoafNest is designed with secured offset handles to prompt two hand operation. When handling the hot casserole, securing all four handles together gives more stability. All our materials are food contact safe in line with EU and US regulations. The NYT no-knead bread recipe and My Bread by Jim LaheyFlour Water Salt Yeast by Ken ForkishModernist Bread by Nathan Myhrvold and Francisco MigoyaBaking bread is as much a science as an art. Recent books like the 5-volume 'Modernist Bread' are an indication of how complex and wonderful the science of bread can be. We have worked hard to translate the best of the bread science into LoafNest to make it simple to use, to deliver consistent results, tolerant for errors in recipes, versatile for various types of breads, and to make beautiful and tasty bread for everyday use. Here is the science behind how we do it.Hydration: the proportion of liquids in a recipe has a strong influence on the structure of the bread. This ratio is called hydration and typically expressed as a weight percent of flour in the recipe. For example, a 50% hydration recipe has 50 grams of water for every 100 grams of flour. Too low a hydration makes the bread end up dry and tough. Higher hydration is generally preferred for and high hydration breads (e.g. ciabatta) are known for their rich soft texture and taste. However, too high a hydration typically makes softer bread but after a point it causes the bread structure to collapse which makes a very dense bread. Of course, it also makes it very difficult to handle since the dough would be very runny. Only with a very strong protein structure can a high hydration bread hold its structure during baking. You can achieve this by adding flour strengthening agents (as done in many commercial bakeries) or by allowing more time for the protein structure to develop. With LoafNest, we recommend the long fermentation and slow yeast activity process to allow for the proteins to hydrolyze to a higher extent, to form stronger and longer chains that can help bread retain its structure even with high hydration, which is typically used in no knead methods. With the silicone liner to hold the dough during the baking, it makes it even easier.Crust formation: Crust forms on the bread when the outer layer reaches a high temperature and goes through changes like Caramelization and Millard reactions. This creates the wonderful golden-brown color and the flavor. The texture of the crust comes from the gelling of starch on the surface as it hardens. A higher humidity of air around the bread as it is baking does not let the bread surface dry as it bakes. This gives a thin but crunchy crust that we associate with artisanal breads. LoafNest retains the moisture inside by forming a seal on the rim using the silicone liner while thick walls of cast iron provide high heat to the bread. This very effective moisture trapping allows for crunchy and thin crust.Consistent baking temperature: Unknown to most home bakers, the temperature you set on your own is not necessarily the temperature experienced by the bread. We are not talking about inaccuracies in temperature setting. Even an oven with perfectly calibrated temperature will not ensure a consistency of temperature for bread baking simply due to the variation of humidity in atmosphere. Ever noticed how on a humid day you feel warmer with the same temperature that is fine on a dry day? The same thing happens to the bread. If the air is dry it experiences a lower temperature than that of air temperature. In thermodynamics this is called the wet bulb temperature. Since LoafNest seals moisture around the bread, the air will become quickly saturated with moisture and hence your bread will always experience the same temperature that you intend.Oven spring: The large cracks on the surface of the bread (called ears/ oven spring) are distinguishing feature on many artisanal bread. On some breads like baguettes they are distinct part of the identity of the bread. Location and number of these ears is controlled on some breads by scoring with sharp a knife. These ears are formed when the outer layer of bread is partly hardened but inner of the bread is still expanding. This expansion of bread is called oven spring. When oven spring happens at the beginning of the baking before the outer layer is fully hardened, it can lead to wonderful ears. But oven spring requires a lot of heat input into the bread and most ovens can not provide heat fast enough. With specifically designed high thermal mass of cast iron casserole, LoafNest re-creates condition similar to a stone oven. This gives a great oven spring every time.

story:
If you are a small distillery owner, then you are well aware of the three-tier system and the constraints it places on your business. This outdated means of retail distribution seriously constrains your ability to get your product to your customers, in all states, at a fair price. And it makes your tasting room, if you’re lucky enough to have one, your most profitable retail channel.

If you are a craft spirits enthusiast living away from a major metropolitan area, you know how hard it can be to find great spirits from small independent distilleries in your local liquor store.

But it doesn't have to be that way, and the wine industry has already proven it.

For those of you not familiar with how wines from small wineries ended up getting shipped around the country, a quick history lesson.

Prior to 2005, Michigan and New York state law allowed in-state wineries to directly ship alcohol to consumers, but prevented out-of-state wineries from doing so. Thankfully, the 2005 Supreme Court decision in the case of Granholm v. Heald ruled that it was unconstitutional to favor in-state wineries at the expense of out-of-state wineries. Since this ruling a growing number of states have allowed small wineries to ship wine directly to consumers and, as of March 2017, 45 states now allow small wineries to ship to their residents.

This was not only a huge victory for wineries, but was as big a victory for consumers everywhere.

Which brings us to this campaign: For-Lovers, along with two small distilleries , have engaged the firm of Epstein Cohen Seif & Porter,  and specifically Robert Epstein, the legal mastermind who argued the constitutionality of interstate wine shipping in Granholm v. Heald, to do for distilleries what they achieved for wineries.

If you own - or work for - a small craft distillery, imagine selling your spirits directly to a consumer anywhere in the United States, resulting in a significantly larger profit margin that goes directly to your bottom line.

If you are consumer imagine receiving a spectacular bottle of whiskey, from a small independent distillery in another state, in a matter of days.

How great would that be?

Well, we are on our way to achieving this vision...but to get there, we need your help. It's time for all of us, one community of distillers and consumers alike, to take a stand and change the byzantine liquor laws that prohibit small distilleries from shipping directly to consumers.  

As you can imagine, initiatives to change the laws don't come cheap, and this is certainly beyond the means of For-Lovers and our distillery partners alone. We need to raise at least $15,000 in order to fund our legal proceedings and overturn this prehistoric legislation, so we are asking for your help.

Please join us in this fight by making a contribution if you can: every little bit gets us closer to making interstate shipping for small independent distilleries a reality.

Together, we can support our nation’s independent distillers and change the world of artisanal spirits for the better, facilitating commerce, partnership, and a vibrant marketplace where small independent distilleries, and the consumers that support them, can thrive.

Use of funds raised here:

  • $12,500: Seeding the legal effort needed to change the spirits shipping laws
  • $2,500 - Case administration and management

All funds raised beyond $15,000: the development of infrastructure to support and facilitate direct to the Distillery-To-Consumer direct marketplace so it is ready when case is won.

story:
We spent hundreds of hours working in our home kitchen, with chefs and then food scientists to perfect our shockingly delicious recipe that some people can't believe is really fish!" 


OneForNeptune’s sea jerky is endorsed by doctors, athletes,  moms, kids, and sustainable seafood scientists! 

 

 

Get a low-calorie snack that tastes great and can help boost your heart health, immune system, brain function, and cognitive performance. Paleo and Keto friendly, non-GMO, gluten free and made with all-natural, preservative-free ingredients.

 

 

Not only does it taste AMAZING, OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky is GOOD FOR YOU too!

 

 

With OFN Pacific rockfish jerky, you’ll get more protein per pound than salmon, beef, or chicken. Pacific rockfish has 30-100x more Omega-3s than beef and even double the Omega-3s of Atlantic Cod!

OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky is also rich in Selenium, Vitamin D, and Vitamin E, making it great for boosting your heart health, strengthening your immune system, supporting stronger bones, healthier skin, and improving brain function and cognitive performance.

 

The Rockfish is a little known rockstar of the US West Coast. The name ‘Pacific rockfish’ describes a family of abundant, sustainably-managed species common from Southern California to the Pacific Northwest and Alaska. We use this amazing wild-caught fish to make our delicious jerky.

 

 

Despite the fact that they are an absurdly rich source of high-quality, sustainable protein, rockfish are currently an undervalued and underutilized fish. After being depleted through poor management and overfishing in the 1980’s and 1990’s, populations have rebounded, fishermen are catching rockfish, but consumer interest hasn’t bounced back for this noble fish. In fact, only 24% of the scientifically-based West Coast quota for Pacific rockfish is caught.

 

 

Our Pacific rockfish is packed with protein and Omega-3 healthy fats, while surprisingly low in calories per gram. In fact, it has roughly ¼ the calories per gram compared to ground beef! It also has zero saturated fat and 2x the Omega-3 content of Atlantic cod!

 

 

Not only that, but Pacific rockfish is also a good source of Selenium, Vitamin D, and Vitamin E - making it an amazing and delicious superfood for any occasion.  

 

Rockfish has almost 12x more Omega-3s than Chicken, and almost 2x more than Atlantic Cod and Tilapia.

 

 

Rockfish has 50x more Vitamin D than ground beef, 30x more than chicken, and 4.2x more than Atlantic cod.

 

 

Rockfish has 6x more Vitamin E than turkey, 1.5x more than chicken, and 2x more than ground beef.

 

 

Rockfish has 4x more Selenium than Chicken, beef, and farmed salmon. It also has 2x more Selenium than Atlantic cod and wild salmon.

 

 

Our Pacific rockfish is packed with lean protein with next to zero saturated fat. Even better, rockfish contains ⅓ the calories per gram compared to ground lean beef. You would be hard pressed to find a better protein-to-calorie ratio.

In fact, 100g of Pacific rockfish contains only 90 calories, of which 82% are derived directly from protein! Compare that to the 332 calories per 100g of ground beef, 186 calories per 100g of chicken, and 119 calories per 100g of lean turkey breast.

 

 

OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky is not just high in protein, one packet contains 100% of the broadly accepted daily recommendation for healthy Omega-3 fatty acids as well (250-500mg). In 100g of Pacific rockfish, there is up to 350 mg of Omega-3. That’s DOUBLE the amount found in Atlantic cod, 4x the amount in Tilapia, 12x chicken, and 30-100x that of beef!

 

 

Omega-3 fatty acids are well-known to be great for improving your heart health and preventing heart disease. It’s been shown to lower elevated triglyceride levels - which has been shown to decrease your risk for heart disease. 

Experts also recommend eating whole food/real seafood rather than supplements to get your Omega-3 intake. Studies suggest that Omega-3s from whole food sources were better absorbed into our bodies than Omega-3s from supplements.

There have also been studies showing Omega-3s can help with joint pain and rheumatoid arthritis, depression, vision loss, as well as infant health & neurodevelopment. Some studies also cite a reduced risk in cognitive decline, Alzheimer’s disease, and dementia, as well as a reduced risk of cancer, with higher Omega-3 intake.

A recent study also found that children who reported eating fish weekly scored 4.8 points higher on IQ exams as compared to those who didn’t.

 

 

Along with Omega-3s, our jerky is also packed with Vitamin D & E.

Vitamin D & E are proven to be vital for skin and bone development and to help build a stronger immune system. Along with getting a healthier body, these vitamins can also help improve brain function and cognitive performance. 

 

 

Needless to say, OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky makes a super-snack for body-hacking and overall health.

 

 

Our Pacific rockfish is also a great source of Selenium. In fact, rockfish has more Selenium than almost any other animal protein.

 

 

Selenium is an antioxidant that helps prevent coronary heart disease, fights inflammation, and increases blood flow.

 

 

Some recent studies also that suggest Selenium may reduce the likelihood of certain cancers, These studies are so far inconclusive but this remains an exciting, growing area of research.

And let’s not forget that rockfish, as mentioned, contains almost zero saturated fat. All hail the mighty, heart-healthy rockfish!

 

 

We took extreme care in selecting every ingredient in OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky. All of our products are non-GMO, gluten-free, and nitrate/preservative free making it the perfect snack for anyone on a ketogenic diet or paleo lifestyle. For those avoiding meat, now you can eat jerky while maintaining a Pescatarian diet.

We also made sure that our products are kosher, free of dairy, nut free so as many people as possible can enjoy it!

 

 

Sustainability is why we embarked on this journey and it is at the core of our mission, vision, and future. All of the fish we source are 100% U.S. wild-caught Pacific rockfish. We make sure that every single fish comes from a sustainably managed fishery certified by the leading international sustainable seafood ecolabel and that the species and gear types are “Best Choice". We have made efforts to align ourselves with a network of hardworking, dependable, small-scale fishers who buy into OneForNeptune’s driving mission.

 

 

We believe that it is critically important that you know all about the fish you’re buying, as well as where and by whom  it was caught. With our “Find My Fish” platform, you can scan the QR code found on the back of each OneForNeptune package, where you will find all of this information and learn more about the global seafood trade.

 

 

Paying homage to the Vikings who sailed to distant lands with dried fish in their Longboats, our Original flavor blends smoky sea salt with cracked pepper and gin-soaked juniper berries, leaving your mouth watering for more. Created in our founder’s kitchen in, New Mexico, OneForNeptune started with a dream and countless hours of trial and error.  Excited for new adventures and flavors ahead, Norse Smoke will forever be our foundation in creating a bluer future for our oceans.

 

 

Our fiery blend of Cajun spices invigorates the taste buds of adventure seekers on the trail, cliff face, open water.  Inspired by Creole chefs from the Louisiana Bayou, who have a long-lasting tradition of bold, rich dishes, or spice combinations of cayenne, paprika, garlic, thyme, salt, and peppers are truly something special. This mouthwatering blend will get you hooked. Don’t forget to share!

 

 

Balancing zesty lemon, smooth honey, and crisp, refreshing ginger, our HLG flavor will elicit an involuntary “mmmmMmmm” as the blend of sweet and savory hits your palette. This one is a favorite of snackers young and old and is an excellent complement to a cheese plate or packed lunch on a spring picnic or afternoon sail.

*Please note that these figures may shift slightly as we go into full production, but the ingredient lists will not change

 

 

One For Neptune was founded by Nick Mendoza, a marine scientist and aquaculture researcher recently recognized on the Global Aquaculture Alliance’s 30 under 30 list of leaders “making waves” in the global seafood industry.

 

 

Most people don’t know that about 90% of the U.S. seafood supply is imported and less than 2% of global seafood can be traced back to a fisher or fishing community. Unfortunately, this means that the source of a lot of fish is unknown or, worse, intentionally mislabeled. In fact, as much as 68% of seafood sold in the US is mislabeled. This is a problem because if we do not know where our fish is coming from, we have no idea whether we are supporting fair, ethical fisheries or sustainable fishing practices. Luckily, we can all be a part of the solution.

The seas have a tremendous capacity to produce healthy, sustainable food. If properly managed, they support life and human livelihoods around the planet. This is food that can even be produced without the use of freshwater or agricultural products, in the case of responsible, wild-caught seafood. At the same time, about 80-90% of Americans do not meet dietary recommendations for seafood consumption. We at OneForNeptune want to change that and make it easier for you to enjoy the best that the ocean has to offer.

 

 

We are embarking on this journey to change the perception of seafood in this country and make it easy and delicious for people to enjoy the amazing benefits of seafood anywhere they go. Not only can you feel good about the nutrition of what you’re putting into your body, but you can also feel good about the impact you’re having on our planet.

 

 

When you choose OneForNeptune, you are supporting U.S. jobs while taking care of Mother ocean, one bite at a time.

The ocean is our most valuable resource. We want to use food as part of the solution for our Blue Planet. Together, we can keep our oceans vibrant and pass on their bounty to future generations.

 
 

Nick wishes he'd been born with gills but does his best to live a seafaring existence without ‘em. Claiming both San Diego, CA and his family ranch in the Gila Wilderness of New Mexico as home, he was raised with an innate respect for land & sea, their preservation being of the utmost importance. Before taking the helm at OneForNeptune, Nick worked in sustainable aquaculture research and marine science in eight countries, which included tagging sharks and tuna at sea, and several trans-Pacific sailing voyages. Deep in Nick’s heart, you’ll find a commitment to sustainable seas, healthier, more delicious food, and disruptive change, which are guiding tenets of OneForNeptune. When he’s not in the Captain’s quarters, you’ll find Nick deep underwater chasing fish and abalone or off-trail in the backcountry of New Mexico (depending on whether it’s a surf or turf time of the year).

 

James is an Englishman by heart and avid adventurer. Sailing since an early age he developed a fondness for the open waters of the seas. Before James celebrated his 20th birthday, he successfully established, developed, and sold his first business.  His desire for more pushed him to pursue his studies at the University of Loughborough. In 2010 he set up a luxury eCommerce company which has allowed him to travel extensively, picking up the important marketing, negotiation, buying, selling, and operational skills required for business. James is a foodie with a passion for travel. He loves efficiency and smooth operations. In his downtime, he's often found very close to or on the water.

 

Financial, legal, and contract expert. After studying Economics at Stanford University, Garrett went to work a for a Southern California based commercial real estate corporation, rising to become CFO of the $640M company in four years. He moved on from this role in hopes of generating greater social and environmental impact through his work and found OneForNeptune. Hailing from the Palos Verdes Peninsula, a Los Angeles coastal suburb, Garrett developed a love for the sea inspecting the tide pools of Abalone Cove and making his fondest memories on the sunny, sandy, Southern California beaches with his family.

 

 

We love the ocean. We love diving its depths, surfing its waves, admiring its perfect creatures, and pondering its countless mysteries. The ocean is our greatest resource, and we want to be a part of the solution. Join us - so future generations have the opportunity to enjoy all that the ocean has to offer.

 

Since starting OneForNeptune, we have grown leaps and bounds.  We’ve brainstormed, we’ve researched, we’ve pitched, and even won an internationally acclaimed prize. We have the right team and the pieces in place to make our dream a reality, but we need your help.

 

 

With your support, OneForNeptune can begin production to launch our first three flavors. Any additional funds will be used to grow our partnerships with small-scale fishermen and to further our educational outreach so everyone can be a part of our mission. Join our crew and you will be the very first to receive our jerky and the many other treasures we have to offer.  You can help us accomplish our goals so together we can be a part of a healthy, sustainable, and delicious future, for you, me, and the sea.

 

Q: Is Sea Jerky gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free, non-GMO?

A: Yes! Our Sea Jerky is gluten-free, nut-free, dairy-free, non-GMO, gluten-free, Kosher, nitrate/nitrite-free, and free of artificial preservatives. The allergens that our products do contain soy and fish.

Q: How do I select the flavor I want to purchase?

A: After you purchase your Sea Jerky, you will receive an email survey that will let you choose the jerky flavors you will receive.

Q: Will OneForNeptune ship internationally?

A: We will be shipping to Canada, as well as across the US.

Q: When will my jerky be delivered?

A: Our goal is to have your jerky delivered in November, and we will be sure to send you updates along the way!

Q: Do you have a guarantee/warranty?

A: Satisfaction Guaranteed! We are so confident you'll love our product that we will send you a full refund if you are not satisfied.

Q: Is OneForNeptune Sea Jerky organic? What ingredients do you use?

A: While we use organic ingredients, truly wild-caught fish cannot be certified as organic. However, all of our fish is wild-caught in the waters of the pristine US West Coast and is 100% traceable to “Best Choice” fisheries. The ingredient lists for all three of our flavors are viewable on the Kickstarter page.

Q: How can OneForNeptune fish jerky not taste fishy?

A: We spent countless hours developing our unique recipe and spice blends to bring out the best qualities in the high-quality rockfish we use, while emphasizing rich, bold flavors that were created in our home kitchen and alongside some of the best food scientists.

Q: How does “Find My Fish” work?

A: Using your smartphone, you can scan the QR code on the back of every packet by opening your iPhone camera or QR reader. A link to our “Find My Fish” page will appear, where you can enter your unique batch number to learn about the fish, fisher, and fishery where we sourced your product. Full transparency and traceability to the source, supported by FishTrax.

Q: Can I buy Sea Jerky online now?  Where can I buy Sea Jerky?

A: Currently, our Sea Jerky is exclusively sold on Kickstarter!  We are currently working on getting our jerkies to a store near you

Q: Is OFN’s jerky made in America?

A: Yes, our fish is caught by American fishers, filleted, and manufactured by American hands in the Pacific Northwest. Every step of our production utilizes American workers.

Studies suggest that Omega-3s from whole food sources were better absorbed into our bodies than Omega-3s from supplements.There have also been studies showing Omega-3s can help with joint pain and rheumatoid arthritis, depression, vision loss, as well as infant health & neurodevelopment. Some studies also cite a reduced risk in cognitive decline, Alzheimer’s disease, and dementia, as well as a reduced risk of cancer, with higher Omega-3 intake.A recent study also found that children who reported eating fish weekly scored 4.8 points higher on IQ exams as compared to those who didn’t.  Along with Omega-3s, our jerky is also packed with Vitamin D & E.Vitamin D & E are proven to be vital for skin and bone development and to help build a stronger immune system. Along with getting a healthier body, these vitamins can also help improve brain function and cognitive performance.   Needless to say, OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky makes a super-snack for body-hacking and overall health.   Our Pacific rockfish is also a great source of Selenium. In fact, rockfish has more Selenium than almost any other animal protein.  Selenium is an antioxidant that helps prevent coronary heart disease, fights inflammation, and increases blood flow.  Some recent studies also that suggest Selenium may reduce the likelihood of certain cancers, These studies are so far inconclusive but this remains an exciting, growing area of research.And let’s not forget that rockfish, as mentioned, contains almost zero saturated fat. All hail the mighty, heart-healthy rockfish!  We took extreme care in selecting every ingredient in OneForNeptune’s Sea Jerky. All of our products are non-GMO, gluten-free, and nitrate/preservative free making it the perfect snack for anyone on a ketogenic diet or paleo lifestyle. For those avoiding meat, now you can eat jerky while maintaining a Pescatarian diet.We also made sure that our products are kosher, free of dairy, nut free so as many people as possible can enjoy it!  
  Sustainability is why we embarked on this journey and it is at the core of our mission, vision, and future. All of the fish we source are 100% U.S. wild-caught Pacific rockfish. We make sure that every single fish comes from a sustainably managed fishery certified by the leading international sustainable seafood ecolabel and that the species and gear types are “Best Choice". We have made efforts to align ourselves with a network of hardworking, dependable, small-scale fishers who buy into OneForNeptune’s driving mission.  We believe that it is critically important that you know all about the fish you’re buying, as well as where and by whom  it was caught. With our “Find My Fish” platform, you can scan the QR code found on the back of each OneForNeptune package, where you will find all of this information and learn more about the global seafood trade.  
 
  Paying homage to the Vikings who sailed to distant lands with dried fish in their Longboats, our Original flavor blends smoky sea salt with cracked pepper and gin-soaked juniper berries, leaving your mouth watering for more. Created in our founder’s kitchen in, New Mexico, OneForNeptune started with a dream and countless hours of trial and error.  Excited for new adventures and flavors ahead, Norse Smoke will forever be our foundation in creating a bluer future for our oceans.  Our fiery blend of Cajun spices invigorates the taste buds of adventure seekers on the trail, cliff face, open water.  Inspired by Creole chefs from the Louisiana Bayou, who have a long-lasting tradition of bold, rich dishes, or spice combinations of cayenne, paprika, garlic, thyme, salt, and peppers are truly something special. This mouthwatering blend will get you hooked. Don’t forget to share!  Balancing zesty lemon, smooth honey, and crisp, refreshing ginger, our HLG flavor will elicit an involuntary “mmmmMmmm” as the blend of sweet and savory hits your palette. This one is a favorite of snackers young and old and is an excellent complement to a cheese plate or packed lunch on a spring picnic or afternoon sail. 
 *Please note that these figures may shift slightly as we go into full production, but the ingredient lists will not change  
 One For Neptune was founded by Nick Mendoza, a marine scientist and aquaculture researcher recently recognized on the Global Aquaculture Alliance’s 30 under 30 list of leaders “making waves” in the global seafood industry.  Most people don’t know that about 90% of the U.S. seafood supply is imported and less than 2% of global seafood can be traced back to a fisher or fishing community. Unfortunately, this means that the source of a lot of fish is unknown or, worse, intentionally mislabeled. In fact, as much as 68% of seafood sold in the US is mislabeled. This is a problem because if we do not know where our fish is coming from, we have no idea whether we are supporting fair, ethical fisheries or sustainable fishing practices. Luckily, we can all be a part of the solution.The seas have a tremendous capacity to produce healthy, sustainable food. If properly managed, they support life and human livelihoods around the planet. This is food that can even be produced without the use of freshwater or agricultural products, in the case of responsible, wild-caught seafood. At the same time, about 80-90% of Americans do not meet dietary recommendations for seafood consumption. We at OneForNeptune want to change that and make it easier for you to enjoy the best that the ocean has to offer.  We are embarking on this journey to change the perception of seafood in this country and make it easy and delicious for people to enjoy the amazing benefits of seafood anywhere they go. Not only can you feel good about the nutrition of what you’re putting into your body, but you can also feel good about the impact you’re having on our planet.  When you choose OneForNeptune, you are supporting U.S. jobs while taking care of Mother ocean, one bite at a time.The ocean is our most valuable resource. We want to use food as part of the solution for our Blue Planet. Together, we can keep our oceans vibrant and pass on their bounty to future generations. 
 
   Nick wishes he'd been born with gills but does his best to live a seafaring existence without ‘em. Claiming both San Diego, CA and his family ranch in the Gila Wilderness of New Mexico as home, he was raised with an innate respect for land & sea, their preservation being of the utmost importance. Before taking the helm at OneForNeptune, Nick worked in sustainable aquaculture research and marine science in eight countries, which included tagging sharks and tuna at sea, and several trans-Pacific sailing voyages. Deep in Nick’s heart, you’ll find a commitment to sustainable seas, healthier, more delicious food, and disruptive change, which are guiding tenets of OneForNeptune. When he’s not in the Captain’s quarters, you’ll find Nick deep underwater chasing fish and abalone or off-trail in the backcountry of New Mexico (depending on whether it’s a surf or turf time of the year). James is an Englishman by heart and avid adventurer. Sailing since an early age he developed a fondness for the open waters of the seas. Before James celebrated his 20th birthday, he successfully established, developed, and sold his first business.  His desire for more pushed him to pursue his studies at the University of Loughborough. In 2010 he set up a luxury eCommerce company which has allowed him to travel extensively, picking up the important marketing, negotiation, buying, selling, and operational skills required for business. James is a foodie with a passion for travel. He loves efficiency and smooth operations. In his downtime, he's often found very close to or on the water. Financial, legal, and contract expert. After studying Economics at Stanford University, Garrett went to work a for a Southern California based commercial real estate corporation, rising to become CFO of the $640M company in four years. He moved on from this role in hopes of generating greater social and environmental impact through his work and found OneForNeptune. Hailing from the Palos Verdes Peninsula, a Los Angeles coastal suburb, Garrett developed a love for the sea inspecting the tide pools of Abalone Cove and making his fondest memories on the sunny, sandy, Southern California beaches with his family.  We love the ocean. We love diving its depths, surfing its waves, admiring its perfect creatures, and pondering its countless mysteries. The ocean is our greatest resource, and we want to be a part of the solution. Join us - so future generations have the opportunity to enjoy all that the ocean has to offer. 
 Since starting OneForNeptune, we have grown leaps and bounds.  We’ve brainstormed, we’ve researched, we’ve pitched, and even won an internationally acclaimed prize. We have the right team and the pieces in place to make our dream a reality, but we need your help.  With your support, OneForNeptune can begin production to launch our first three flavors. Any additional funds will be used to grow our partnerships with small-scale fishermen and to further our educational outreach so everyone can be a part of our mission. Join our crew and you will be the very first to receive our jerky and the many other treasures we have to offer.  You can help us accomplish our goals so together we can be a part of a healthy, sustainable, and delicious future, for you, me, and the sea. 
 
 
 Q: Is Sea Jerky gluten-free, dairy-free, nut-free, non-GMO?A: Yes! Our Sea Jerky is gluten-free, nut-free, dairy-free, non-GMO, gluten-free, Kosher, nitrate/nitrite-free, and free of artificial preservatives. The allergens that our products do contain soy and fish.Q: How do I select the flavor I want to purchase?A: After you purchase your Sea Jerky, you will receive an email survey that will let you choose the jerky flavors you will receive.Q: Will OneForNeptune ship internationally?A: We will be shipping to Canada, as well as across the US.Q: When will my jerky be delivered?A: Our goal is to have your jerky delivered in November, and we will be sure to send you updates along the way!Q: Do you have a guarantee/warranty?A: Satisfaction Guaranteed! We are so confident you'll love our product that we will send you a full refund if you are not satisfied.Q: Is OneForNeptune Sea Jerky organic? What ingredients do you use?A: While we use organic ingredients, truly wild-caught fish cannot be certified as organic. However, all of our fish is wild-caught in the waters of the pristine US West Coast and is 100% traceable to “Best Choice” fisheries. The ingredient lists for all three of our flavors are viewable on the Kickstarter page.Q: How can OneForNeptune fish jerky not taste fishy?A: We spent countless hours developing our unique recipe and spice blends to bring out the best qualities in the high-quality rockfish we use, while emphasizing rich, bold flavors that were created in our home kitchen and alongside some of the best food scientists.Q: How does “Find My Fish” work?A: Using your smartphone, you can scan the QR code on the back of every packet by opening your iPhone camera or QR reader. A link to our “Find My Fish” page will appear, where you can enter your unique batch number to learn about the fish, fisher, and fishery where we sourced your product. Full transparency and traceability to the source, supported by FishTrax.Q: Can I buy Sea Jerky online now?  Where can I buy Sea Jerky?A: Currently, our Sea Jerky is exclusively sold on Kickstarter!  We are currently working on getting our jerkies to a store near youQ: Is OFN’s jerky made in America?A: Yes, our fish is caught by American fishers, filleted, and manufactured by American hands in the Pacific Northwest. Every step of our production utilizes American workers.

story:
Hello,

My name is Charlie Sizemore. I've been working in Burlington restaurants and bars for the past 15 years--running Taco Gordo for the past four. Many of you are familiar with the business, if not please check out our Facebook,  Instagram and Website.

We're taking Taco Gordo off the streets and into the old Burlington Beverage and Redemption Center space in the Old North End of Burlington. Full bar, 50+ seats, outdoor seating, and all our tortillas being made fresh by our neighbors in the space, All Souls Tortilleria.

My vision is to build Taco Gordo into a Burlington institution. To bring warmth in the winter and fun in the summer. For years from now, for the smells and sounds of the space to remind people of childhood, of their college years, of time spent with friends.

It's a huge project. We're renovating and fitting the space up from nothing. I'm looking to raise $20,000 to help with fit-up of the space, start-up costs, and to buy equipment. Any level of support is appreciated. We've come up with some awesome incentives for those willing to donate, please check them out. And if you can't help with a donation, please consider sharing this campaign and spreading the word.

I love you all, and am endlessly grateful for all the support you've shown us to this point. Can't wait to see you at the new spot in September.

-Charlie
