story:
Metta is formulated to boost your body’s natural ability to adapt to stress. Drink it anytime to improve performance, reduce fatigue, and feel great. 

Metta uses clinical dosages of adaptogenic herbs which are extensively studied, safe and effective.

 

 

 

#DrinkMetta

Like what you're seeing? Want to help us? Just 30 seconds of your time can make a huge difference. Hit the share button below and to tag a friend or co-worker who needs this!

 

We can't do this without you!

Why should I back it now?

  • Take advantage of our huge discount available on Indiegogo! Our retail price will become $3 USD per can once the Indiegogo campaign is completed on November 20, 2017.
  • Be among the first in the world to get the power of adaptogens on your side, improve performance without harsh caffeine and sugar crashes.

When is the best time to consume Metta?

  • Based on the formulation of the product, Metta should be taken before or during any stressor event. Don’t worry if your forget, you can drink Metta afterwards to improve recovery and feel great.

What’s in the formula?

  • Metta is centered around adaptogenic herbs. It also contains Vitamin B complex, astragalus root, and Taurine. Metta also uses sea salt to improve hydration.
  • We make sure we only use the most active and absorbable form of our ingredients, in clinically effective dosages. We test to ensure that what’s in the product is exactly what’s on our label.

What are adaptogens?

  • They are a unique category of plants growing in some of the harshest conditions on the planet. They help our bodies adapt to stress which in turn provide an astonishing range of health and performance benefits.

Where can I find additional studies on adaptogens?

  • https://examine.com/supplements/rhodiola-rosea/
  • https://examine.com/supplements/panax-ginseng/
  • https://examine.com/supplements/schisandra-chin...

Where is Metta manufactured?

  • Metta will be manufactured in the United States at a FDA approved production facility.

Is Metta FDA approved?

  • Yes, Metta is a dietary supplement, and is FDA compliant. This means that the ingredients used are considered safe within the FDA monograph system. Additionally, every step of Metta’s sourcing, testing, and manufacturing complies with the requirements set forth in the FDA regulations.

Is Metta available internationally?

  • Yes! Metta is currently available in Canada and United States. We have free shipping on all orders during the Indiegogo campaign.

How do I contact you if I have more questions?

  • Email hello@drinkmetta.com or message us on Facebook.

Can I purchase Metta in bulk?

  • Yes! Email wholesale@drinkmetta.com for more information.

We've spent a lot of time building relationships with experienced beverage companies to mitigate as many risks as possible. We know there will still be unexpected challenges along the way. We will always be transparent and inform our backers of potential hurdles.

We have built in extra time for the manufacturing process and are confident we will ship by the projected dates. We will always keep you informed if things take longer.

We are committed to delivering the best quality product. We have been meticulous in creating this product. Some of these steps included testing dozens of flavour combinations and extensively sampling to ensure the active ingredients give the effect we want. Our formula is approved for production in the United States and we will only make changes to our current formula to improve stability or to comply with regulations of other countries.

We have established relationships with experienced contract manufacturers to mitigate the risk of delays by ingredient suppliers and to ensure quality control is implemented to the highest level. We have communicated extensively with our co-packer and they fully understand our product, specifications and production timeline.

On behalf of the Metta crew, thank you for your support!

story:
Veg'n Out Cafe

I am Lucas deWindt. I am working with Derek Wytzka to open a Vegetarian and Vegan Cafe and Bakery in North East Ohio. We both have backgrounds in the food business and we would like our chance to open our own restaurant rather than work for another one.

We really want to open this cafe because, being both vegetarians, we don't have many options when dining out. We can choose from salads, meatless pasta/pizza, or sometimes a veggie burger. With the help of your donations, we will be able to open a place that ANYONE can eat at. We are not going to supply strange vegetarian options that no one will eat, but options that everyone can enjoy and that you would never expect to be vegetarian.

We ultimately want to succeed and open cafe's all around the country to offer such a varitey of healthy options to everyone. 

What We Need & What You Get

We can't start this business without your help! To get a running start on the Veg'n Out Cafe, we are looking to raise a minimum of $30,000. It may seem like a lot, but with this money we will be able to advance tremendously!

With your donations, we will acquire:

  • A building to open the cafe. 
  • Supplies including things such as ovens, refrigerators/freezers, baking/cooking equipment, mixers, kitchen utensils, tables, etc.
  • Advertisement: website, business cards, apparel, merchandise that will be rewarded, commercial space, billboard/sign space. 
  • As well as the acquistion of a staff.

We have quite a set of uniqe perks. You can get a perk with as little as just $1 or as much as $5,000+. Some of the perks include: Veg'n Out Cafe merchandise, thank-you notes and plaques, discount rates for every visit you make, and menu items named and created by YOU! 

If we unfortunately do not reach our goal, our hope is not gone. We will put the money received towards opening an at home/online vegan bakery. We will have a website filled with our menu and all you will have to do is order online and we will ship it directly to you... FRESHNESS GUARANTEED! If this is the case, the money will be put towards ingredients needs, shipping costs, and baking supplies: stand mixers, larger oven, proper decorating tools. 

How Even a Dollar From You Can Change Our Tomorrow

Veg'n Out Cafe will be a valuable investment to everyone who takes part in it. In today's society, fast food chains rule the food world. They serve unhealthy, greasy, and sometimes underprepared food that doesn't satisfy our nutritional needs. Fast food makes it easier to eat because it is much cheaper than buying healthy organic foods, but with Veg'n Out Cafe, everything will be much healthier than fried foods, and best of all, the prices will mirror the cheap foods rather than the expensive items at a grocery store. 

Not only will our food be for vegetarians and vegans, but our food will appeal to everyone who enjoys healthier eating without breaking the bank. I am probably one of the biggest offenders of purchasing fast food rather than healthy food due to economic issues. In today's economy, we all struggle with money and food is a neccesity. So we want to open a cafe where the prices are the same as McDonald's or Wendy's, but offer those healthier options that we are all missing out on. 

We will supply you a healthy and relaxing enviroment fit for anyone's hectic lifestyle. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Most of you may not be able to donate, but that's alright! We have other ways you can help us out...

  • We ask you to make some noise and spread the word and mission of Veg'n Out Cafe to everyone you know!
  • You can like us on Facebook, tweet us on Twitter, email us, and repin us on Pinterest!

Our social media names are as follows:

  • Twitter: @vegnoutcafe
  • Facebook: Veg'n Out Cafe
  • Email: vegnoutcafe@gmail.com
  • Pinterest: vegnoutcafe

story:
How the Winds Shifted and became a brewery…

Tony said, “I have an idea!”.

Lynn rolled her eyes again and said, “Okay, this is just crazy enough that it might work…”

Paul said, “You can use that space up front if you want.”

Tammy said, “As long as you don’t blow the place up.”

Danny said, “Here, hold my beer.”

Tim said, “I’m here to help. What do you need?”

Chaelyn said, “I have the best mom in the whole world!”

Ryan said, “I wanna’ be your sledgehammer!”

Chelsey said, “Let’s push this rock uphill!”

Andy said, “I can do that!”

Charlotte said, “I love you!”

Larry said, “No, you have to do it this way. Try not to be a dummy!”

Jason said, “My wife doesn’t know I’m here.”

Joe said, “This might give me a heart attack, but whatevs dude.”

Brian S said, “It’s going to have that ‘wow’ factor.”

Kim said, “Oh but that Baltic Porter!”

Nigel said, “Oh Hell Yeah!”

Kurtis said, “I watch a lot of HGTV.”

Brad said, "You keep talking, but I read somewhere that this is how it works."

Brian W said, “Who puts five foot of insulation in the ceiling? Change Order.”

Rex said, “Just Watch me!”

Jake said, “I always like to leave something behind.”

Billy said, “As long as it’s not sideways, it’ll probably work.”

Hillary said, “This is going to be great!”

Nick said, “You have it upside-down!”

Taylor said, "My first job was laying drywall. Somebody say Cue?"

And they all said “Tony makes really great beer! We can't wait until you're open!”

Tony and Lynn say, “We are so blessed with amazing friends in our life who have volunteered their valuable time to help us get this far. There are no words to thank any of you enough for all you've done.”

And this is how Wind Shift Brewing happened. The rest of the story is up to you. 

What We Hope To Be Able To Do With The Funds

There is every indication that the brewery will open on time. We experienced a few cost overruns and have special projects, like outdoor seating, that we would like to get started on.  Our plan was to tackle these projects in late

summer, but with your help we can keep going.

Risks & Challenges

Opening a brewery comes with risks, but we've cleared our biggest hurdles. We have our federal and Missouri permits, a commercial location, our equipment, and preliminary inspections complete. The build out is 90% complete. At this point, just a few odds and ends stand between us being able to open the taproom. These include:
-Final health inspection 
 -Certificate of occupancy 
 
We don't foresee any issues with these last few items, and look forward to hosting you in our taproom!

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it, sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us. Tell your friends, neighbors and share this campaign on social media. We'll have something for you when you come visit us in the taproom.

Chelsey said, “Let’s push this rock uphill!”
Andy said, “I can do that!”
Charlotte said, “I love you!”
Larry said, “No, you have to do it this way. Try not to be a dummy!”
Jason said, “My wife doesn’t know I’m here.”
Joe said, “This might give me a heart attack, but whatevs dude.”
Brian S said, “It’s going to have that ‘wow’ factor.”
Kim said, “Oh but that Baltic Porter!”
Nigel said, “Oh Hell Yeah!”
Kurtis said, “I watch a lot of HGTV.”
Brad said, "You keep talking, but I read somewhere that this is how it works."
Brian W said, “Who puts five foot of insulation in the ceiling? Change Order.”
Rex said, “Just Watch me!”
Jake said, “I always like to leave something behind.”
Billy said, “As long as it’s not sideways, it’ll probably work.”
Hillary said, “This is going to be great!”
Nick said, “You have it upside-down!”
Taylor said, "My first job was laying drywall. Somebody say Cue?"
And they all said “Tony makes really great beer! We can't wait until you're open!”
Tony and Lynn say, “We are so blessed with amazing friends in our life who have volunteered their valuable time to help us get this far. There are no words to thank any of you enough for all you've done.”
And this is how Wind Shift Brewing happened. The rest of the story is up to you. 

What We Hope To Be Able To Do With The Funds
There is every indication that the brewery will open on time. We experienced a few cost overruns and have special projects, like outdoor seating, that we would like to get started on.  Our plan was to tackle these projects in late
summer, but with your help we can keep going.
Risks & ChallengesOpening a brewery comes with risks, but we've cleared our biggest hurdles. We have our federal and Missouri permits, a commercial location, our equipment, and preliminary inspections complete. The build out is 90% complete. At this point, just a few odds and ends stand between us being able to open the taproom. These include:-Final health inspection  -Certificate of occupancy  We don't foresee any issues with these last few items, and look forward to hosting you in our taproom!
Other Ways You Can Help
We get it, sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help us. Tell your friends, neighbors and share this campaign on social media. We'll have something for you when you come visit us in the taproom.

story:
KLCuisine is proud to announce that our 2 flavors of Iced Tea, Ginger and Hibiscus will soon be on the market. They are not only refreshing with freshly brewed tea leaves, they also have many health benefits because of being full of nutrition. In many cultures, both ginger and hibiscus tea is known to be home remedy for various health issues. 

Health Benefits from Ginger Iced Tea:

  • Ginger does not only treat indigestion with its powerful nutrition but it also helps to sooth nausea, eliminates vomiting, and also relives gas as well as heartburn
  • Ginger improves cognitive function and also, the ingredients are excellent at soothing nerves and improving mood
  • The natural anti-inflammatory nature of ginger not only reduces irritation, swelling, and inflammation in the body
  • Ginger helps to prevent dangerous spikes and drops in blood sugar that can lead to diabetes
  • High vitamin A and C in ginger improves hair growth as well as reduce dandruff
  • Ginger is also known to stimulate metabolism and help lose weight by satiating feeling of hunger.
  • Ginger tea is also known for reliving tension and lowering stress while make you feel happy
  • In Indian culture, Ginger tea is used as home remedy for sickness such as cold and flu
  • Ginger also helps to prevent cancer and Alzheimer’s disease
  • Ginger tea is great for sinuses relief

 

Health benefits form Hibiscus Iced Tea:

  • Hibiscus tea is known for lowering High Blood Pressure as well as Cholesterol
  • Hibiscus tea is full of nutrition that protects liver and it is also known as anti-cancer
  • Hibiscus tea has fatty acid, omega-3 and omega 6 as well as dietary fiber, protein, and vitamin B2.
  • It plays a vital role for calming the nervous system and helps to relieve the symptom of Anxiety and Depression
  • Hibiscus tea also helps to boost immune system and improve digestion.
  • The anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties in hibiscus tea such as vitamin C and vitamin A can effectively treat acne, scars, sunburns, eczema, and skin allergies.
  • Hibiscus tea is low in calorie and helps to lose weight as well.

 

Research on the benefits of Ginger and Hibiscus Tea

story:
Saucy Newfoundland Co.

Saucy - Sau.cy (adj) - Bold and Brazen 

We are proud and saucy Newfoundlanders.  We love to eat and entertain.   Our team consists of:

Crystal McCall - Chief Sassy Sauce Chef - Knows good food when she sees it.  Crystal has an M.Sc from University of Guelph and has 7 years of agricultural experience.  Crystal comes from a long family history of cooking and her desire to cook has brought her to the Saucy Newfoundland Company.

Julia Allingham (Genge) - Food Fanatic.  Julia has a M.ed, from Memorial University of Newfoundland and has done intense study of the health benefits of natural ingredients that has taken her to the far corners of the world.

Brad Small - Gets the food to your kitchen. Brad has been a carpenter for the last 10 years, has a passion for fine food.  

Mark Tierney - Sauce Spreader.  Mark has a MBA from the University of Leicester and is passionate about cooking.  Always whipping up new sauces for go on his moose, salmon, or salad. Fifteen years of business development experience and full of sass.

Our Products

Our crafted small batch sauces are home grown and locally created by four Newfoundlanders. Inspired by local products and global flavours, our sauces are as bold and brazen as any Newfoundlander.  These products will challenge your tastebuds and your perception of Newfoundland food.

NL Partridgeberry BBQ Sauce - Every saucy Newfoundlander loves partridgeberries.  A perfect balance of tartness and sweetness.  BBQ with it today!

NL Screeching Hot Sauce - So screechin hot!  Made from NL rum and smokey chipotle peppers. Add it to your eggs, chilli, fish or Mexican dish.

NL Crowberry Balsamic - A perfect marriage of sweet Newfoundland crowberries and tart balsamic.   Perfect on goat cheese salads or dipping breads. 

NL Blueberry Honey Spread - Earthy and sweet. You can bake it with brie or use it to saucy up your pancakes! 

NL Lassie Ketchup - A sassy lassie ketchup, sure to make your burger broil!

NL Pickled Mustard Sauce - All Newfoundlanders know about the great mustard pickle tragedy of 2016.  We have a sweet sassy pickle sauce  to put on your steamy sausages.  This is a limited edition, unlimited supply. 

We love food and we think Newfoundland has an unfair bland food reputation.  Yes our forefathers loved to boil and salt food to "bejeezus" but that's because they didn't have our sassy sauce.

What We Need & What You Get

We need you to support our team.

  • You can buy a perk.
  • Like us on Facebook
  • Retweet on Twitter
  • Share our Instagram Page, and
  • Promote our Indiegogo page.

story:
Cloud Forest Coffee Farms is an Alliance of Eco-farms in Biodiverse Northwest Ecuador, Reforesting and Restoring Land for Shade Coffee Production

Our story has many interwoven threads:

  • Coffee cultivation in the shade of restored agro-forestry systems
  • Premium coffee processing on our farms, to enjoy and for export to US and European   partners
  • Ecosystem restoration of land that was cleared for cattle ranching, returning it to a  biodiverse, productive state
  • Creation of an eco-tourism destination on our restored lands, our nature reserves, and our farms
  • Creating a sustainable economy in a biodiverse and threatened landscape

 

Help us fund the construction of the biodigestor at our new wet-mill

It´s not so obvious, but for every pound of exportable coffee at least five pounds of coffee fruit "cherries" are picked. The resulting, left-over fruit skin and pulp can be a real mess, but if well managed can be the raw material for soil amendments and useful bio-gas for the farm. By running our pulp through a biodigestor we will lower methane and CO2 emissions and also lower the need for off-farm soil inputs. Depulping, fermenting, washing and drying coffee can be as simple or complex as the farm size and budgets allow. It´s all about correctly removing the fruit parts of the coffee cherry and coming out on the other side with correctly dried fruit stones, pits or in the case of coffee lingo in English, "beans." 

By participating you can try our latest harvest which is already in the USA and on its way to Europe

Thanks to our friendship with Tiny Footprint Coffee in the US and Aekvator Kaffe in Denmark, we can send you fresh roasted coffee from our latest harvest, t-shirts and other fun perks. Visit the roastery, learn to cup coffee like a pro!

 

The construction of our new wet-mill is almost funded and the $1500 we are seeking here will put us over the top! 

We offer a gamut of cool perks for you to enjoy and feel part of the team. As our coffee is roasted and delivered by Tiny Footprint Coffee in the US, your participation will also help fund the reforestation efforts of Mindo Cloudforest Foundation, mitigating emissions above and beyond those produced in the growing, roasting and shipping of your coffee. Shrink your own carbon footprint in a tasty way!

This new project builds on our past efforts and success at the nearby Tambo Quinde nature reserve and keeps us growing so that we can involve yet more growers and forest protectors in our network of alliances. 

Our perks feature coffee from Tambo Quinde, where the "before" pictures come from, a successful agro-forestry model.

 

Feel free to share

Indiegogo makes sharing easy, so please go ahead and use their social media tools to help get the word out!

story:
ABOUT US:
The Apothecary Bitters Company is a small batch cocktail bitters company in Vancouver, BC and has remained one of the top selling brands in Canada over our 5+ years of operation. Our products are also sold in the US and Australia. Over the course of our time running we’ve received a generous amount of press coverage as well as several accolades and awards.

Our unique and complex bitters, formulated to enhance spirits and cocktails, are handmade using only the finest natural botanicals.

We believe that bitters should be a complex blend of flavors and aromas, not one dimensional or single flavored, to add layers of depth and flavor to your cocktails, sodas and cooking. As such, our bitters are currently used at top bars across Canada and at select bars in the US and abroad. 

Our founder and head bitters maker, Cole Benoit, is also a beverage industry consultant. He works closely with the award winning distillery, Long Table Distillery, on their cocktail program and products, such as BC's first (and gold winning) amaro, an orange curacao, an absinthe (in which he grew most of the botanicals), a unique rum (still aging) and more.
He is also an educator and tour guide, having taught seminars across Canada in a variety of settings on topics such as bitters, cocktails, spirits and using botanicals.
 

CAMPAIGN INFORMATION:
With this campaign we plan to release up to five limited edition bitters flavors that will only be available through the IndieGoGo campaign.

We are constantly creating new flavors and have come up with some we absolutely love and want to share with the world, however we also feel that a brand can extend their product line too much, which can cause stress on retailers and overwhelm consumers, therefore we wanted to do an IndieGoGo campaign to make these flavors available to bartenders and consumers, both new and existing, without complicating our current retail line up and distribution.

We’re offering three initial flavors with this campaign with two unlockable stretch goal flavors. The initial flavors are: Solar Flare - Herbal Kola bitters, Bird of Paradise - Tropical Tiki bitters and Forgotten Trails - Winter Forest bitters.

The first stretch goal flavor, Winds of the Mojave - Desert Sage bitters, will be available at $2500 and the second, Pythia’s Temple - Savory Garden bitters, will be available at $3500.

By purchasing through this IndieGoGo campaign you will have access to limited edition bitters not available for retail sale anywhere! They will be exclusive to our IndieGoGo supporters.

 

WHAT WE NEED:
The minimum funding we require will allow us to purchase the materials and ingredients needed to produce the limited bitters lineup.

Most of the ingredients used in these limited bitters flavors aren’t used in our core flavors, therefore we need funds to purchase all of these special ingredients. Due to the small scale production of these bitters, the cost of materials (such as labels) goes up and increases the cost of each bottle.

Any excess funds will go towards re-investing in The Apothecary Bitters Company to help with equipment upgrades, educational seminars for consumers, promotional materials, infrastructure and all of the other expenses involved in maintaining and growing a small business.

 

THE PERKS:

The perks here are of course the limited edition bitters flavors you will receive! Exclusive to this IndieGoGo campaign, you’ll be purchasing unique and delicious bitters that will not be available again.

As well, the first 20 people to purchase the 5 bottle tier will receive a 1 oz bottle of super unique mystery bitters, also exclusive to the campaign.

Our last tier will allow 10 people to receive all 5 flavors PLUS 3 bottles of a completely custom* flavor of their choosing that we will design and produce just for them! 
*(Restrictions apply on the cost/availability of ingredients and the theme of the flavor.)

The exclusive bitters being offered are:

Bird of Paradise - Tropical Tiki Bitters

“A bright blend of tropical fruits form the body of these bitters with notes of baking spices and rich wood on the palate while a citrusy bitterness and floral tannins creep up in the finish.”
Tasting notes: Pineapple, Ginger, Guava, Baking Spices, Citrus, Hibiscus.

Forgotten Trails - Winter Forest Bitters

‘A rich and complex blend of barks, leaves and woods, these bitters evoke the crisp smell of a winter forest with clean botanical flavors, woodsy tannins, earthy bitterness and a wisp of smoke, moss and dried fruit in the finish.”
Tasting notes: Woodsy, Dried Fruits, Cedar, Vanilla, Birch, Smoke, Fresh Leaves.

Solar Flare - Herbal Kola Bitters

“These bitters celebrate the unique flavor of the kola nut, encircling it in complex layers of citrus and tea-like notes, whilst tannic botanicals and bitter barks linger in the finish.”
Tasting notes: Kola nut, Citrus, Cinnamon, Sarsaparilla, Canela, Eucalyptus, Birch.

Stretch Goal 1 - $2500

Winds of the Mojave - Desert Sage Bitters

“Evoking the desert in a rare bloom, rich in scent, these bitters feature notes of sage, grapefruit and desert flowers on the palate, while a mineral bitterness and desert botanicals loom largely in the finish.”
Tasting notes: Sage, Damiana, Grapefruit, Eucalyptus, Sweet Florals, Mineral, Smoke.

Stretch Goal 2 - $3500

Pythia’s Temple - Savory Garden Bitters
“As if wandering through a summer garden, the palate on these bitters surprises with flavors of earthy roots, culinary herbs, and bright vegetal notes, while the finish lingers with peppery citrus, savory plants and a hint of fresh flowers.”
Tasting Notes: Root Vegetables, Bay Laurel, Cucumber, Pepper, Wormwood, Herbs, Florals.
 

WHY WE CAN MAKE THIS WORK:
As mentioned, we’ve been successfully producing cocktail bitters on a commercial scale for over 5 years now, with cross Canada distribution and self distribution in the US and Australia. We understand the intricacies of bitters production, manufacturing and packaging.

We also have been working with bars and bartenders over that entire time, with excellent feedback, ensuring that these bitters will work amazingly in either a home or professional bar setting. 

Also, we initially launched The Apothecary Bitters Company with a Kickstarter campaign so we’ve done this before in terms of managing the campaign, fulfilling rewards and all of the logistics involved with production and especially shipping.
 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
We’ve already extensively tested these flavors over the past few years and are confident in their flavor profiles and usability in cocktails, cooking and more.

Since these flavors are merely an extension of our current production methods, there is very little in the way of risk for those donating to the campaign. We’ve been producing bitters successfully on a commercial level for over 5 years now and having done a number of seasonal flavors over the years, we also understand the intricacies of scaling up bitters recipes for commercial production.

As well, because we did a Kickstarter for our initial conception almost 6 years ago we have experience with the logistics, shipping/delivery and reward fulfillment involved in a fundraising campaign.

Procuring materials and ingredients in a timely manner can always be a challenging aspect of an operation like ours but we’re confident in our relationships with our suppliers and that we can produce these bitters on schedule.
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Not everybody can afford to purchase bitters or donate, nor is everyone interested in purchasing bitters for themselves, but we’re sure you know someone who might like to try our unique and delicious limited edition flavors, so please help us share this campaign, be it on social media or in person!

You can find us at www.apothecarybitters.com or on Facebook (The Apothecary Bitters Company) or on Instagram (@apothecarybitters).

You can also use the IndieGoGo sharing tools to help spread the word as well.

We truly appreciate any and all of your support - it means the world to us!

‘A rich and complex blend of barks, leaves and woods, these bitters evoke the crisp smell of a winter forest with clean botanical flavors, woodsy tannins, earthy bitterness and a wisp of smoke, moss and dried fruit in the finish.”Tasting notes: Woodsy, Dried Fruits, Cedar, Vanilla, Birch, Smoke, Fresh Leaves.

Solar Flare - Herbal Kola Bitters
“These bitters celebrate the unique flavor of the kola nut, encircling it in complex layers of citrus and tea-like notes, whilst tannic botanicals and bitter barks linger in the finish.”Tasting notes: Kola nut, Citrus, Cinnamon, Sarsaparilla, Canela, Eucalyptus, Birch.

Stretch Goal 1 - $2500
Winds of the Mojave - Desert Sage Bitters
“Evoking the desert in a rare bloom, rich in scent, these bitters feature notes of sage, grapefruit and desert flowers on the palate, while a mineral bitterness and desert botanicals loom largely in the finish.”Tasting notes: Sage, Damiana, Grapefruit, Eucalyptus, Sweet Florals, Mineral, Smoke.

Stretch Goal 2 - $3500
Pythia’s Temple - Savory Garden Bitters“As if wandering through a summer garden, the palate on these bitters surprises with flavors of earthy roots, culinary herbs, and bright vegetal notes, while the finish lingers with peppery citrus, savory plants and a hint of fresh flowers.”Tasting Notes: Root Vegetables, Bay Laurel, Cucumber, Pepper, Wormwood, Herbs, Florals. 
WHY WE CAN MAKE THIS WORK:As mentioned, we’ve been successfully producing cocktail bitters on a commercial scale for over 5 years now, with cross Canada distribution and self distribution in the US and Australia. We understand the intricacies of bitters production, manufacturing and packaging.We also have been working with bars and bartenders over that entire time, with excellent feedback, ensuring that these bitters will work amazingly in either a home or professional bar setting. 
Also, we initially launched The Apothecary Bitters Company with a Kickstarter campaign so we’ve done this before in terms of managing the campaign, fulfilling rewards and all of the logistics involved with production and especially shipping. 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES:We’ve already extensively tested these flavors over the past few years and are confident in their flavor profiles and usability in cocktails, cooking and more.Since these flavors are merely an extension of our current production methods, there is very little in the way of risk for those donating to the campaign. We’ve been producing bitters successfully on a commercial level for over 5 years now and having done a number of seasonal flavors over the years, we also understand the intricacies of scaling up bitters recipes for commercial production.As well, because we did a Kickstarter for our initial conception almost 6 years ago we have experience with the logistics, shipping/delivery and reward fulfillment involved in a fundraising campaign.
Procuring materials and ingredients in a timely manner can always be a challenging aspect of an operation like ours but we’re confident in our relationships with our suppliers and that we can produce these bitters on schedule. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:Not everybody can afford to purchase bitters or donate, nor is everyone interested in purchasing bitters for themselves, but we’re sure you know someone who might like to try our unique and delicious limited edition flavors, so please help us share this campaign, be it on social media or in person!You can find us at www.apothecarybitters.com or on Facebook (The Apothecary Bitters Company) or on Instagram (@apothecarybitters).
You can also use the IndieGoGo sharing tools to help spread the word as well.
We truly appreciate any and all of your support - it means the world to us!

story:
​

Valser begins high up in the 220 million year old Swiss Alps as rain, snow, and ice.

The Piz Aul mountain rises 10,000 feet over the outskirts of the Vals village – population 1,000.

For up to 200 years, the water flows over the unique dolomite rock in the mountain which infuses Valser with a high level of mineralization and low sodium.

Bottled directly at the source at a small bottling plant constructed on the slopes of the mountain. Never bulk transported.

Official water of the 5-Star Swiss Deluxe Hotels.

  • In partnership with Climeworks, our carbonation technology uses recycled CO2 from the air to help carbonate Valser Classic (beginning August 2018)

  • We are Switzerland’s first CO2-neutral water

  • With every 1L purchase of Valser Still in Switzerland, we donate 3L of drinking water to a child in need in Nepal in partnership with Helvetas.

FAQs

  • How do I contact you with more questions? Please reach out to us at george@valserusa.com

  • Where can I read more about Vals? For now, you can visit www.valser.com. This is the current website maintained by Coca-Cola Switzerland.

Never bulk transported.Official water of the 5-Star Swiss Deluxe Hotels.
In partnership with Climeworks, our carbonation technology uses recycled CO2 from the air to help carbonate Valser Classic (beginning August 2018)
We are Switzerland’s first CO2-neutral water
With every 1L purchase of Valser Still in Switzerland, we donate 3L of drinking water to a child in need in Nepal in partnership with Helvetas.
FAQs
How do I contact you with more questions? Please reach out to us at george@valserusa.com

Where can I read more about Vals? For now, you can visit www.valser.com. This is the current website maintained by Coca-Cola Switzerland.

story:
SteepShot (pat.pend.) is a manual brewing device for coffee. With minimalism and practicality at the forefront, SteepShot gives you an excellent cup of coffee fast wherever you need it. 

SteepShot is: 

  • User friendly 
  • Easy to clean 
  • Portable 
  • Manual 
  • Fast 
  • Consistent 
  • Durable 
  • Dishwasher safe

 

SteepShot is a great experimentation tool. You can play around with grind size, brewing time, how much water you use, different filters, how much coffee you use and agitation.

To get you started, here’s the recipe we use:

  • Metal filter (included)
  • 14 g. Coffee, finely ground   
  • 2 dl. (max level) Boiling water
  • 30 seconds brewing time 

This is the recipe we swear by, but it all boils down to personal taste. Whether you like your coffee stronger or milder or perhaps you prefer the mouthfeel a paper filter gives you? (All types of Aeropress-size filters fit SteepShot). You might like the body and depth of a longer brewing time, or the clarity of a shorter one. With SteepShot, it’s up to you.Our friend Tim has kindly offered to further explain how to use the SteepShot in this video.

The important thing to remember when brewing with SteepShot is that the water needs to be hot; at least 90 degrees Celsius. Without steam, there’s no pressure, which means no shooting.

Here’s a video of Tim cleaning the SteepShot and doing a rinsing cycle with only hot water. Note that the SteepShot is dishwasher-safe. Also note that we recommend pouring through a sieve and dump grinds in the trash/compost.

Standard metal plate filter (comes with SteepShot):
· Drains fast, which gives you better control over the brewing time 
· Lets oils and some sediment pass through 
· Durable and easy to clean

SteepShot metal mesh filter: 
· All benefits as metal plate filters 
· Ari’s personal favorite in regards of taste. 
· Drains a little slower with finer grind settings. 
· Less sediment than the metal plate filter. 
· Durable and easy to clean.

More about SteepShot technical details/brewing can be found here (scroll down).

In everyday use with the standard metal filter, there are two parts to handle with SteepShot: the cup and the lid. If you wish to swap out the filter or give SteepShot a more thorough clean, you can simply dismantle the lid as shown above.

 

We know what you’re thinking. “This thing is too good to be true!” 

 Here’s what our world-class-barista-friends say about the quality of “SteepShotted” coffee.

 

Ari Halonen is the inventor of SteepShot. The idea came to him while he was doing the dishes one Autumn day in 2015. He assembled a prototype and realised its potential when he found his wife brewing with it one morning. She has been known to keep a safe distance to Ari’s brewing gear, which she calls “lab equipment”.

He brought the prototype to Tim Wendelboe, who’s coffee house was right around the corner from his home at the time, and with Tim’s stamp of approval, Ari had the confidence to move forward with further development of SteepShot.

Today, we have nine fully functioning prototypes, the oldest of which is still going strong after over 6000 servings. With this crowdfunding campaign, Ari’s vision of making coffee brewing simple and easy for everyone is becoming a reality.

story:
Mimi Grace: Coffee/Tea/Clean Eats

Mimi Grace: Coffee/Tea/Clean Eats is a local Redding, CA business opening a shop in August 2017 featuring specialty drinks and farm to table style eats from local sources whenever possible. 

  • Mimi Grace started at the Redding Farmer's Market two years ago with specialty coffees and gluten free waffles. While creating community through good food and drink has always been in our vision; getting to know the local farming community expanded our vision to see how opening a shop could support and grow the local economy. By showcasing how delicious local ingredients are and sourcing from local artisans, Mimi Grace is not just a coffee shop, but a catalyst for local economy and other aspiring entrepreneurs. 
  • Having chosen a location and gotten permits from the city, we are now in the midst of completing renovations. During this process we are choosing to create a space that is done well and serves with excellence. As the opening date approaches, we want to invite you to be a part of creating this space and making it possible. 
  • Redding is special in that it is the largest town in northern CA and is right off the I5 corridor. We consistently have a large number of visitors in our city from all over the world. However there seems to be a gap in the farm to table, healthy cafe options in our city. By contributing to the opening of Mimi Grace, you are helping to create a place that not only supports our local farmers but also where you can enjoy healthy real food and tasty beverages. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need equipment, final construction, and furniture:

  • We have (thankfully) gotten this far with this project without going into debt. We need approximately $25,000 more to get all our equipment, finish with some final construction costs, and our furniture.
  • Our perks are very simple, a thank you and/or a gift certificate to the shop when we open up, and a private party event. 
  • The final funds are going towards mostly refrigeration, cooking/baking equipment, and our coffee equipment. The remaining amount will go towards some final construction costs (approximately $3,000), and getting some furniture so we can host the city of Redding well. 

Risks & Challenges

Health and excellence is a growing value in our city. The risk would be that people don't see the value of investing in real, organic, local whole foods. We are greatly encouraged by the feedback we have received from our local community which fuels our hope and desire to open up shop and serve our city.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everybody is able to contribute financially, so here is other ways to help us on this journey:

  • Share the campaign with your friends and family by word of mouth and social media. 
  • Send us an encouraging email or social media message (some days we really need those)
  • Tell people about our shop opening up, we want to start well in this journey of serving our city. 

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you!!!

story:
Welcome to Dynheer!  

Founded by Kerel Fryar, Dynheer is a social dining platform that connects passionate food entrepreneurs with customers who have limited time to cook and/or prefer the convenience of nutritious, home-cooked meals. Dynheer allows our customers to hire in-home personal chefs or dine-out in the home of a host chef. No waiting in lines. No subscriptions. No dirty pots and pans. Dynheer enables customers to simply enjoy authentic, fresh meals, and it allows host chefs to connect with those who seek a unique dining experience—something beyond what they can expect in a restaurant.

Dynheer aims to become an iconic, meal-centric marketplace—a space where customers; passionate amateur cooks; new chefs; experienced chefs and grocery retailers can connect.

Our startup was recently inducted into the 2018 Startup Grind Class. Consideration included more than 6,000 applicants, from which Dynheer and 130 companies across 80 countries were handpicked for Startup Grind’s Global Conference. Startup Grind is the world’s largest independent startup community, actively educating, inspiring, and connecting 1,000,000 founders in over 250 cities.

In the past four months, we have focused on fine-tuning the Dynheer platform, validating our market base and testing the market response to our business model. We have centered our efforts on building an intuitive design that will resonate with our end users and ensure a remarkable experience for all. We need your help to sustain our growth and bring our unique experiences to more dining tables around the United States! Funds will be allocated towards our platform development cost, web development costs and launching our sales & marketing team cross country to grow our user base.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to support our team while we continue to grow the platform. We need to raise $30,000, which will help us with technology development, marketing, sales, and business administration tasks.

Your support will help us move quickly to hit major milestones for our official launch. We are truly hoping you will rally behind Dynheer and help us achieve our social business. We are generating jobs, helping food entrepreneurs build their brands, giving precious time back to customers, and connecting communities. Furthermore, we are providing proceeds of our revenue to help those in need.

We have a range of products we are offering for donations. All of the products are sourced from social good companies that have a mission to help others and support wellbeing. Also, a portion of each donation will help support our “Give A Meal” pledge. Select the donation that's right for you and declare yourself a Friend of Dynheer and support Dynheer's ultimate goal of connecting people over the power of a meal!  

 

The Impact

Dynheer pledges to give back by launching a program:" Give A Meal.”  A portion of the profit from every plate served via Dynheer will be donated to provide a meal to a domestic hunger-relief organization, working to connect people with food and end hunger.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our number one risk is competition in the marketplace. We are not the first company to strive for unique dining experiences, and we will not be the last. What differentiates Dyhneer is its human-centric designed approach, which ensures we value our customers as true partners. Our biggest challenge is our acceleration of growth. We have the ideas and an innovative platform.  Now we need that extra boost to allow us to scale the company nationally! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Still unsure? Become a Dynheer Host or Customer! Check-out Dynheer.com to learn more and see what's new! Be sure to follow us Instagram @Dynheer, Facebook @ DynheerUSA, Twitter @ DYNHEER_USA for continued updates. We sure hope you join our community!

 

THANK YOU!

story:
You love coffee and you love coffee from your French press even more. The exquisite aroma and vision of the coffee oils floating to the top makes coffee aficionados the world over prefer to press and pour.

Nevertheless, many coffee drinkers have set their French press aside to avoid the mess that comes with cleaning. It consumes more time, smudges your sink, clogs your drain and requires a lot of tap water or kitchen paper to clean up the presses' messes.

With your support, we can solve the problem once and forever. 
We’re giving you back your French press pleasure without any of the pain.

 

 

Say hello to GRUMS - a brilliantly simple “cup” that collects your grounds for easy disposal while keeping your carafe clean. We’re developing the ideal receptacle for your grounds that automatically fastens to the plunger when you pull it from the carafe to empty and clean it. GRUMS saves you time, effort, water, and eliminates clogging of your drain. Just shake your grounds out from the cup to your trash bin or save the grounds for a variety of helpful uses (more on that later).

 

You’ve just made a nice cup of coffee from your French press, and now your carafe is filled with coffee grounds. Time for clean up! The coffee grounds are thrown into the sink and now you rinse the carafe and the sink with lots of water. Wasteful and messy! 

With GRUMS, you simply add your fresh coffee grounds into the GRUMS cup, set it inside the carafe, fill with water, and press down the plunger.

Now comes the magic.

After you’ve enjoyed your delicious cup of coffee, gently push the plunger in the GRUMS cup and let friction work for you to effortlessly pull out the grounds – compacted nice and tidy inside the GRUMS cup. After lifting the cup out, all the grounds can be thrown into the trashcan, or set aside for other meaningful uses.  

 

We set out to create something so smart, simple and easy, French press coffee lovers wouldn’t think twice about purchasing one.

With GRUMS, you get the taste you want without the mess you don’t. Just fill up GRUMS with your favorite coffee until you reach one of the markings of your liking. Place the cup into the French press, pour your hot water, press, and then enjoy a nice cup of coffee. Afterwards, the plunger is automatically fastened to the cup, which easily can now be removed to throw out the grounds or even keep it for later purposes – How simple is that?

 

In Denmark, where GRUMS is being developed, we are passionate about conserving resources to benefit people and our planet. Much of our inspiration for GRUMS is a result of not wanting to waste water. On average, it takes about 4-liters (more than a gallon) to clean your carafe and sink – even more if your drain clogs.

Lets say we put it conservatively at 2 liters minimum to clean you carafe after use. Taking into account the number of French presses sold up to now, and the average use (1-2 times a week), we get to a stunning water consumption of 104.000.000 cubic meters (27,473,893,445 gal) pr. year. That’s enough to fill about 7 million tanker trucks. The length of all these trucks combined equals to more than two times the circumference of the Earth.

Let us remind our selves that only 1% of the world’s water is fresh water, and this water needs to be made drinkable before it comes out of our taps. The energy required to make water drinkable is substantial. By using water to clean a carafe with coffee grounds, we’re wasting the world’s precious supplies of water.

USING GRUMS can save 100,000 tons of CO2.
This is the energy it approximately takes to collect, pump, distribute and again drain off all this water. According to the Danish Danva water association it takes about 1 kg CO2 per 1000 liters. So we use not only a lot of water but also 100,000 tons of CO2 to deal with it. Lets save this too.

 

GRUMS is not made for any specific French Press brand, but for the standard 1-liter jar that is most commonly used. GRUMS will fit right into what we believe is more than 95% of French press carafes being sold today and at least all the major brands.

If you're concerned about fit, take a measure at home before you pledge.
The outer dimension of GRUMS is 90 mm (3.5-inches), so your carafe should be a little larger than that.

 

Save the grounds and re-use them – Coffee grounds can be used for more than 20 different purposes including surprising things, like fungus and soap making.

Brewing coffee is actually using a small percentage of the nutritional value inside the bean; so don’t throw your grounds in the trashcan.
Coffee grounds contain rich amounts of nitrogen and function as a perfect natural fertilizer for your plants. By adding organic material to the soil, you will improve drainage, water retention and aeration.

You can also use it to absorb food odor. Simply place your coffee grounds in an open container and leave it inside your refrigerator. After a few weeks, you can still use the same coffee grounds as fertilizer. 

It also makes a great exfoliating body scrub. Mix your coffee grounds with a bit of warm water and you’re ready to exfoliate your skin.

In case you want to read more about how to use your coffee grounds click on the buzzfeed below:

 

Not only have we designed GRUMS for the perfect french press experience, but we've also made an easy solution to save your grounds. 

It's simple to use. Slide the lid to the side, knock the grounds into the container and close the lid again, done. 

 

 

We’ve made it easy for you to make French press coffee. We’ve designed markings inside of the cup, so you can easily fill it with the right amount of coffee for you. The markings make it more consistent than spoon measuring.

When it’s time to clean your carafe, you’ll see why GRUMS is the one French press accessory you never want to be without. Because all the grounds remain nice and tidy inside the cup, there’s less grounds residue to clean up in the carafe and in your sink. Just knock the grounds out in your bin. Imagine how much water you’ll save, and how much easier it is to enjoy another cup. 

Get ready in seconds and get ready again. It’s Friday night and you’re having a dinner party with all your best friends. Normally you would choose the coffeemaker because you need to make multiple pots, but to be true to yourself, you prefer the French press way. With GRUMS, you can clean the used carafe quickly and have it loaded again and ready to go.

Imagine the compliments you’ll get serving your guests delicious and aromatic French press coffee.

 

 

 

This is how it normally looks. Ah, the drain pain! Cleaning a carafe will fill your sink and takes a lot of water to re-clean.

  - and clog your drain, heavily!​

 

Although the idea of GRUMS is simple, those ideas are often the hardest to bring into reality. Though the design of GRUMS looks similar to any other small bowl or container, there’s so much more than what meets the eye.

First, the outer diameter was one of our greatest design challenges and our most proud accomplishment. After attempting numerous variations of wall thickness, diameter, height, and shape of the outer wall, we finally landed at 90 mm diameter and a 1 mm wall thickness for GRUMS (see below) to effortlessly pass into the carafe.

At the same time, the groove pattern on the side of GRUMS is an essential design component. The grooves allow for water to pass and relieve the amount of vacuum and suction created at the bottom of the glass carafe for easy removal.

Even the logo on the lower side of GRUMS plays an important role. Notice how it is elevated to assist in the removal of the cup as you lift the plunger. Honestly, without these small technical tricks and design features the product would not work as effectively as it should. Instead, the carafe piston/filter would be pulled out of GRUMS during lifting procedure.

The Knock-box is not complicated. A small bin and a cross bar.
The lid is easy to move as its made as a sliding- turning lid like on a old tobacco can. The bin content will hold you about 20 pcs of Grums.

Small grooves on the side will ensure some air ventilation to the inside that will prevent mold to build. 

 

Finding the right material is our next challenge.

Thus far, we have so far only made prototypes, but we are encouraged that medical Polypropylene, Nylon or ABS will do the job. We will test all of these materials to see what is best – both in terms of molding and in use.

In use, we aim for a material that elongates and retracts to a minimum. As our unit is thin, we look for good flow in molding. And finally, we must only consider food grade materials that are 100% free from migrating any harmful components. We also realize that some people may have an aversion to synthetic material, so we are also considering ways to make GRUMS in aluminum, but that extension will only happen after we’ve perfected the original GRUMS we’re proposing to you now.

 

 

 

We can make our first mold tooling.

Once we receive our moldings, we will test and retest every facet of the unit. We will be vigilant in improving the material and the design. It may mean adding 1/10 mm here and there, but we won’t be satisfied until we know we have perfected GRUMS. Once we’re confident to proceed, we will make 4-cavity tooling to bring down production cost and really set this concept on fire. Your backing will not only help us financially, but to also spread the word and encourage us in the belief we have done something right here, something good for you, our future customers, and our planet.

 

Tobias had this idea.

I started using the french press in my early twenties. It was the beginning of the nineties with Nirvana playing on the radio. The cold war was over, and the world was bright and promising.

I lived in a small flat in Copenhagen and I enjoyed my french press coffee to the fullest, but the cleaning was annoying.

If I flushed the coffee grounds, my drain would clog, so I often found myself scraping the grounds into the bin with a wooden spoon. I started thinking that there must be a better way. While I was studying industrial design at the Royal Academy of Architecture, I got an idea:
Why not collect the grounds in a cup that could be removed with the flick of your wrist?

I drew the unnamed gizmo, but I was concerned someone would steal my invention, so I didn't show it to anyone. Later, I contacted the company that made my coffee maker, but got turned away at the reception, “We do not cooperate with outside designers,” I was told.

The project ended in a drawer for 20 years.

I had a career in television for 17 years, but when I got sick and lost my job, I needed a new occupation. I looked at my old ideas. That French press ‘gizmo’ jumped to the forefront. As the 3d-printer was now in existence, and better yet, the University had one I could use for free, I made a prototype - Eureka! It worked.

No longer afraid to show it anymore, I contacted several firms. I knew I had to trust people or it would sit in the drawer once again. It took me two years to find Lars and Fabrikators. We met in November 2015. The idea has a name: GRUMS.

Now it's up to you. Do you like my idea?

Thank you for giving us your time.

 

 

At first glance, the image below may look like nothing more than a few grams of plastic, but in reality, the design entails some unique engineering and design characteristics.

Nevertheless.   
Lets face it - GRUMS could come into the hands of people who may attempt to copy our concept and designs. To protect ourselves from copycats, we have filed for an international patent we hope will take some of the air out of their efforts. We are relatively sure the major players will leave us alone for a while or seek a license deal. With your support, we will stand a better chance of protecting the idea.

 

 

Disclaimer: 
Grums is in no way affiliated with beakers, grinders, cups or anything else used on the video and photo material. All materials used are for example only.
story_txt:
You love coffee and you love coffee from your French press even more. The exquisite aroma and vision of the coffee oils floating to the top makes coffee aficionados the world over prefer to press and pour.Nevertheless, many coffee drinkers have set their French press aside to avoid the mess that comes with cleaning. It consumes more time, smudges your sink, clogs your drain and requires a lot of tap water or kitchen paper to clean up the presses' messes.With your support, we can solve the problem once and forever. We’re giving you back your French press pleasure without any of the pain. 

 
Say hello to GRUMS - a brilliantly simple “cup” that collects your grounds for easy disposal while keeping your carafe clean. We’re developing the ideal receptacle for your grounds that automatically fastens to the plunger when you pull it from the carafe to empty and clean it. GRUMS saves you time, effort, water, and eliminates clogging of your drain. Just shake your grounds out from the cup to your trash bin or save the grounds for a variety of helpful uses (more on that later). You’ve just made a nice cup of coffee from your French press, and now your carafe is filled with coffee grounds. Time for clean up! The coffee grounds are thrown into the sink and now you rinse the carafe and the sink with lots of water. Wasteful and messy! With GRUMS, you simply add your fresh coffee grounds into the GRUMS cup, set it inside the carafe, fill with water, and press down the plunger.Now comes the magic.After you’ve enjoyed your delicious cup of coffee, gently push the plunger in the GRUMS cup and let friction work for you to effortlessly pull out the grounds – compacted nice and tidy inside the GRUMS cup. After lifting the cup out, all the grounds can be thrown into the trashcan, or set aside for other meaningful uses.   We set out to create something so smart, simple and easy, French press coffee lovers wouldn’t think twice about purchasing one.With GRUMS, you get the taste you want without the mess you don’t. Just fill up GRUMS with your favorite coffee until you reach one of the markings of your liking. Place the cup into the French press, pour your hot water, press, and then enjoy a nice cup of coffee. Afterwards, the plunger is automatically fastened to the cup, which easily can now be removed to throw out the grounds or even keep it for later purposes – How simple is that? In Denmark, where GRUMS is being developed, we are passionate about conserving resources to benefit people and our planet. Much of our inspiration for GRUMS is a result of not wanting to waste water. On average, it takes about 4-liters (more than a gallon) to clean your carafe and sink – even more if your drain clogs.Lets say we put it conservatively at 2 liters minimum to clean you carafe after use. Taking into account the number of French presses sold up to now, and the average use (1-2 times a week), we get to a stunning water consumption of 104.000.000 cubic meters (27,473,893,445 gal) pr. year. That’s enough to fill about 7 million tanker trucks. The length of all these trucks combined equals to more than two times the circumference of the Earth.Let us remind our selves that only 1% of the world’s water is fresh water, and this water needs to be made drinkable before it comes out of our taps. The energy required to make water drinkable is substantial. By using water to clean a carafe with coffee grounds, we’re wasting the world’s precious supplies of water.USING GRUMS can save 100,000 tons of CO2.This is the energy it approximately takes to collect, pump, distribute and again drain off all this water. According to the Danish Danva water association it takes about 1 kg CO2 per 1000 liters. So we use not only a lot of water but also 100,000 tons of CO2 to deal with it. Lets save this too. GRUMS is not made for any specific French Press brand, but for the standard 1-liter jar that is most commonly used. GRUMS will fit right into what we believe is more than 95% of French press carafes being sold today and at least all the major brands.If you're concerned about fit, take a measure at home before you pledge.The outer dimension of GRUMS is 90 mm (3.5-inches), so your carafe should be a little larger than that. Save the grounds and re-use them – Coffee grounds can be used for more than 20 different purposes including surprising things, like fungus and soap making.Brewing coffee is actually using a small percentage of the nutritional value inside the bean; so don’t throw your grounds in the trashcan.Coffee grounds contain rich amounts of nitrogen and function as a perfect natural fertilizer for your plants. By adding organic material to the soil, you will improve drainage, water retention and aeration.You can also use it to absorb food odor. Simply place your coffee grounds in an open container and leave it inside your refrigerator. After a few weeks, you can still use the same coffee grounds as fertilizer. It also makes a great exfoliating body scrub. Mix your coffee grounds with a bit of warm water and you’re ready to exfoliate your skin.In case you want to read more about how to use your coffee grounds click on the buzzfeed below: Not only have we designed GRUMS for the perfect french press experience, but we've also made an easy solution to save your grounds. It's simple to use. Slide the lid to the side, knock the grounds into the container and close the lid again, done.    We’ve made it easy for you to make French press coffee. We’ve designed markings inside of the cup, so you can easily fill it with the right amount of coffee for you. The markings make it more consistent than spoon measuring.When it’s time to clean your carafe, you’ll see why GRUMS is the one French press accessory you never want to be without. Because all the grounds remain nice and tidy inside the cup, there’s less grounds residue to clean up in the carafe and in your sink. Just knock the grounds out in your bin. Imagine how much water you’ll save, and how much easier it is to enjoy another cup. Get ready in seconds and get ready again. It’s Friday night and you’re having a dinner party with all your best friends. Normally you would choose the coffeemaker because you need to make multiple pots, but to be true to yourself, you prefer the French press way. With GRUMS, you can clean the used carafe quickly and have it loaded again and ready to go.Imagine the compliments you’ll get serving your guests delicious and aromatic French press coffee.    This is how it normally looks. Ah, the drain pain! Cleaning a carafe will fill your sink and takes a lot of water to re-clean.  - and clog your drain, heavily!​ Although the idea of GRUMS is simple, those ideas are often the hardest to bring into reality. Though the design of GRUMS looks similar to any other small bowl or container, there’s so much more than what meets the eye.First, the outer diameter was one of our greatest design challenges and our most proud accomplishment. It worked.No longer afraid to show it anymore, I contacted several firms. I knew I had to trust people or it would sit in the drawer once again. It took me two years to find Lars and Fabrikators. Do you like my idea?Thank you for giving us your time.  At first glance, the image below may look like nothing more than a few grams of plastic, but in reality, the design entails some unique engineering and design characteristics.Nevertheless.   Lets face it - GRUMS could come into the hands of people who may attempt to copy our concept and designs. story:
Short Summary

Stoker & Goose are friends who went their seperate ways after highschool. A decade later, they found out they were both active in the hospitality business, but on very different ends of it. The connection? They both share the same passion for quality spirits & genever in general. Stoker is a  distiller, distilling over 250 different products. For once he wanted to be in charge of the whole process - from hand-picking juniper berries to the aging experiments.  Goose is a bartender and beverage consultant who's always on the road, managing bars,and making people happy with good drinks & memorable experiences. Having been a sales rep & bartender for multiple big name spirits, he just wanted to be the face of his own brand too. A brand that was just born and has the opportunity to organically grow through the community he values and respects more than anything. The hospitality industry is family.  

The brand will celebrate hospitality in general, small-town people making an impact, and will link the Belgian bartending community to New York. These two markets hold most importance to Goose - both with his personal and professional relationships. And everything is linked by water - through his journeys over the last few years along with the ones to come... As he explains (or at least tries to) in the video.

While Goose will be traveling between both markets in the first few months as the face of the brand, Stoker will be tending to the high quality product back home in Belgium with his loving and supportive family by his side...every batch he makes (to the tune of Sting).  Stoker & Goose may seem like an unlikely match, but they're the perfect pair, especially when it comes to perfecting and pursuing this small batched venture. 

What We Need & What You Get

1. We need traction. We need to educate people about the product - genever. Not only about our brand. But the whole gang. Jonge Genever, Oude Genever, Malt Wine,... So by just sharing our video, you're already making a small impact. 

2. We need love. The more people who find their hidden love for our traditional spirit, the better. We hope to make this easier by developing a free recipe book with cocktails & tips from the best bartenders in Belgium and NY. We will need a winter to finish this project - just in time to get your hands on the perfect 7knots Punch recipe created bya notable local bartender. If you're a bartender or bar, don't hesitate to shoot an e-mail if you're interested in beingfeatured! 

3. We need money. Plain and simple. We're putting everything we have into this project in all possible ways. From buying all the bottles and corks, to figuring out legal terms for export and distribution. Everything eats at the budget. Every extra dollar (or Euro) counts.

4. We need support. Every person backing this project is just reassuring us that we may actually be able to save our national spirit from dying. Next to that, if we feel support and interest from people in other countries, maybe sky is the limit. 

Every single person backing this project - regardless of how much - will be listed on our website as this is a community on its own. 

People who manage to buy a bottle will even be included on the label of the first & following batches. This is part of the reason why our label design isn't finalized just yet. We're waiting on you, to be apart of the story, the design, and this killer project.

story:
OUR STORY

Hi Tailin' It! is a small, women-owned business with big hearts based out of Morgan Hill, California. For the past five years, we have been running a successful pet service business and decided it was time to expand our company.

The expansion started with a simple idea that came after a backpacking trip two years ago. Bailey, Cat’s Rottweiler, was going on a four day trip with her family in the Sierras. Bailey is not the type of dog that feels comfortable wearing a saddle harness to carry her own backpacking items. After putting a side-saddle harness on her and receiving the very sad puppy dog eyes (she can really play it up!), Cat relented and decided her family should carry Bailey’s food and bowls. Bailey’s kibble took up so much room in the family bear box that she had to go out and purchase a second box! Cat was able to pack food and toiletries in one bear box for five people for four days (yes, thank you, she is an expert bear box packer) and it was still lighter than the bear box containing Bailey’s food. After the first day of carrying her gear and Bailey’s food she asked herself the question, “Wouldn’t it be awesome if there was a lightweight dog food that came in a package that we didn’t have to pack out?” Hence, the Hi Tailin’ It! product line was born.

 

WHY AN INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN?

We are asking the INDIEGOGO community for assistance in helping our company build brand awareness so that every dog lover can provide their furry friend with a full belly wherever they land.

We are raising money to help cover the costs of building inventory, upgrading our packaging and labels, and funding participation in trade shows/events.

 

 

OUR PRODUCTS

The Hi Tailin' It! On the Go line is a simple and delicious freeze-dried dog food specifically made and packaged for active dogs on the go. Whether you are camping, hiking, or backpacking with your dog, or just need to travel away from home, Hi Tailin' It! On the Go products can provide an easy grab-and-go meal. The pouch the food comes in is water-soluble, meaning it will dissolve once mixed with water. After Fido finishes eating, place the pouch in water, swish around 30 seconds, and watch it disappear.  Nothing for the landfill!

(BEEF RECIPE)

 

The Hi Tailin' It! Be Ready! line is perfect for your Go Bag in case of an emergency. Disaster can strike at any time. Don't forget about food for Fido. If you need to flee Fido will be covered too. Get Ready!, Be Ready!, Stay Ready!

(CHICKEN RECIPE)

 

The Hi Tailin' It! On the Go Bars and the Hi Tailin' It! Nibbles give Fido a little extra boost as he goes about his adventures. Each yummy bar and treat is packed with nutritious ingredients providing additional protein for active dogs.

(CHEESE BARS)

 

OUR PRODUCTS

 

Inside the pouch

Each pouch of dog food supplies one serving of nutritious wholesome food. Currently available in chicken or beef recipe. 

Chicken recipe - Chicken, Lentils, Sweet Potatoes, Apples, Green Beans, Eggs, Coconut Oil, Chia Seeds, Flaxseed, Eggshell

Beef recipe - Beef, Barley, Squash, Mushrooms, Kale, Apples, Eggs, Coconut Oil, Chia Seeds, Flaxseed, Eggshell

 

Cat cutting up squash!

 

Chris removing sweet potatoes from the freeze dryer.

 

All-natural, locally sourced, wholesome freeze-dried food ingredients. There are no preservatives, gluten, or GMOs.

 

Bars and Treat Ingredient

Cheese Flavor - Cheddar cheese, black beans, whole wheat flour, coconut oil, sunflower seeds, brown rice

Peanut Butter Flavor - Peanut butter (dry roasted peanuts), chickpeas, banana, whole grain oats, chia seeds

W

(Cheese Treats)

(Peanut Butter Bars)

 

OUR PERKS

  • Hi Tailin’ It! Dog food
  • Hi Tailin’ It! Treats
  • Hi Tailin’ It! Bars
  • Hi Tailin’ It! carrot and apple treats
  • T-Shirt
  • Drawstring bag (with food, bowls, dispenser with poop bags)
  • Discount on products
  • Freeze-drier usage

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Any adventure that incorporates starting a new business comes with risks and challenges. From inception to launch we have overcome numerous obstacles and gained much knowledge on starting a business. Some of our risks are:

· Successfully being able to scale up to accommodate growing demand. Our plan is to hire additional staff as needed.

· As our business expands, we will need to invest in bigger freeze dryers which will bring us to the next hurdle of either finding additional commercial kitchen space or the need to create our own commercial kitchen space. To address this risk we plan to eventually open our manufacturing facility. 

· We try to use local ingredients that are both nutritious and easily found throughout the year. However, it may be more expensive to purchase particular products at certain times of the year. We intend to purchase additional space to be able to freeze-dry and store seasonal products.

 

WHO WE ARE

Catherine is a lifelong animal lover and owner. She is originally from Michigan but settled in California eight years ago. She enjoys traveling and looks forward to spending time outdoors with her family and her lovable 90-pound Rottweiler doing what they love (hiking, camping, and backpacking). Catherine graduated from Wayne State University in Detroit, MI and later went on to obtain a master’s from Walsh College in Troy, MI. Although her background is in business, she has always loved animals and desired to work with them.

Christy has always been a huge animal lover. She is originally from Lexington, Kentucky and now lives in Morgan Hill, California where she regularly volunteers for a local cat shelter. She has two daughters, four cats, and a guinea pig. She attended the University of Kentucky where she got a BA in Theatre Arts. She went on to pursue a career as a professional dancer.

After Catherine and Christy met they decided to go into business together and started a pet service business. One thing led to another and they came up with the idea for Hi Tailin’ It! product lines. After many hours of hard work and research, Hi’Tailin It! was launched.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you like the product please share the campaign on social media and pass the word to friends and family.

 

 

* Hi Tailin' It! is a DBA of Chris & Cat LLC, a fully licensed pet food manufacturing company through the State of California. We manufacture our products to California's high standards for quality pet food.

After Fido finishes eating, place the pouch in water, swish around 30 seconds, and watch it disappear.  Nothing for the landfill!(BEEF RECIPE) The Hi Tailin' It! Be Ready! line is perfect for your Go Bag in case of an emergency. Disaster can strike at any time. Don't forget about food for Fido. If you need to flee Fido will be covered too. Get Ready!, Be Ready!, Stay Ready!(CHICKEN RECIPE) The Hi Tailin' It! On the Go Bars and the Hi Tailin' It! Nibbles give Fido a little extra boost as he goes about his adventures. Each yummy bar and treat is packed with nutritious ingredients providing additional protein for active dogs.(CHEESE BARS) OUR PRODUCTS Inside the pouchEach pouch of dog food supplies one serving of nutritious wholesome food. Currently available in chicken or beef recipe. Chicken recipe - Chicken, Lentils, Sweet Potatoes, Apples, Green Beans, Eggs, Coconut Oil, Chia Seeds, Flaxseed, EggshellBeef recipe - Beef, Barley, Squash, Mushrooms, Kale, Apples, Eggs, Coconut Oil, Chia Seeds, Flaxseed, Eggshell Cat cutting up squash! Chris removing sweet potatoes from the freeze dryer. All-natural, locally sourced, wholesome freeze-dried food ingredients. There are no preservatives, gluten, or GMOs. Bars and Treat IngredientCheese Flavor - Cheddar cheese, black beans, whole wheat flour, coconut oil, sunflower seeds, brown ricePeanut Butter Flavor - Peanut butter (dry roasted peanuts), chickpeas, banana, whole grain oats, chia seedsW(Cheese Treats)(Peanut Butter Bars) OUR PERKS
Hi Tailin’ It! Dog food
Hi Tailin’ It! Treats
Hi Tailin’ It! Bars
Hi Tailin’ It! carrot and apple treats
T-Shirt
Drawstring bag (with food, bowls, dispenser with poop bags)
Discount on products
Freeze-drier usage
 RISKS AND CHALLENGESAny adventure that incorporates starting a new business comes with risks and challenges. From inception to launch we have overcome numerous obstacles and gained much knowledge on starting a business. Some of our risks are:· Successfully being able to scale up to accommodate growing demand. Our plan is to hire additional staff as needed.· As our business expands, we will need to invest in bigger freeze dryers which will bring us to the next hurdle of either finding additional commercial kitchen space or the need to create our own commercial kitchen space. To address this risk we plan to eventually open our manufacturing facility. · We try to use local ingredients that are both nutritious and easily found throughout the year. However, it may be more expensive to purchase particular products at certain times of the year. We intend to purchase additional space to be able to freeze-dry and store seasonal products. WHO WE ARECatherine is a lifelong animal lover and owner. She is originally from Michigan but settled in California eight years ago. She enjoys traveling and looks forward to spending time outdoors with her family and her lovable 90-pound Rottweiler doing what they love (hiking, camping, and backpacking). Catherine graduated from Wayne State University in Detroit, MI and later went on to obtain a master’s from Walsh College in Troy, MI. Although her background is in business, she has always loved animals and desired to work with them.Christy has always been a huge animal lover. She is originally from Lexington, Kentucky and now lives in Morgan Hill, California where she regularly volunteers for a local cat shelter. She has two daughters, four cats, and a guinea pig. She attended the University of Kentucky where she got a BA in Theatre Arts. She went on to pursue a career as a professional dancer.After Catherine and Christy met they decided to go into business together and started a pet service business. One thing led to another and they came up with the idea for Hi Tailin’ It! product lines. After many hours of hard work and research, Hi’Tailin It! was launched. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPIf you like the product please share the campaign on social media and pass the word to friends and family.  * Hi Tailin' It! is a DBA of Chris & Cat LLC, a fully licensed pet food manufacturing company through the State of California. We manufacture our products to California's high standards for quality pet food.

story:
What's Inside

 

 

How to drink rivvibe™

 

 

 

rivvibe™ in Action

 

 

Don't Just Take Our Word

 

 

We Are Happy to Bare It All

 

 

Meet Our Team

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Why should I back rivvibe™ now?

  • Take advantage of our special pricing and promotional items available on Indiegogo! Our retail price will be $3.29 per bottle in stores, but here on Indiegogo our backers receive rivvibe at a great discount. 

When is the best time to consume rivvibe™?

  • rivvibe should be consumed before or after a workout. Don't worry if you forget! You can still drink rivvibe afterwards to improve recovery and feel great. 

Where can I find additional, independent studies on moringa and other ingredients?

  • You can use google search and input the following search terms, 'moringa', 'ginger', 'turmeric', and 'honey', to read all about the amazing health and nutritional properties of our ingredients.

Where is rivvibe™ manufactured?

  • rivvibe is manufactured and distributed locally in Arizona. We have an incredible local partner, who has been in business for over 25 years, owning the trademark "Made in Arizona". 

Is rivvibe™ FDA approved?

  • Yes, rivvibe is a bottled beverage and is FDA compliant. Every every step of rivvibe's sourcing, testing, and manufacturing complies with the requirements set forth in the FDA regulations.

How do I contact you if I have more questions?

  • Email rivvibe@gmail.com or message on Facebook. 

Can I purchase rivvibe™ in bulk?

  • Absolutely! You can contact us via our website or email us at rivvibe@gmail.com.
