story:
Bottle2Box: Your Wine on Your Time.

Everyone who drinks wine has their favorite selections: specific vintages from specific producers. Until now, it has been entirely up to wine producers to decide whether or not to put their product in a box. Bottle2Box will change that. We'll take any bottle from any producer, put it in a box, and ship it directly to your front door. And, we'll do all of this while meeting or beating retail prices.

Why would you want wine in a box? The short answer is: flavor and longevity. When you open a bottle of wine, the flavor starts to degrade almost immediately. In a matter of hours (perhaps days), the flavor will change so much that most people would consider it spoiled. Sure, you can put the cork back in, use a stopper or even a fancy countertop appliance to delay the change, but those don't measure up because ...

Wine boxes are different. Your wine is actually stored in a sealed plastic bag inside the box. This means that pouring a glass from a box isn't the same as opening a bottle. Once the first glass is poured from a box, the rest of the wine stays sealed off. Because of the limited exposure to atmosphere, your wine in the box will stay fresh for weeks, allowing you to enjoy your wine at your own pace. There’s no need to finish it in hours, hook it up to an expensive appliance, or throw away what isn't consumed.

But Don't Take Our Word For It:

NY Times: The Argument for Boxed Wine

Winefolly: Are There Benefits to Boxed Wine?

Forbes: The Best in Boxed Wine

We Need to Build a Machine

In order to deliver our product to anyone, we first need to build a machine to implement our patent-pending process.

Part of the machine already exists. Because some producers already package their wine in a box (like Franzia*, Bota*, Black Box*, etc.), we can buy the same machines they use. That technology is not proprietary. It's expensive, industrial-quality, food-safe machinery, but it's available nevertheless.

Part of the machine is brand-new. Because no one is taking wine out of retail-ready bottles before putting into a box, that machinery doesn't exist. We have to start from scratch. Engineers will have to design it, and machinists will have to build it. However, this isn't ground-shattering, sci-fi-level technology; it's motors and levers and seals and pumps. In other words, the only challenge is paying for it.

*Marks are the property of their respective owners.

That's Where You Come In

With your help, we can order the existing parts and start the process of building the novel parts. Properly combined, the two parts of the Bottle2Box machine will allow us to start building a business. 

Meeting our fundraising goal will help us build a low-volume machine suitable for testing and limited order fulfillment. Exceeding our goal will get us closer to a high-volume machine which can deliver on orders from multiple states (and eventually the entire country, or even the world).

MEMBERSHIP PERKS:

  • Day One Club: Every contributor to this campaign will be a member of the Day One Club. Membership includes a lifetime of exclusive offers and discounts.
  • Day One Elite: People who contribute $100 or more will receive all the benefits of Day One membership, plus custom-designed and exclusive packaging on all orders for life. 
  • Boxed Seats Club: People who contribute $1,000 or more will get all the benefits of Day One Elite membership, plus a spot-for-life on our special "Thank You" website page.


TOP STATE COMPETITION: The State which contributes the MOST MONEY to this campaign will be Bottle2Box's FIRST EXPANSION STATE. After we're up and running in Texas, your home state could be first in line.

TOP DOG COMPETITION: The single largest contributor to this campaign will receive BOXES OF WINE AT COST FOR LIFE (see below). Furthermore, he or she will appear in our FIRST CELEBRITY VIDEO ENDORSEMENT.


SOME RESTRICTIONS APPLY (Don't They Always):

  • The Twitter "Thank You" tweets will be paced so as to not drown out our other twitter messages, and will be posted in order of donation. As such, delivery date will vary.
  • Estimated Delivery Dates are only for non-alcoholic goods. 
  • All discounts on and deliveries of wine will only be available once Bottle2Box has been properly licensed in your state or country, and your age has been confirmed.
  • All perks are for personal, household use only. They are non-transferable.
  • The TOP DOG will be limited to 24 Boxes at cost per year. That's equivalent to 96 bottles.
  • Only states which allow the online purchase and delivery of wine are eligible for TOP STATE.
  • All personal information required for the delivery of perks will be provided by you. Should that information change before we can deliver, please inform us. 

The Challenge Ahead

Because Bottle2Box is doing something new, there are a number of obstacles in our way. The first challenge involves safety and quality. Not only do we want our machine to be safe to operate, but it also needs to be safe to the consumer. This means using only tested and proven materials which can be quickly and effectively sanitized. The engineers who designed the existing parts have already thought of this. We'll have to replicate that thinking for the new parts.

To make sure we get it right, Bottle2Box has already engaged the services of a former Food & Beverage industry executive, and we will work with qualified engineers to make sure our final product meets stringent safety standards. 

The second challenge will be legal compliance. This will come in two primary forms: food safety and liquor laws. Regarding food safety: after our engineers tell us the machine is safe, and after lab testing confirms it, we’ll have to convince various state and federal agencies of the same. Because what we’re doing is unique, these agencies will probably want to take an extra-close look to ensure we’re in line with the appropriate regulations. These thorough inspections will probably be time-consuming. 

Regarding liquor laws: every state has its own rules. Starting in Texas, we’ll have to find a way to fit our wine-repackaging service into an existing legal framework, one that currently views every business as a producer, distributor, or retailer. Bottle2Box might fall into all of these categories or none. Then we’ll have to take steps to comply with laws relating to the home-delivery of alcoholic beverages. This process will have to be repeated in every state, and eventually around the world.

Fortunately, as a former political operative and currently licensed attorney, Sean Matula (creator of Bottle2Box) has both the skillset and network necessary to tackle these challenges. 

The final challenge will be managing growth. We know how big the wine industry is, we know how it’s changing, and we know how boxed wine currently fits into that picture. However, until we actually start selling boxes of wine, we’ll have no idea what kind of demand we’ll face. This means finding a careful balance between hoping for the best and planning for the worst. It also means that some of our earliest customers will be most exposed to our growing pains.

To face this challenge, Bottle2Box will employ the latest technology and techniques from both the business and political arenas. This will allow us to better maintain communication with our supporters, ensure quality experiences for our customers, reduce the costs of operation, and predict growth before it occurs.

story:
Are you ready to reignite the magic within? Let's Duet!

 

I am Lindsay, first and foremost I am the very proud mother of two beautiful children, Brayden (9) and Lillian (4). I am a passionate, dedicated and professional Entrepreneur originally from Naples, Maine and now located in Charlotte, North Carolina. I have seventeen years of restaurant experience. This includes working as a General Manager in corporate fine dining establishments as well as private clubs. I grew up highly involved in theatre and music, and have always possessed a love for the arts, and a fascination with uniquely artistic people. 

I have started this campaign to raise money to open a restaurant with a new concept in South End Charlotte, NC. 

Lets Duet will offer elegant cuisine in an eclectic atmosphere, designed completely by Charlotte artists. We combine fine dining with immersive art to provide an experience like no other! Using molecular gastronomy and mixology to create edible works of art, presented by our theatrical dining assistants who use tools to provide a unique sensory experience. 

We have partnered with some of the city's most amazing artists to design the immersive art rooms, and host a different style of art class paired with a tasting menu every Friday to showcase and feature many different Charlotte artists and their unique style of art. 

Lets Duet also will have a late-night, musical surprise called The Stagedoor. Just like in theatre, The Stagedoor is a hidden door that leads to a speakeasy style music bar that offers a unique upscale bar menu, open mic nights, poetry nights, and "duet nights". Duet nights will feature only pairs. Guests can bring their own partner or get blind partnered through our app. On Lets Duet's App there is an area to provide personal preference information that will match partners together. 

This is mine and my son's dream. I love food, I love people, I love art, and I love kindness. I want to give back to my amazing community, I want to support unique artists and entrepreneurs on their quest to follow their dreams, but most of all, I want to show my children, and upcoming generations, that if we work hard, work together, share kindness, and give more than we take, together, we can achieve anything. 

Change the mindset, change the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

Lets Duet is looking to raise money through various avenues to come up with our initial start up cost of $1 million. 

We hope to raise $200,000 through crowdfunding alone. This will be used to cover the down payment on our prospective location so we can begin building our dream!

If we don't reach our entire goal through Indiegogo we will continue to raise money through other avenues and save everything raised in our business account until we have what we need for start up costs.

For any backers we find through Indiegogo we will be sending a variety of thank you gifts such as: a personalized thank you letter explaining the impact they had on our business development, Lets Duet merchandise, unique art pieces created by one of our amazing artist partners, and pairs of tickets for "an artistic dining experience" once we are open!

The Impact

Lets Duet will bring a new value to Charlotte. We will strive to bring together the community by supporting small business owners, entrepreneurs, and Charlotte's artists of all kinds!  We plan to support our community in every way we can. This includes: Rewarding employees for volunteering in the community, hosting different local charity events., donating annually to local charities, hosting and catering events for local small businesses, advertising for local businesses and artists, and partnering with the theatre and art community to provide an experience only to be found at Lets Duet. 

Your contribution will make all the difference in the world to myself and my amazing team. Every amount we raise gets us one step closer to drawing back the curtains for opening night.  From then on we can work to make a difference in our community and then spread throughout the world. Sharing kindness and working hard, together, we can achieve anything. Change the mindset, change the world.

Risks & Challenges

There are always many risks and challenges to face when planning any business.  The food service industry is highly competitive. The U.S. restaurant industry includes over one million restaurants with combined annual revenue of about $700 billion in 2019. 

The largest challenge we have is raising the money to get the business up and running.  Once open Lets Duet will face many threats such as: 

•    Rising operating costs 

•    Building & maintaining sales volume

•    Popular, upscale restaurants nearby such as Ruth's Chris, Bardo, and The Capital Grille.

•    Increasing demand for food delivery services.

I believe we can overcome threats and challenges due to the following strengths:

•    I have an exceptional team with the can-do attitude. Combined over 60 years in the restaurant industry

•    Due to each of us having industry experience, we have already established a customer base and approved vendors

•    Due to our limited size, we believe we can provide exceptional quality by hand selecting our market specials when compared to our larger competitors

•    The same concept holds true in our staffing requirements, by hand selecting our employees we will strive to offer unsurpassed service when compared to our larger competitors

•    Lets Duet dining experience that is the first of it's kind in not only the city of Charlotte, but in the state of North Carolina.

•    Combining an immersive art experience with dining gives us more to offer than our average fine dining competitors. 

•    Working with artists of all kinds allows us to consistently increase our customer base swiftly.

•    This also allows us to keep cost of decor low as we will be showcasing selling their art inside the restaurant. 

Other Ways You Can Help

•    The more the merrier, you can join our team of creators!

•    We ask for you to please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

•    Using the Indiegogo share tools makes getting the word out quick and easy!

story:
Dear Backers,

Thank you for being a part of our incredible journey to bring Tiiable Awake to life. Before we launched, we didn’t know who else would be as excited about our idea as we were. Now, because of your support and the support of 1215 backers, we are moving onto the next phase of the project. In fact, we have already started discussing the specifics with the manufacturer and we should be able to share the delivery schedule with you within the next few weeks as the details are confirmed.

Our priority is to deliver on our commitments to you and we’ll keep you updated on our progress. As we hunker down to make Tiiable Awake a reality, you can expect to receive open, honest, & substantive updates from us monthly. Feel free to contact us at support@tiiabletea.com in the meantime if you have any questions. Thanks again for your support!

All the best,
Tiiable Awake

 

         

   

AWAKE's manufacturing facility is similar to that of semiconductors, equipped with an aseptic cleanroom environment, where the source of contamination is completely removed. All functional natural ingredients comprising AWAKE, including Oriental Raisin Tree extract, turmeric, ginger, and many others are flash-sterilized by ultra-high temperature(UHT) processing, and are instantly chilled at room temperature. This ensures minimal loss of nutrients, and each ingredient's unique taste and aroma is kept intact. AWAKE is safely manufactured in the facility that has been awarded with ISO 9001, FSCC 22000, and HACCP Certification in accordance the international quality standards. 

AWAKE will start to ship from

September(late) or October,

depending on manufacturing schedule.

You are what you drink. Yet, many people around the world are left without safe drinking water. This is also where TIIABLE is committed to make a difference. 

 

To that end, we will be donating five percent of our revenue from the indiegogo campaign to help alleviate the drinking water shortage problem around the world. That is not, however, where our mission ends, as we will continue to seek other ways to make our contribution.

 

Proper hydration is one of the key habits contributing to one's health and general well-being. Stick to that habit, and TIIABLE will deliver our unique blends of the best natural ingredients, more than water or any other beverages could.

​

​​

Visit Our Website

https://www.tiiabletea.com/

 

Research document

Hovenia Dulcis

Article: Natural Products for the Prevention and Treatment of Hangover and Alcohol Use Disorder

Molecules 2016, 21, 64; doi:10.3390/molecules21010064

URL: https://www.mdpi.com/1420-3049/21/1/64/pdf

Excerpt (page 5): Dihydromyricetin (DHM), a flavonoid separated from Hovenia dulcis, was identified to interact with γ-aminobutyric acid receptors and block alcohol intoxication … DHM could remarkably reduce alcohol digestion … DHM could be used as a therapeutic candidate for alcohol use disorders.

 

Glutathione(GSH)

Article:Engineered Animal Models Designed for Investigating Ethanol Metabolism, Toxicity and Cancer: Proceedings of the Third International ConferenceAdvances in Experimental Medicine and Biology January 2018

URL:https://www.researchgate.net/publication/328520...

Excerpt (page 205): Enzymes involved in GSH synthesis, such as glutamate-cysteine  ligase catalytic (GCLC) (GCLM) subunits are integral to neutralizing and maintain-ing homeostatic ROS levels that are generated after ethanol consumption preventing the deleteri-ous effects of ethanolReactive oxygen species (ROS), by-products of ethanol metabolism, are scavenged by glutathione (GSH)-dependent mechanisms. Enzymes involved in GSH synthesis, such as glutamate-cysteine ligase catalytic (GCLC) and modifier (GCLM) subunits are integral to neutralizing and maintaining homeostatic ROS levels that are generated after ethanol consumption preventing the deleterious effects of ethanol

 

Turmeric

Article : Curcumin Reintroduced Therapeutic Agent from Traditional Medicine for Alcoholic Liver Disease

ASIA PACIFIC JOURNAL of MEDICAL TOXICOLOGY APJMT 4;1 http://apjmt.mums.ac.ir March 2015

URL:https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/7322/971556e12...

Excerpt (page 27):Curcumin is able to provide protection for the liver against toxic effects of alcohol use.

Excerpt (page 29):Curcumin has antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, chemopreventive, and chemotherapeutic activity without major adverse effects. Chronic inflammatory diseases such as asthma, bronchitis, inflammatory bowel disease, rheumatoid arthritis, alcoholic liver disease, fatty liver, and allergy can be therapeutic targets of curcumin.

 

Ginger

Article:Natural Products for the Prevention and Treatment of Hangover and Alcohol Use Disorder

Molecules 2016, 21, 64; doi:10.3390/molecules21010064

URL:https://www.mdpi.com/1420-3049/21/1/64/pdf

Excerpt (page 6):Owing to the antioxidant effect of ginger, Zingiber officinale is recommended to be used as natural product to treat alcohol toxicity … In a clinical effectiveness evaluation study, the hangover symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhea were alleviated after administration of formula in scheduled prophylactic doses … Therefore, ginger could be used as a candidate to the prevention and treatment of hangover and organ damages induced by overconsmption of alcohol through its antioxidant action.

Article: Natural Products for the Prevention and Treatment of Hangover and Alcohol Use Disorder
Molecules 2016, 21, 64; doi:10.3390/molecules21010064
URL: https://www.mdpi.com/1420-3049/21/1/64/pdf
Excerpt (page 5): Dihydromyricetin (DHM), a flavonoid separated from Hovenia dulcis, was identified to interact with γ-aminobutyric acid receptors and block alcohol intoxication … DHM could remarkably reduce alcohol digestion … DHM could be used as a therapeutic candidate for alcohol use disorders.
 
Glutathione(GSH)
Article:Engineered Animal Models Designed for Investigating Ethanol Metabolism, Toxicity and Cancer: Proceedings of the Third International ConferenceAdvances in Experimental Medicine and Biology January 2018
URL:https://www.researchgate.net/publication/328520...
Excerpt (page 205): Enzymes involved in GSH synthesis, such as glutamate-cysteine  ligase catalytic (GCLC) (GCLM) subunits are integral to neutralizing and maintain-ing homeostatic ROS levels that are generated after ethanol consumption preventing the deleteri-ous effects of ethanolReactive oxygen species (ROS), by-products of ethanol metabolism, are scavenged by glutathione (GSH)-dependent mechanisms. Enzymes involved in GSH synthesis, such as glutamate-cysteine ligase catalytic (GCLC) and modifier (GCLM) subunits are integral to neutralizing and maintaining homeostatic ROS levels that are generated after ethanol consumption preventing the deleterious effects of ethanol
 
Turmeric
Article : Curcumin Reintroduced Therapeutic Agent from Traditional Medicine for Alcoholic Liver Disease
ASIA PACIFIC JOURNAL of MEDICAL TOXICOLOGY APJMT 4;1 http://apjmt.mums.ac.ir March 2015
URL:https://pdfs.semanticscholar.org/7322/971556e12...
Excerpt (page 27):Curcumin is able to provide protection for the liver against toxic effects of alcohol use.
Excerpt (page 29):Curcumin has antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, chemopreventive, and chemotherapeutic activity without major adverse effects. Chronic inflammatory diseases such as asthma, bronchitis, inflammatory bowel disease, rheumatoid arthritis, alcoholic liver disease, fatty liver, and allergy can be therapeutic targets of curcumin.
 
Ginger
Article:Natural Products for the Prevention and Treatment of Hangover and Alcohol Use Disorder
Molecules 2016, 21, 64; doi:10.3390/molecules21010064
URL:https://www.mdpi.com/1420-3049/21/1/64/pdf
Excerpt (page 6):Owing to the antioxidant effect of ginger, Zingiber officinale is recommended to be used as natural product to treat alcohol toxicity … In a clinical effectiveness evaluation study, the hangover symptoms such as nausea, vomiting and diarrhea were alleviated after administration of formula in scheduled prophylactic doses … Therefore, ginger could be used as a candidate to the prevention and treatment of hangover and organ damages induced by overconsmption of alcohol through its antioxidant action.

story:
Nazareth has been producing delicious food through Delina for over five years now. She has produced her own brilliant range of dishes and was recognised by the Free From Awards with a gold, silver and bronze. This is nothing short of amazing given the competition was the likes of Marks and Spencer, Lidl and Tesco.

In addition to her amazing food, she has been running very popular cooking courses where groups can sample the amazing tastes and learn to make their own delicious food.

It is exciting times for Delina and now it is time to take a big step forward. Until now Delina has not had its own space to prepare food and teach, but a fantastic space has become available in the heart of Shepherds Bush - the Market. This will mean more delicious food, more cooking classes and also a cultural coffee experience from the very birthplace of coffee.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Nazareth needs to raise funds for the set up costs of the new premises. She will need to install plumbing, electricity and workbenches along with purchasing kitchen equipment. She is looking for £5000 to cover all of this.

She is inviting you to help make this big step for her and be a part of this new stage for Delina. For generous backers she needs you to sponsor items she needs for the kitchen - fridges, sinks and benches. For this you will have your name permanently written in gold with a thank you on that item, and you will have Naz’s eternal gratitude.

For smaller donations Naz is also offering dinners, cooking classes and exclusive deals on her products.

The Impact

Your help at this point will finally take Delina to the next stage and Nazareth will be able to give you all the range of food and experiences you have all been asking for. Until now it has been hard to produce enough of her products and deliver classes in a professional environment. The new space will open the door for Naz to offer so much more too - Ethiopian coffee ceremony, bespoke spice blends and launching new products.

Risks & Challenges

This is a huge step for Naz and she cannot do it without significant help from all of you. There is a big financial hurdle in front of her, but it is the only way to move forward in her business. The opportunity to grow is huge and after this hurdle is past we all know Delina will be a fantastic success because Naz has what it takes.

story:
CAFE AT PHARR 

Although the cafe is still open for take out and delivery, having to close our dine in area to customers last week was a heartbreaking day for all of us. Our family owned restaurant has been feeding Buckhead and the surrounding areas the fastest and freshest sandwiches and salad plates for over 27 years and we aren't going to let COVID-19 stop us now!

We have created this campaign to offer incentives and perks to our customers to use when we are able to be fully operational again. These funds will help support our hard working staff during this down time. We want to be clear that we would never ask for any donations or handouts and want you to get everything you paid for, but at a discounted price.

Please share this campaign with friends, family, and fellow chicken salad lovers! Thank you for your support and we hope to see all of our customers very soon!

story:
You Are One of Us… Belong.

If you’re reading this then there’s a good chance you already belong to an exclusive group of people who are passionate about the Fownes Brewing Co and our blend of Epic Ales and Dwarfen Tales. 

The last five years have been amazing. We've gone from brewing 60 litres of beer in James' kitchen to nearly a 1000 litres a week at our brewery, won multiple awards locally and at a regional level and taken our Storyteller out on the road to meet all of you.

The Fownes Brewing Co was founded in 2012 by brothers James and Thomas Fownes. The brewery is located at the Jolly Crispin, a 200 year old free house situated on top of a windy ridge in Gornal.

What's next for the Dwarfs?

We're now taking the next step to ensure the sustainability of the brewery in a changing market place. We’ve put a lot of thought into this subject and come to one simple conclusion: Dwarfen Ales in bottles.

We need you to show us you belong by giving us a leg up on this next adventure.

Bottling our ales will allow us to reach even more people, who will hopefully become as passionate about our beer as you are. By helping us to bottle our Dwarfen Ale you'll be able to enjoy it  anywhere for any occasion. Whether it's a ginger and honey ale at a BBQ, a pumpkin ale by the bonfire or just one of our core range with your Sunday roast. Getting bottles out there means we can show the world what we’re all about, and you'll be able to say, 'I was there at the start!'

How do Dwarfs fill bottles?

We want our bottled ale to be handcrafted, just like our cask and keg, and as such we aren’t sending it out to be bottled by another company; we’re doing it ourselves. You’ve probably seen our brewery (if not, pop by some time) and know it’s almost as small as the Dwarfs in our stories, and our bottling equipment is no different. This means the amount we can invest in equipment directly relates to the number of bottles we can produce and send out for you to enjoy.

How do Dwarfs stand tall?

It's no secret that drinkers now have access to an overwhelmingly large range of beers and we need to make ours stand out from the crowd. Not an easy task for a Dwarfen brewery, but we think we've cracked it.

Our bottles are stubby! After a lengthy search we finally found the perfect bottle. These 330ml black glass bottles are stout and proud like our Dwarfen heroes.

In order to accommodate these new bottles we’ve worked with a local packaging firm to make the perfect custom box for them. Our square boxes carry within them 16 little bottles of joy and feature our distinctive new artwork on the side to leave no doubt who these epic brews are from.

It's only fitting then that our new ales, bottles and boxes are completed by labels featuring the latest artwork for each Dwarfen Ale in our 2017 range, printed for us by an award winning local firm. Every bottle is numbered and dated by hand for the personal touch.

How can I help the Dwarfs?

We need to raise a minimum of £5,000.

That allows us to finance the initial investment in equipment and materials needed to kickstart our fantastic range of bottled beers. Some of these items are essential, like bottles, others, such as labelling machines, are there to make the process efficient and cost effective.

What are the essentials?

  • A year's worth of custom Fownes Brewing bottle boxes: £700

We designed these ourselves to snuggly fit our unique choice of bottles. The boxes went through a prototyping stage and are manufactured by local company Kilby Packaging. 

  • Three months worth of our new stubby 330ml bottle: £600

We’ve spent years going around trade shows and trawling through catalogues trying to find a bottle that perfectly matches our brand and we believe this is it. The bottle fits beautifully in the palm of your hand and makes a visual statement when sitting on the shelf. Being made from black glass also provides an extra level of protection against UV light to the beer inside. They come from the Netherlands on a pallet carrying 3355 bottles.

  • Enough labels for three months of bottling: £700

We’ve always produced our own artwork, it’s one of the perks of the job. After numerous tests we settled upon what we believe is a design that has a strong graphic element in keeping with today's market place but also shows off the imagery created for each beer. The design was inspired by 80’s horror and sci-fi novel covers, tying together with the storytelling theme. The label material is textured paper with a matt varnish. They are printed by an award winning local company CS Labels.

  • An eight month supply of black crown caps: £100

We’re not going to lie. In an ideal world we’d love to have custom printed crown caps on all of our bottles. However, when the minimum order quantity is over 100,000, it gets a bit silly. So we tested all of the available caps and decided that a black cap looks awesome on a black bottle.

How will you increase efficiency?

  • A new labelling machine enabling us to apply labels three times faster: £500

The labelling machine we’ve chosen is a semi automatic device that uses sensors to stop the label in-between bottles. Once we get into the groove we should be able to apply 40 to 50 labels a minute.

  • New bench mounted crown capper: £100

An Italian made manual crown capping machine which can be found in most microbreweries who do their own bottling and arguably the most important piece of equipment. If the crown cap isn’t on correctly then the beer is going to lose carbonation and maybe even leak! 

  • Professional bottling machine, allowing us to fill more bottles at a time: £2300

This is the big ticket item. A high quality stainless steel syphon filling machine is ideal for the bottle conditioned ales we're aiming to produce. With six filling heads this piece of kit will allow us to fill three times as many bottles at a time as we currently can. 

 

What do I get out of all of this?

The most important and priceless thing that you will get is the life long gratitude of the Dwarfs (worth approximately 300 years of gratitude, none transferable.) Oh, and you'll also get some beer.

We’ve put together some great perks that we’re thrilled about sharing with you. 

  • A Case of Dwarfen Ale

This is the main perk that we want you to walk away with. It will look beautiful and taste amazing. Here’s what to expect:

16 bottles of our finest ales, presented in our custom designed box, containing: 

Frost Hammer
4.6% Pale Ale

Pale, like a winters morn. Flashes of citrus and battles.

Forged from the heart of the heavens themselves, a weapon born of tragedy and destined to leave it’s mark on the most infamous of Sagas.

Classic American hops bring bags of grapefruit and citrus flavour to our palest of ales.

x3 bottles.

Firebeard's Favourite No.5 
5.0% Crimson Ale

Crimson, as his beard. Tour de force of malt.

Epic ales are not simply plucked from thin air, and Master Brewer Broddr Firebeard is not ashamed to let folk know how much hard work went into perfecting his eponymous ale!

A diverse malt bill adds layers of complexity and depth to this wondrous crimson ale, all tied together by a subtle, fruity hop profile.

x3 bottles.

King Korvak's Saga
5.4% Porter

Epically dark, rich & smooth. Chocolate & roast.

A prince, a prophecy and a shadow from the East. Hear ye now the tale of poor King Korvak…

Our signature porter, celebrated and awarded across the Midlands as the finest porter in the land. The complex roast and coffee flavours are suitably balanced by it’s bitterness and subtle earthy hop flavours.

x3 bottles.

Visions of Heresy 
5.7% Smoked Rye IPA

Smoke clears, rye appears, descends into hoppy madness.

The prophecies of Korvak’s youth are being fulfilled, but who will betray him?

Combining the spice of rye with a subtle smokiness, the rich depth of maltiness of this ale is complimented by big fruity, floral and citrus hop flavours.

x3 bottles.

Hand of Doom 
8.2% DIPA

Be led away to a world of bitterness & citrus ruination.

As the Troll Wars grind to a stalemate, an ancient and devastating weapon will change the course of history.

Everything about this beer is big, from it’s effect on the Troll Wars down to it’s big malt backbone which supports a big bitterness and more hops than in any of our other beers. This Double IPA has flavours of grapefruit, orange and lemon with an underlying floral quality.

x2 bottles.

Korvak’s Saga - Chapter IV: Downfall 
9.0% Baltic Porter

Descent into the deep black chasm. Bold. Complex.

All sagas must end, but not all endings are happy. As the Troll Wars come to a head, the Dwarfs are caught off guard by a bold assault directly against the Ulfsburg.

What better way to bring the saga to a close than with a monstrous 9.0% Baltic variation on our porters. Blending seven different malts to deliver a bold and complex flavour with hidden depths of roast, coffee, chocolate and smoke.

x2 bottles.

All of our bottled beers are bottle conditioned and vegan friendly. They are unfiltered, unpasteurised, living creatures and should be treated with care and respect. But mainly drunk.

 

  • Delightful Dwarfen Discount Card

We know some of you won’t be able to get enough of our bottled beers. You may even want to share them with others who don’t yet know how fantastic Dwarfen Ale is. So this perk is a big deal. With your Delightful Dwarfen Discount card you get an Epic 20% saving on all bottle beer bought directly from us at the brewery.

That's the equivalent of 3 free bottles in every case you buy.  

You’d save £8.83 on a case of the award winning King Korvak's Saga, which adds up to over £100 if you bought a case a month during the twelve months its valid.

Throughout the year we'll have 16 different beers available in bottle including our Core, Special, Limited and Saga Editions. Some of these will be exclusively available in bottles and you'll get first refusal on all of them.

  • Dwarfen Goblets and T-shirts

Want to show your love and represent the Fownes Brewery when out in the world? This perk is for you.

Exclusive to this campaign, this single print run of newly designed t-shirts will feature the artwork from our boxes. We will have previews of the t-shirt during the campaign.

Our new Dwarfen Goblets will be specially selected 2/3 pint glasses, lavishly decorated and perfect for enjoying a bottle of Fownes ale. Mock ups will be featured during updates of the campaign. 

(Men's and women's fit t-shirts will be available in a range of sizes. We'll contact you once the campaign is running to ask your preference.)

  • A Brewery Tour

This is one of the big ones. You and five friends will come to the brewery for some one on one time with the brewer, Tom. He’ll tell you all about the Dwarfs and their sagas while James explains about the brewing process. You’ll get chance to see, smell and touch all the raw ingredients while drinking plenty of samples. James will be in touch to arrange for a date that suits you and your friends.

  • Brewer for a Day

It’s not often we let people into the brewery to help out. But you could be one of the lucky few. When you’ve finished your hard day's work we’ll give you the fruits of your labour to have in a cask for an event of your choice. How often are you going to get the chance to say to your friends that you brewed your own beer at a commercial brewery and it has been drunk by hundreds of people across the land? James will get in touch to arrange a mutually agreeable date for you to come to the brewery, and Tom will work with you to develop a recipe.

How will you get the Perks to me?

You're going to have to come to us I'm afraid. But it's okay, we'll shake your hand, maybe even give you a hug and a cup of tea to show our appreciation. If we can get enough people together at the same time we might even have a bit of a knees up. If you can't get to us and you're local we'll endeavour to deliver the perks to you. And if they need posting, well we'll cross that bridge when we come to it.

What happens if we don’t raise enough money?

In the unfortunate event that we don’t find enough people to contribute to our campaign, the money raised will be directed to the items of equipment listed. The raw materials while a large initial outlay for us will eventually recoup their costs when they're sold. The equipment however is more difficult to finance. Your contribution will go towards providing us with the tools to produce bottled beer for years to come.

Why do you need my help?

That’s a great question. If the Fownes Brewing Co produces such wonderful beer, surely it’s making lots of money and can fund bottling itself?

That would be a wonderful position to be in, but we’re not. Even now the physical volume of beer we produce is still very small compared to a lot of breweries and the profit doesn’t allow us to invest in big purchases like the ones proposed in this campaign. Most of the time the money we make goes into incremental improvements in the brewhouse to consistently improve the quality of the beer we produce and replace ageing equipment.

By helping us you’re making a huge impact on a small business. We know we’ve got something special that needs to reach a wider audience but we need our fans to lend us a hand, show us they believe in what we’re doing and show the world why they are right.

I’m sold! How else can I help?

We wouldn’t have made it this far if it wasn’t for our fans spreading the word about the great beers we produce and the stories we tell. And now we need you to do it again. Please share this campaign, shout about it, write about it, tell everyone who trusts your opinion and you think would like to be a part of the Fownes Brewery’s latest adventure. 
 

Thank you,

James & Thomas Fownes

You may even want to share them with others who don’t yet know how fantastic Dwarfen Ale is. So this perk is a big deal. Some of these will be exclusively available in bottles and you'll get first refusal on all of them.Dwarfen Goblets and T-shirtsWant to show your love and represent the Fownes Brewery when out in the world? This perk is for you.Exclusive to this campaign, this single print run of newly designed t-shirts will feature the artwork from our boxes. We will have previews of the t-shirt during the campaign.Our new Dwarfen Goblets will be specially selected 2/3 pint glasses, lavishly decorated and perfect for enjoying a bottle of Fownes ale. Mock ups will be featured during updates of the campaign. (Men's and women's fit t-shirts will be available in a range of sizes. We'll contact you once the campaign is running to ask your preference.)A Brewery TourThis is one of the big ones. You and five friends will come to the brewery for some one on one time with the brewer, Tom. He’ll tell you all about the Dwarfs and their sagas while James explains about the brewing process. You’ll get chance to see, smell and touch all the raw ingredients while drinking plenty of samples. James will be in touch to arrange for a date that suits you and your friends.Brewer for a DayIt’s not often we let people into the brewery to help out. But you could be one of the lucky few. When you’ve finished your hard day's work we’ll give you the fruits of your labour to have in a cask for an event of your choice. How often are you going to get the chance to say to your friends that you brewed your own beer at a commercial brewery and it has been drunk by hundreds of people across the land? James will get in touch to arrange a mutually agreeable date for you to come to the brewery, and Tom will work with you to develop a recipe.How will you get the Perks to me?You're going to have to come to us I'm afraid. But it's okay, we'll shake your hand, maybe even give you a hug and a cup of tea to show our appreciation. If we can get enough people together at the same time we might even have a bit of a knees up. If you can't get to us and you're local we'll endeavour to deliver the perks to you. And if they need posting, well we'll cross that bridge when we come to it.What happens if we don’t raise enough money?In the unfortunate event that we don’t find enough people to contribute to our campaign, the money raised will be directed to the items of equipment listed. The raw materials while a large initial outlay for us will eventually recoup their costs when they're sold. The equipment however is more difficult to finance. Your contribution will go towards providing us with the tools to produce bottled beer for years to come.Why do you need my help?That’s a great question. If the Fownes Brewing Co produces such wonderful beer, surely it’s making lots of money and can fund bottling itself?That would be a wonderful position to be in, but we’re not. Even now the physical volume of beer we produce is still very small compared to a lot of breweries and the profit doesn’t allow us to invest in big purchases like the ones proposed in this campaign. Most of the time the money we make goes into incremental improvements in the brewhouse to consistently improve the quality of the beer we produce and replace ageing equipment.By helping us you’re making a huge impact on a small business. We know we’ve got something special that needs to reach a wider audience but we need our fans to lend us a hand, show us they believe in what we’re doing and show the world why they are right.I’m sold! How else can I help?We wouldn’t have made it this far if it wasn’t for our fans spreading the word about the great beers we produce and the stories we tell. And now we need you to do it again. Please share this campaign, shout about it, write about it, tell everyone who trusts your opinion and you think would like to be a part of the Fownes Brewery’s latest adventure.  Thank you,James & Thomas Fownes

story:
Check out the awesome ice cream perks and if you like one, click the contribute now button!  

  • Perk 1: Cute Mini: buy 5, get 1 free mini scoops
  • Perk 2: Cute Single: buy 5, get 1 free single scoops
  • Perk 3: Take it to Go!: buy 3 pints, get $1 off of each
  • Perk 4: Mini Joy: buy 10, get 2 free mini scoops
  • Perk 5: Single Joy: buy 10, get 2 free single scoops
  • Perk 6: Single Joy with Shirt: buy 10, get 2 free single scoops & 1/2 off a shirt
  • Perk 7: Single Joy with Bag: buy 10, get 2 free single scoops & $5 off a bag
  • Perk 8: Cute Mini Small Gift Pack: 30 mini scoops for the price of 25
  • Perk 9: Cute Single Small Gift Pack: 30 single scoops for the price of 25
  • Other perks: double scoops, shirts, bags, gift packs, ice cream parties, taste testing, and creating your own flavor!

I need your help to open a store!  Preorder artisan ice cream, vegan flavors, and more!  I <3 JOY!!!  Keep reading for the whole story...

Hi, I’m Marissa Joy Flynn and yes, Ice Cream Joy is named after me!  I live in Lakewood, Ohio and no longer want to drive out of this beautiful city to go somewhere and buy some super extra delicious small batch homemade ice cream.  Plus, my freezer at home is too small to store all of my different flavors all the time and I love a good variety!  I get joy out of sharing the ice cream that I make using simple ingredients that people know how to spell and don’t have to look up in a dictionary.  I have noticed for a while that this city, and especially Madison Avenue, is in need of a cute little artisan ice cream shop and that is exactly what I intend to put in.  I even found a great place for it, right next to an adorable candy and brownie shop, what could be better?!  This campaign will help make this awesome dream a reality.  The space is not already set up as a kitchen, so I have a lot of work to do to be ready in time for opening in the spring! 

What We Need & What You Get

With your contributions, I will be able to pay for plumbing, electrical, flooring, paint, a dipping cabinet, a commercial fridge and freezer, and so much more!  This will be pretty expensive and I am starting my campaign out at $15,000 to try to obtain funding for at least the first chunk of what I need to do here.  If I happen to raise $45,000, that would be amazing and I should be able to do everything I need to open the store!  

In return for your generous contributions, you can get some really awesome perks!  Every contributor will get a punch card good for the number of scoops or pints of ice cream listed (this varies by amount contributed) and can be used for up to a year after the store’s grand opening.  People who are able to donate more can also get an Ice Cream Joy shirt, messenger bag, or both.  And, if you are able to contribute even more, you can even be an official taste tester for a year, get an ice cream party, and/or get to help develop your own favorite flavor!  The more you contribute and the more you share with your friends so they can contribute, the better positioned I will be for a great opening where you can enjoy some really delicious ice cream.  And, as much as I would love to reach my entire goal, if it doesn’t happen, I will still use every dollar you contribute to make this store a reality and will stretch it all as far as I can!

Help support the creation of a local store by pre-ordering ice cream and merchandise and give the gift of ice cream and joy to your friends and family!!!  My goal is to open the store in spring of 2015 and it will definitely be open in time for next summer, so you will not have to wait long to enjoy!  Did I mention that the perks are basically pre-orders of ice cream for when the store opens?  And that the timing of this could not be better for the holidays?!  Here are some examples of flavors you might find at the store, and the possibilities are endless...

The Impact

Ice Cream Joy is already a small business located in Cleveland, Ohio offering artisan flavors of ice cream using local milk and cream from happy grass-eating cows, fresh fruit sorbets and ices, and creamy dreamy delicious vegan flavors.  Currently, we sell pre-portioned scoops at Susy's Soup in Tower City downtown.

On a personal note... I seem to have a near obsession with making stuff from scratch. So, I don't just go to the store, buy a mix of pre-made stuff, put it in my machine, and out comes artisan ice cream and sorbet.  I take the time to find the right real ingredients and mix them together myself to have the best flavor possible. I don't add preservatives (unless you count sugar) or fillers and I produce in super small batches.  I'm proud to be from Cleveland and Ohio and will work more and more over time to buy local from the awesome people in this great urban area and wonderful state.  And the more I can buy local, the better: it helps the environment to have food travel less and it helps the local economy thrive!

Risks & Challenges

Starting a business is always risky.  Things do not always work the way I plan or hope for, but that does not mean I give up.  Just the opposite, each hurdle I face pushes me harder to achieve my goals.  My persistence and perseverance even in the face of obstacles allows me to make things happen.  And I am more than willing to adjust my goals and work with others as needed to make this work (e.g. modifying flavors, adjusting store plans for government regulation, etc.).  

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are not able to contribute financially, I could really use your help to get the word out to your friends and their friends!  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools, broadcast this crowdfunding campaign on social media, or talk to people about what I am doing to help me make this store a reality!

Also, if you live in the area and happen to have some furniture that you want to get rid of, I would be happy to look at it and see if it would work within the store!

Perk FAQs

Can I get my rewards before the store opens?

Yes and no… I can get you your punch cards and apparel before the store opens, but you would need to wait for the store to open before you can get the ice cream, sorry!


What do you get as a taste tester? 

In addition to the scoops listed, you will get to try each and every new flavor when it is made.  We will set aside a mini scoop for you for each one.  You will be notified when they are made so you can come in.  Oh, and did I mention that since you likely have never tried any of the flavors, you will have to catch up a lot at the beginning (or choose to spread it out over time)!

I don’t live near Lakewood, Ohio; how can I get my rewards?

You have to physically come into the store to get the ice cream, sorry, I am not shipping ice cream at this time (kind of defeats the local movement)!!!

I don’t live near Lakewood, Ohio; can I give my rewards to someone else?

Absolutely!  Any of the perks you get can be given as gifts! 

Can I redeem my reward for cash later? 

Sorry, the rewards are not redeemable for cash.

Whoa, how do I help develop my favorite flavor?

This will be an evolving thing that we figure out together.  My initial thought is that I will have you come into the store, we can start with a discussion of the foods you like to eat, you can try the flavors I have, and we can come up with something together to try out.  Since it might not be 100% right the first time, we can try up to 2 more times.  You can have the entire batch of ice cream that we make each time (minus a small tasting fee for me!), the recipe, and lots of fun!  Also, I fully plan to make at least one batch of the final product to sell at the store and will continue with it if it does well!

What kind of messenger bag and shirts are there?

It is an Authentic Pigment-Dyed Canvas Field Bag.  There are different shirts available for men, women, and youth (I will get information from you as to which style and size you want).  Each one has the “I <3 JOY” take on the logo shown below.

Do the perks expire?

Yes, the perks will expire a year after the store opens, or March 31, 2016, whichever comes later.

What happens if the store never opens?

This is not going to happen!  Since I am a realist and I know that you might be concerned, I will also say that even if something goes horribly horrendously wrong, your perks will still be fulfilled 100%, even if I have to drive ice cream to people's homes!

Other FAQs

What does the character 樂in the logo stand for?

It translates to joy, more specifically to being happy, glad, amused, or cheerful or that something is enjoyable or fun.  All of these remind me of eating ice cream!

Where will the store be located?

I just signed the lease for 15210 Madison Avenue in Lakewood, Ohio.  This spot just so happens to be next door to a gourmet brownie and chocolate store, Fear's Confections, that is completely awesome.  And that store is right next door to Elmwood Bakery, where we got our wedding cake!  It has been called a Trifecta of Sweets by a few people now, just based on the delicious idea!

Do you have other plans for the store?

That's a fantastic question!  I have a ton of plans including incorporating art with the artisan ice cream, flavor passports, warm drinks and potentially made-to-order artisan soft pretzels for the cold months, a kids area, collaborating with my dessert-dishing neighbors, and so much more.  Follow Ice Cream Joy on FaceBook and Twitter or keep an eye on the website to see how everything else shapes up!

Is it good?

It is delicious!  Every time I try a flavor that I make I am amazed by how good it tastes!  You will definitely empty your bowl!

                    

Oh no, your campaign expired and I didn't get to take advantage of your great perks!  Can I still order them?

Send me an email at iScreamJoy@gmail.com and we can figure something out.  If the store is already open, come on in!

Your ice cream sounds amazing, when will you be open?!?!

Yay!  Thanks for the compliment and for asking!  I hope to open by the spring of 2015 and will definitely be open by the summer of 2015!!!!  If you just cannot wait to try some of these awesome flavors, some of them are already available at Susy's Soup in Tower City downtown (same level as the food court, opposite end, near the lower indoor entrance to the casino).  Check the website for flavors!

What will the store look like?

If you're a good artist, don't look too closely and find all my drawing flaws...  Here's the plan so far!

story:
Our names are Merelis and Ysanet, and we are Woke Foods -- a women-owned cooperative that taps into the healing traditions of Dominican food! We are NYC’s first Dominican vegan food business and we cater events, create and share recipes on our website, host cooking classes, and soon will offer meal planning. We love food, specifically Dominican food, and wholeheartedly believe that food is our medicine! Woke Foods is the way we bring nutritious foods to our people. We talk about our collective ancestral connection to food, and share vegan and vegetarian Dominican food practices with our community. Since creating Woke Foods we see and experience the need for socially conscious, nutritious, and culturally respectful foods made by us and for us. We are clear on how politics deeply influences our personal lives, particularly our relationship with food and the land. Our vision is to reconnect people with the knowledge they already have within themselves to nourish themselves and our communities in a way that honors our Mother Earth. We have created this crowdfunding campaign to expand our current team and get our business off the ground to better serve all of you. We are truly grateful for all the love we have received from you all these past few weeks and look forward to what we get to create together!

 

Background

 

In May 2016, Ysanet quit her non-profit job to focus more on work that addresses racism and systems of oppression, shortly after Woke Foods was born. Ysanet who had been cooking for most of her life, began to see the intersection of food, health, and race, and how our current food system was negatively impacting the health of our black and brown communities. Woke Foods began to address these issues by offering food that was healthy and culturally relevant in the form of meal planning and catering. As Woke Foods was embraced by these communities, the need for this work became increasingly apparent and necessary. When the opportunity to enroll in Green Workers Cooperative Co-op Academy, a development program that guides and aides people of color to launch cooperative businesses, Ysanet immediately thought of an ideal business partner to grow the business, Merelis Catalina Ortiz. For several years, Merelis worked in food justice, facilitating cooking classes, studying traditional Dominican food practices, and developing relationships with gardeners, farmers and food educators. In 2015, Merelis and Ysanet connected at a women’s circle gathering in Washington Heights. They quickly realized their shared values and interests for community, self-love, love for black and brown people, and a commitment to using food as a tool for liberation. Together, Merelis and Ysanet have developed the business and vision to create what Woke Foods is today.

 

In Febraury 2017, Woke Foods graduated from Green Workers Cooperative’ Co-op Academy, and formed as a green cooperative business. This piece is important to Woke Foods because the business is part of a movement that is much larger than themselves. A movement working towards food sovereignty (where all people exercise the right to control our own food systems), building a strong local economy within the Bronx and Northern Manhattan rooted in democracy and environmental justice.

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT?

 

In the past year, we have accomplished more than we imagined. This includes:

 
  • Catering for over a dozen events
  • Facilitating cooking classes online and in-person
  • Selling foods, through our Food Pop-Ups, at events throughout the five boroughs of NYC
  • Registering as a Limited Liability Company (a cooperative) in New York State
  • Launching our website and sharing recipes
  • Featured on Harlem Focus via Medium, Blavity and Vibe Viva
  • Pulling all our resources together! We have used our limited savings, food stamps, and generous support from our family, friends, and community to bring this business into fruition
 

We recognize that for Woke Foods to meet the demands of our people, we need a bigger team with the skills and knowledge to offer more cooking classes, catering services, and meal planning services throughout the Bronx, Northern Manhattan, and eventually the rest of New York City. We plan to expand our current team of 2 to a team of 10 people by the end of the year. In order to do this, we need your support! The money raised will go to the following:

  • Rental of a commercial kitchen
  • Food Handler’s Certification for new co-op members
  • Kitchen equipment and supplies for catering, cooking classes, and meal plans (i.e. knife sets, chafing dishes, aprons, biodegradable supplies, etc.)
  • Free cooking classes for low-income people living in the Bronx and Northern Manhattan
  • Purchase a safe and reliable van to deliver food, shop for ingredients, transport supplies, etc.
  • Launch our training program for new co-op members that includes cooking/culinary skills and food sovereignty workshops
  • Video equipment to create educational cooking videos
  • Start writing a cookbook
  • Develop business relationships with local and international ethical food producers
 

What happens if we surpass or don’t meet our goal?

 

We will continue to make this work happen by any means necessary, no matter the campaigns outcome. When we surpass our goal we will begin to train our new members, develop content for you all, and get to working! If we happen to not meet our goal then we will continue to look at creative ways to raise the funds we need to accomplish the aforementioned.

 

Other ways you can support:

 

Please share this page with your family, friends, neighbors, and your peoples. As the famous saying goes, “We are our ancestors wildest dreams”. With your help we are feeding minds, feeding souls, and feeding bellies. Thank you for reading, for your love, support, and for embarking on this journey with us.

 

About Woke Foods Co-Owners, Merelis and Ysanet  

 

Our names are Merelis and Ysanet, we are Afro-indigenous Dominican women, guided by our African and Indigenous roots and ancestors.

 

I am Merelis Catalina, a Afro-indígena Dominicana. I was born and raised in Queens, NY; my motherland the Dominican Republic (DR). I stayed connected to DR by visiting family during the summer every two years. I graduated from the City College of New York, where I discovered my passion for food sovereignty and studied the connection between culture and food. The past five years, I have worked with the Northern Manhattan community around nutrition education, to speak on ways food is medicine. In 2015, I graduated from Black and Latinx Farmers Immersion program. Today I work as a wellness organizer, where I help organize schools and early childhood centers bring wellness to their spaces in a culturally respectful way.  I am guided and inspired by my community of powerful and loving black and brown people. I am the living legacy of my ancestors and family, who have and continue to nourish and heal community through food.

I am Ysanet and I am a queer Afro-Dominicana, born in Harlem, NY. I was raised in between the Dominican Republic and Hialeah, FL. I spent my childhood in Santo Domingo, DR playing in my grandmother’s garden, then moved to Florida. I graduated from Johnson & Wales University in Providence, RI and spent a couple of years working in major hotel companies before transitioning to community based work. Today, I live and work in the Bronx as a nutrition and food justice educator for bilingual middle school students. My passions include holistic cooking, farming, writing, community organizing, and making homemade products. I am inspired by the power and magic of black and brown people, the ocean, and the Now. I am currently a student at Farm School NYC earning a certificate in Urban Agriculture.
story_txt:
Our names are Merelis and Ysanet, and we are Woke Foods -- a women-owned cooperative that taps into the healing traditions of Dominican food! We are NYC’s first Dominican vegan food business and we cater events, create and share recipes on our website, host cooking classes, and soon will offer meal planning. We love food, specifically Dominican food, and wholeheartedly believe that food is our medicine! Woke Foods is the way we bring nutritious foods to our people. We talk about our collective ancestral connection to food, and share vegan and vegetarian Dominican food practices with our community. Since creating Woke Foods we see and experience the need for socially conscious, nutritious, and culturally respectful foods made by us and for us. We are clear on how politics deeply influences our personal lives, particularly our relationship with food and the land. Our vision is to reconnect people with the knowledge they already have within themselves to nourish themselves and our communities in a way that honors our Mother Earth. We have created this crowdfunding campaign to expand our current team and get our business off the ground to better serve all of you. We are truly grateful for all the love we have received from you all these past few weeks and look forward to what we get to create together! Background In May 2016, Ysanet quit her non-profit job to focus more on work that addresses racism and systems of oppression, shortly after Woke Foods was born. Ysanet who had been cooking for most of her life, began to see the intersection of food, health, and race, and how our current food system was negatively impacting the health of our black and brown communities. Woke Foods began to address these issues by offering food that was healthy and culturally relevant in the form of meal planning and catering. As Woke Foods was embraced by these communities, the need for this work became increasingly apparent and necessary. When the opportunity to enroll in Green Workers Cooperative Co-op Academy, a development program that guides and aides people of color to launch cooperative businesses, Ysanet immediately thought of an ideal business partner to grow the business, Merelis Catalina Ortiz. For several years, Merelis worked in food justice, facilitating cooking classes, studying traditional Dominican food practices, and developing relationships with gardeners, farmers and food educators. In 2015, Merelis and Ysanet connected at a women’s circle gathering in Washington Heights. They quickly realized their shared values and interests for community, self-love, love for black and brown people, and a commitment to using food as a tool for liberation. Together, Merelis and Ysanet have developed the business and vision to create what Woke Foods is today. In Febraury 2017, Woke Foods graduated from Green Workers Cooperative’ Co-op Academy, and formed as a green cooperative business. This piece is important to Woke Foods because the business is part of a movement that is much larger than themselves. A movement working towards food sovereignty (where all people exercise the right to control our own food systems), building a strong local economy within the Bronx and Northern Manhattan rooted in democracy and environmental justice. WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT? In the past year, we have accomplished more than we imagined. This includes: 
Catering for over a dozen events
Facilitating cooking classes online and in-person
Selling foods, through our Food Pop-Ups, at events throughout the five boroughs of NYC
Registering as a Limited Liability Company (a cooperative) in New York State
Launching our website and sharing recipes
Featured on Harlem Focus via Medium, Blavity and Vibe Viva
Pulling all our resources together! We have used our limited savings, food stamps, and generous support from our family, friends, and community to bring this business into fruition
 We recognize that for Woke Foods to meet the demands of our people, we need a bigger team with the skills and knowledge to offer more cooking classes, catering services, and meal planning services throughout the Bronx, Northern Manhattan, and eventually the rest of New York City. We plan to expand our current team of 2 to a team of 10 people by the end of the year. In order to do this, we need your support! The money raised will go to the following:

Rental of a commercial kitchen
Food Handler’s Certification for new co-op members
Kitchen equipment and supplies for catering, cooking classes, and meal plans (i.e. knife sets, chafing dishes, aprons, biodegradable supplies, etc.)
Free cooking classes for low-income people living in the Bronx and Northern Manhattan
Purchase a safe and reliable van to deliver food, shop for ingredients, transport supplies, etc.
Launch our training program for new co-op members that includes cooking/culinary skills and food sovereignty workshops
Video equipment to create educational cooking videos
Start writing a cookbook
Develop business relationships with local and international ethical food producers
 What happens if we surpass or don’t meet our goal? We will continue to make this work happen by any means necessary, no matter the campaigns outcome. When we surpass our goal we will begin to train our new members, develop content for you all, and get to working! If we happen to not meet our goal then we will continue to look at creative ways to raise the funds we need to accomplish the aforementioned.
 
Other ways you can support: Please share this page with your family, friends, neighbors, and your peoples. As the famous saying goes, “We are our ancestors wildest dreams”. With your help we are feeding minds, feeding souls, and feeding bellies. Thank you for reading, for your love, support, and for embarking on this journey with us. About Woke Foods Co-Owners, Merelis and Ysanet   Our names are Merelis and Ysanet, we are Afro-indigenous Dominican women, guided by our African and Indigenous roots and ancestors.
 
I am Merelis Catalina, a Afro-indígena Dominicana. I was born and raised in Queens, NY; my motherland the Dominican Republic (DR). I stayed connected to DR by visiting family during the summer every two years. I graduated from the City College of New York, where I discovered my passion for food sovereignty and studied the connection between culture and food. The past five years, I have worked with the Northern Manhattan community around nutrition education, to speak on ways food is medicine. In 2015, I graduated from Black and Latinx Farmers Immersion program. Today I work as a wellness organizer, where I help organize schools and early childhood centers bring wellness to their spaces in a culturally respectful way.  I am guided and inspired by my community of powerful and loving black and brown people. I am the living legacy of my ancestors and family, who have and continue to nourish and heal community through food.
I am Ysanet and I am a queer Afro-Dominicana, born in Harlem, NY. I was raised in between the Dominican Republic and Hialeah, FL. I spent my childhood in Santo Domingo, DR playing in my grandmother’s garden, then moved to Florida. I graduated from Johnson & Wales University in Providence, RI and spent a couple of years working in major hotel companies before transitioning to community based work. Today, I live and work in the Bronx as a nutrition and food justice educator for bilingual middle school students. My passions include holistic cooking, farming, writing, community organizing, and making homemade products. I am inspired by the power and magic of black and brown people, the ocean, and the Now. I am currently a student at Farm School NYC earning a certificate in Urban Agriculture.

story:
As I was growing up, my mom had the most beautiful vegetable garden in our backyard. She grew everything from carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, celery, onion, you name it! She loved learning about what crops to grow, companion planting, and pest management. Year after year, she'd get a good bounty of carrots! In fact, I would not eat them unless they were grown by my mom. Over the years, her love for growing food continued, but as life got busy and her kids began busy lives, she stopped growing in her vegetable garden and focussed on her flowers, storing away her love and passion for vegetables.

With the bounty of her backyard garden and trips to her favourite vendors at the market, mom had a passion for canning and preserving food. Some of the fondest memories I have of my mom are strawberry picking, visiting Stryck's Farm, and celebrating my birthday traditon of apple picking each year! She'd preserve an abundance of pickles, green tomato relish, pickled beets, strawberry jam, apple sauce, and peaches! Some years, she would even shuck peas by hand, blanch them, and freeze them. Mom loved to make food for her family, but most of all, she loved to see the smiling faces as people enjoyed her food. She would often send friends and family jars of preserves home.

Two years ago, mom moved to my brother's farm and began to grow a larger garden there. Seeing her in the garden again was one of the most incredible feelings in the world. She was so happy and proud of the food she grew and was even more so excited to share it with everyone around her! We began to dream of starting a mobile certified kitchen to do all of her preserves with farm-fresh vegetables from both her garden and our veggies at Wayward Farm. This way, we could share the love and bounty she grew with even more people.

Unfortunately, in summer of 2021, mom was diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer. Her energy was low and she wasn't able to get in her garden to grow her vegetables. Some of mom's friends were able to help! They planted half of her garden with corn, squash, beans, potatoes, pickling cucumbers, beets, tomatoes, pumpkins, onions, and peppers. All in hopes that mom would be able to spend time in the garden, tending, harvesting, and doing her favourite part, preserving. As quickly as things grew, mom's health declined. She spent a lot of time by the garden, but didn't get the opportunity to make any preserves before passing away on September 4th, 2021.

In honour of my mom, I would like to plant a perennial garden with apple trees, rhubarb, strawberries, raspberries, asparagus, and a large perennial herb garden. I hope to continue her traditions with my daughters, inspiring them to grow their own food, preserve it, and share it as much as possible!
