story:
Tacos & Tequila
BBQ & Bourbon

Hello Friends, I am Sean Hopkins.
You can call me "Hoppy".

I just love Food, Fun, Family and Friends, and connecting the dots from my passions to people is everything I'm all about.  Since I can't just have everyone over to the house for Tacos & BBQ . . . I'm trying to bring this passion to the People of my hometown of Amesbury, Massachusetts. 

I've got some super tasty TEX-MEX treats in mind, like bodacious beef ribs, that go way beyond your typical taco joint and I can't wait to share them with you!

See . . . I ran a successful restaurant in New Hampshire for the last 8 years and recently closed up shop in order to focus on opening Hoppy's Cantina in a historic building in downtown Amesbury. 

When we closed our doors we found jobs for our key people, and got to say "Thank you very much" to many of our loyal friends with a wonderful farewell party.  We closed up right and I'm really proud.  Though it was hard to close something I worked so hard on for 8+ years . . . I knew I had to do it if I wanted to make my Taco & BBQ Dream come true here in Amesbury. 

So here we are ready to make it "Hoppen" and I gotta tell you, I really love living in Amesbury.  I am thrilled to become a vibrant part of the community and our future. I'm looking forward to furthering the relationships we've already established within The 'Bury and want to be a part of making Amesbury a destination!


Here's where you can help.  The building we're going into is a small charming brick and morter space with beautiful floor to ceiling windows.  We're right in the down town rotary section with a great view of the down town area, in walking distance of so many friends and businesses . . . our space is great but really needs some work.  Your contributions will help Hoppy's Cantina Bring Tacos to the People!

What do we need your help with?

  • BUILD A BETTER BAR
    There is currently a bar in place, but it is very small with only 6 usable bar stools with no back rests. We're going to have to totally break down and remove the old bar. Naturally, we will be redesigning a bigger and better bar with new materials. We're designing a centralized horseshoe-shaped bar with approximately 20 stools with backs and maybe a dozen taps to compliment our Tequila, Bourbon and Margarita selection.

     
  • DESIGN A KILLER KITCHEN
    With a Tex-Mex menu in mind, We're going to totally need to redesign the kitchen. We're going to have to bring in some specialized equipment (like a smoker and buffalo chopper) because we want to offer some really unique things like authentic low and slow smoked BBQ along with Fresh Salsa and unique Tex-Mex treats like Gator Bites and Sausage bombs!  As with any kitchen refresh, you never know what we're going to find when we dig into it.
     
  • INVIGORATE THE INTERIOR
    We really love this space and think it can be amazing! Since we're totally rebuilding the bar, we have the opportunity to do some super cool things like reinvigorate the brick walls, give the floor a new treatment and implement a brand new Sound, Paint & Light scheme. We want this place to feel like you're on vacation, so we're really going for A VIBE which is very much Key West, Austin Texas, Cancun and Jamaica. It's going to take a lot of work, and we're totally stoked about it!
     
  • FRESHEN THE FACADE
    This is the simplest part of what we're doing. This charming old building built in the 1800's could use a face lift, And we want you to feel Warm and "Hoppy" when you walk into our little ol' Taco Joint.

Thanks for checking out Hoppy's Cantina Campaign.  Now let's make it "Hoppen"!

*** Look at that smoked Scotch Egg with the runny Yolk! Yum!!!


What We Need & What You Get

We're anticipating a total build out cost of less than $100k.  We're hoping to raise $20k to help us get started while we're doing the build out and not generating income or contributing to the community.

100% of the funds we receive will be applied, in order, as follows:

  • BUILDING A BETTER BAR
    • Remove old bar.
    • Build new centralized horse shoe bar as focal point of the space.
  • DESIGNING A KILLER KITCHEN
    • Smoker.
    • Buffalo Chopper.
    • Replace equipment & remodel space.
  • INVIGORATING THE INTERIOR
    • Recondition & Revitalize interior brick walls.
    • Implement new schemes for sound, lighting and paint.
    • Custom tables & chairs.
  • FRESHENING THE FACADE
    • Let's give the ol' Cantina a facelift!


HOPPY HELPER PERKS

We're offering several levels of perks ranging from $10 up to $3,500 so there's a ton of ways to help!

  • $10 - Thank You.
    Every bit of sponsorship helps and is appreciate. You deserve a heartfelt ThankYou!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.

  • $25 - Pint Power.
    Pint Power to the People . . . Thank you very much!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.

  • $50 - 1 Year Membership in the Hoppy's Cantina Club.
    When you want to roll into the Cantina Like a Boss.
    -  One Year Access to the Cantina Crew VIP Rewards Program.
    -  Pre-Access to all Special Events & Dinners.
    -  25% Appetizers.
    -  10% off Entrees.
    -  $5 House Sangria Red or White.
    -  $5 House Margaritas.
    -  $1 off all Draft Beer.

  • $75 - Hoppy's Helper Pack.
    You help us get going? 
    We'll help you keep going!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  $25 Gift Card to Hoppy's Cantina.

  • $100 - Hoppy's Helper Pack.
    Half your sponsorship back AND you get to keep the stuff?
    We got your back Baby!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  $50 Gift Card to Hoppy's Cantina.

  • $250 - "TT" Tasting.
    Let's take a trip on the Tequila Trail.
    Let's eat Tacos while we're doing it!
    -  Tequila Tasting & Taco Bar.
    -  Includes up to 10 people.
    -  Limit 20.

  • $250 - Pre-Opening Party VIP.
    If you want Hoppy's Cantina in town as much as we do . . . here's a great way to let all your friends know YOU are the Real VIP!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  FREE admission for you and a guest to a special pre-opening Thank You Bash.
    -  2 Drink Tokens.
    -  FREE food.
    -  Live social media posting(s) during the event.
    -  One Year Access to the Cantina Club VIP Rewards Program.
    -  Limit 20 offers.

  • $250 - Sponsor A Bar Stool.
    Let folks know they'd be sitting on the floor if you didn't give them this nice high back comfy bar stool sit on!  #YoureTheBest
    -  Personalized name badge on the actual bar stool
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  Live social media event posting(s) during the ceremony.
    -  Limit 20.

  • $300 - Pit Master BBQ Class and Dinner.
    -  Private BBQ Class with Pit-Master Hoppy.
    Hoppy's personal pre-class consultation covers:
    -  Your BBQ experience.
    -  BBQ styles and interests.
    -  Main proteins, side dish and dessert concepts.
    Day of Event:
    -  Hands on BBQ instructional class.
    -  Prepping and Cooking real BBQ.
    -  Dinner party.
    -  Up to four people.
    -  Meal and Drinks are included.
    -  Limit 4.

  • $300 - Hoppy Hooker & Tour.
    aka:  1 Bourbon, 1 Scotch and 1 Beer.  
    aka:  John Lee Hooker Tribute Package.
    -  Private Dinner featuring foods specifically chosen to go with Bourbon, Scotch and Beer.
    -  Appetizers, Tapas, After Dinner Treat(s).
    -  Up to four people.
    -  Limit 4.

  • $300 - Design Hoppy's Drink-O-The-Month.
    Are you The Mix-Master General? 
    Well . . . Let's see what you got!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  Spend an afternoon at the bar working to design and name your custom cocktail.
    -  Note: The drink will be within the Cantina's theme, mood and style.
    -  Live social media event posting during the development process.
    -  Limit 12.

  • $500 - Sponsor A Table.
    Let people know that Terrific Table Top holding their Magnificent Margaritas wouldn't be there without your GINORMOUS Generosity!  #WeLoveOurPeeps
    -  Personalized name badge on the actual Table.
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  Live social media posting(s) during the ceremony.
    -  Limit 10.

  • $750 - Hoppy's Guest Chef
    Do you watch Iron Chef and just know you could kick their ass? Now YOU can prove it to your friends as Hoppy's Cantina Guest Chef at one of our Tequila Dinners.
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  Hoppy's Helpers T-Shirt.
    Spend an afternoon in the Cantina kitchen Helping Hoppy design a menu for one of our Tequila Themed Dinners featuring Tequila Representatives from the likes of Patrone, Sauza and Herradura.
    -  Note: The menu will be within the Cantina's theme, mood and style.
    -  Live social media posting(s) during the development process and dinner.
    -  Limit 4.

  • $3,500 - Mi Cantina - Su Cantina!
    * * * aka:  It's Your Cantina for the Night.
    Did you ever want to Own a Cantina with all the hassle of cooking, cleaning, staffing or all the red tape?  Here's your chance Big Shot!  We highly recommend a Chauffeur for The Boss!
    -  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.
    -  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
    -  Your very own pint glass to keep.
    -  Private Party for 40 people.
    -  2 Free Drink Tokens.
    -  Free Food.
    -  Live social media posting(s) during the event.
    -  Limit 4.

What if we don't reach our goal? 

No worries . . . We got this. 

We're going to start by applying our funds into the build out of the bar.  This bar is going to be the heart beat of the space so we really want to do it justice!


What does your Sponsorship Mean?

In a world of Mass-Produced BLAND . . . We have an opportunity to create a very unique experience right here in Amesbury!

I ran a Seafood & BBQ place in an invisible strip mall in New Hampshire for 8 years.  It shouldn't have worked, but it did work and you can't just do that by accident.

Now I feel the energy for Hoppy's Cantina building and I get positively giddy when I imagine what we can bring to the down town restaurant scene!

  • Tacos & Tequila.
  • BBQ & Bourbon.
  • Taco Joint meets BBQ Shack.
  • Margarita Madness.
    It's 5 O'clock somewhere!


Risks & Challenges

Friends . . . We are not going into this blind. We know the risks that come with starting a business, ESPECIALLY A RESTAURANT . . . and we are doing everything we can to understand each risk before us as we take steps to achieve success. 

We understand spreading the business into the community is even harder, and we really want to be a vibrant part of our own home town.

  • We know that the Restaurant scene in Amesbury is growing.
  • We know we make great Tacos and authentic low and slow smoked BBQ.
  • We love to share tales of the Tequila Trail and Bourbon Bank.
  • We love to connect the dots with our friends and neighborhood businesses.
  • We believe the music, paint, lights and atmosphere are a big part of the experience.
    - AND -
  • We know we can build this business.

But transforming our uinque Tex-Mex vibe from Hoppy's Cantina into a true community experience is not going to be easy. Getting people to open up to each other can be tough and we're here to HELP connect the dots. That’s why we are looking for your help in making Hoppy's a place where folks want to be.  A place where OUR friends are truly proud to bring THEIR friends, family and out of town VIPs.

This is why we hope you can be a Hoppy's Helpers and spread the good word & good vibes.

Friends . . . Let's make it epic!


And if you're not in a position to HELP now?

That's cool as life is a complex thing . . .
If you like what Hoppy's Cantina is YOU STILL CAN HELP by:

  • Spreading the good word of Hoppy's Cantina on your social media as we're on Facebook / Instagram and Twitter.  See, If your friends love you, and you love us like we love you . . . then maybe your friends will love us right back and take you to Hoppy's Cantina for dinner and drinks. Talk about a Win /Win!!!
  • You can also spread the good word through the Indiegogo share tools!

Freinds . . . can't wait to give you a FREE High Five at Hoppy's Cantina!

  -  Sean

DESIGNING A KILLER KITCHEN
Smoker.
Buffalo Chopper.
Replace equipment & remodel space.


INVIGORATING THE INTERIOR
Recondition & Revitalize interior brick walls.
Implement new schemes for sound, lighting and paint.
Custom tables & chairs.


FRESHENING THE FACADELet's give the ol' Cantina a facelift!




HOPPY HELPER PERKS
We're offering several levels of perks ranging from $10 up to $3,500 so there's a ton of ways to help!

$10 - Thank You.Every bit of sponsorship helps and is appreciate. You deserve a heartfelt ThankYou!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.
$25 - Pint Power.Pint Power to the People . . . Thank you very much!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.
$50 - 1 Year Membership in the Hoppy's Cantina Club.When you want to roll into the Cantina Like a Boss.-  One Year Access to the Cantina Crew VIP Rewards Program.-  Pre-Access to all Special Events & Dinners.-  25% Appetizers.-  10% off Entrees.-  $5 House Sangria Red or White.-  $5 House Margaritas.-  $1 off all Draft Beer.
$75 - Hoppy's Helper Pack.You help us get going? We'll help you keep going!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  $25 Gift Card to Hoppy's Cantina.
$100 - Hoppy's Helper Pack.Half your sponsorship back AND you get to keep the stuff?We got your back Baby!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  $50 Gift Card to Hoppy's Cantina.
$250 - "TT" Tasting.Let's take a trip on the Tequila Trail.Let's eat Tacos while we're doing it!-  Tequila Tasting & Taco Bar.-  Includes up to 10 people.-  Limit 20.
$250 - Pre-Opening Party VIP.If you want Hoppy's Cantina in town as much as we do . . . here's a great way to let all your friends know YOU are the Real VIP!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  FREE admission for you and a guest to a special pre-opening Thank You Bash.-  2 Drink Tokens.-  FREE food.-  Live social media posting(s) during the event.-  One Year Access to the Cantina Club VIP Rewards Program.-  Limit 20 offers.
$250 - Sponsor A Bar Stool.Let folks know they'd be sitting on the floor if you didn't give them this nice high back comfy bar stool sit on!  #YoureTheBest-  Personalized name badge on the actual bar stool-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  Live social media event posting(s) during the ceremony.-  Limit 20.
$300 - Pit Master BBQ Class and Dinner.-  Private BBQ Class with Pit-Master Hoppy.Hoppy's personal pre-class consultation covers:-  Your BBQ experience.-  BBQ styles and interests.-  Main proteins, side dish and dessert concepts.Day of Event:-  Hands on BBQ instructional class.-  Prepping and Cooking real BBQ.-  Dinner party.-  Up to four people.-  Meal and Drinks are included.-  Limit 4.
$300 - Hoppy Hooker & Tour.aka:  1 Bourbon, 1 Scotch and 1 Beer.  aka:  John Lee Hooker Tribute Package.-  Private Dinner featuring foods specifically chosen to go with Bourbon, Scotch and Beer.-  Appetizers, Tapas, After Dinner Treat(s).-  Up to four people.-  Limit 4.
$300 - Design Hoppy's Drink-O-The-Month.Are you The Mix-Master General? Well . . . Let's see what you got!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  Spend an afternoon at the bar working to design and name your custom cocktail.-  Note: The drink will be within the Cantina's theme, mood and style.-  Live social media event posting during the development process.-  Limit 12.
$500 - Sponsor A Table.Let people know that Terrific Table Top holding their Magnificent Margaritas wouldn't be there without your GINORMOUS Generosity!  #WeLoveOurPeeps-  Personalized name badge on the actual Table.-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  Live social media posting(s) during the ceremony.-  Limit 10.
$750 - Hoppy's Guest ChefDo you watch Iron Chef and just know you could kick their ass? Now YOU can prove it to your friends as Hoppy's Cantina Guest Chef at one of our Tequila Dinners.-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  Hoppy's Helpers T-Shirt.Spend an afternoon in the Cantina kitchen Helping Hoppy design a menu for one of our Tequila Themed Dinners featuring Tequila Representatives from the likes of Patrone, Sauza and Herradura.-  Note: The menu will be within the Cantina's theme, mood and style.-  Live social media posting(s) during the development process and dinner.-  Limit 4.
$3,500 - Mi Cantina - Su Cantina!* * * aka:  It's Your Cantina for the Night.Did you ever want to Own a Cantina with all the hassle of cooking, cleaning, staffing or all the red tape?  Here's your chance Big Shot!  We highly recommend a Chauffeur for The Boss!-  Personal VIDEO shout out across all our social media platforms.-  Hoppy's Cantina Sticker.-  Your very own pint glass to keep.-  Private Party for 40 people.-  2 Free Drink Tokens.-  Free Food.-  Live social media posting(s) during the event.-  Limit 4.

What if we don't reach our goal?  
No worries . . . We got this. 
We're going to start by applying our funds into the build out of the bar.  This bar is going to be the heart beat of the space so we really want to do it justice!



What does your Sponsorship Mean?
In a world of Mass-Produced BLAND . . . We have an opportunity to create a very unique experience right here in Amesbury!
I ran a Seafood & BBQ place in an invisible strip mall in New Hampshire for 8 years.  It shouldn't have worked, but it did work and you can't just do that by accident.Now I feel the energy for Hoppy's Cantina building and I get positively giddy when I imagine what we can bring to the down town restaurant scene!

Tacos & Tequila.
BBQ & Bourbon.
Taco Joint meets BBQ Shack.
Margarita Madness.It's 5 O'clock somewhere!



Risks & Challenges
Friends . . . We are not going into this blind. We know the risks that come with starting a business, ESPECIALLY A RESTAURANT . . . and we are doing everything we can to understand each risk before us as we take steps to achieve success. 
We understand spreading the business into the community is even harder, and we really want to be a vibrant part of our own home town.

We know that the Restaurant scene in Amesbury is growing.
We know we make great Tacos and authentic low and slow smoked BBQ.
We love to share tales of the Tequila Trail and Bourbon Bank.
We love to connect the dots with our friends and neighborhood businesses.
We believe the music, paint, lights and atmosphere are a big part of the experience.- AND -
We know we can build this business.

But transforming our uinque Tex-Mex vibe from Hoppy's Cantina into a true community experience is not going to be easy. Getting people to open up to each other can be tough and we're here to HELP connect the dots. That’s why we are looking for your help in making Hoppy's a place where folks want to be.  A place where OUR friends are truly proud to bring THEIR friends, family and out of town VIPs.
This is why we hope you can be a Hoppy's Helpers and spread the good word & good vibes.
Friends . . . Let's make it epic!


And if you're not in a position to HELP now?
That's cool as life is a complex thing . . .If you like what Hoppy's Cantina is YOU STILL CAN HELP by:

Spreading the good word of Hoppy's Cantina on your social media as we're on Facebook / Instagram and Twitter.  See, If your friends love you, and you love us like we love you . . . then maybe your friends will love us right back and take you to Hoppy's Cantina for dinner and drinks. Talk about a Win /Win!!!
You can also spread the good word through the Indiegogo share tools!

Freinds . . . can't wait to give you a FREE High Five at Hoppy's Cantina!  -  Sean

story:
What is Cirque Du Soufflé?

Cirque du Soufflé is a private dessert chef service by me, T Lawrence-Simon. Cirque du Soufflé can come to your home, and provide a fantastic dessert to your dinner party, or skip the dinner entirely, and entertain guests with a 3 to 5 course dessert party. Through brilliant flavor combinations, and stunning pastry and confection techniques, I will provide a remarkable and unique experience for your guests to remember. 

About Me

I have been a lifelong artist and a professional circus performer and coach for the last 12 years. Over the past 2 years, I have deeply traveled into the world of fine pastry and confections. Recently, I have experienced huge professional growth with amazing world-class pastry and chocolatier mentors, and the time is right to open up this new business.

What We Need

To get my business off the ground, I need to invest in professional quality equipment to create high-quality desserts; A professional-grade higher volume stand mixer including multiples of bowls and mixer heads, portable induction stovetops, induction pots, ISI guns, immersion blenders...etc. In addition to equipment, I will need to invest in specialty supplies and ingredients like premium plating decoration and high-grade gelatine sheets.

In addition, I intend to enroll at Ecole Chocolat, a world-renowned program for me to become a certified chocolatier and take my chocolate techniques to the next level. This will help me grow in my repertoire of confections, as well as creating impressive chocolate garnishes.

What You Get

I have many fun perks as thanks for contributing to this business. They range from a Cirque du Soufflé postcard, Cirque du Soufflé kitchen gear like towels and aprons, all the way up to macaron and bon bon making lessons.

Risks & Challenges

Cirque du Soufflé is breaking new ground by being a dessert-only private chef service. Many private chefs offer dessert with their dining, but I am choosing to focus solely on crafting the finest desserts that will be the highlight of your party. By being a new concept, it will need visibility and excited word of mouth to become a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

-Share the campaign.

-Tell your friends about Cirque du Soufflé, and keep an eye out for when the business launches so you can start securing your Cirque du Soufflé event.

story:
Our Story

Brad Lazarenko the founder and Executive Chef de Cuisine of the Culina Family of Restaurants, is a self-taught chef with a Metis background. His first restaurant, the 45-seat bistro ‘Culina’ (the root word for culinary) opened in Edmonton’s beautiful Millcreek neighbourhood in 2004. With excellent reviews, Culina introduced Edmonton to Brad’s philosophy of offering quality and affordable comfort food featuring local suppliers and producers.

In 2015, Brad brought this philosophy into the River Valley by renovating and  operating the cafe at Victoria golf course. A successful and well-received endeavour, Brad's vision was then expanded to include cafes and restaurants at a number of City of Edmonton-run facilities including ACT Centre at Rundle Park and The Riverside Golf Course. Despite the popularity of the local cafes, in 2018, Culina Restaurants lost the bid to renew for the river valley spaces to a much larger, corporate competitor. Now only two years later, the corporation has left town and there is an opportunity to bring local food back to the river valley at Hawrelak Park.  
                                                 

                                  We're game...but we need your help to do it.


Culina on the Lake will be a community space where we can all enjoy local fare, skillfully prepared within the beautiful backdrop of Hawrelak Park. We want to be the meeting place for family meals after a day of skating, where friends catch up after work and a place to refuel while enjoying the river valley with all its festivals and attractions. During the summer months we invite our neighbours to join us for lakeside sunsets with fresh food and beverage or to grab one of our picnic baskets to enjoy the park even more. We also intend to utilize this unique space by hosting cultural events, yoga, paddleboarding and much more. 

                        We want this to be yours as much as much as it is ours. 

Why Indiegogo?

When a good opportunity presents itself you have to move. We would love to be able to simply jump in and start a new venture like Culina on the Lake but for us, like most, that is not the case. Some capital will be required to get up and running. We will need to purchase equipment, furniture, signage and a little bit of marketing to make sure everyone knows were there. Lastly, since we not only support local food but local art as well, we will have a mural installed on the building by a local artist to mark it as ours. That's it, and we will be sharing each development with you on the way so that you know where your dollars are going. 

Will this work?

Of course. Culina Restaurants has an exemplary track record when it comes to creating spaces for local food and gatherings in the river valley. Successful, well reviewed establishments that the Culina Family of Restaurants have created in the past include:

          - Dogwood Cafe at the Victoria Golf Course

          - Dogwood Cafe at the Riverside Riverside Golf Course

          - Dogwood Cafe at the Rundle Golf Course and Rundle ACT Centre.

          - Culina Muttart Cafe

          - Culina Mill Creek

          - Bibo Wine Bar

Lessons learned from operating these establishments and decades of restaurant industry experience put Culina Family of Restaurant's in an ideal position to meet and surpass expectations on the lake at Hawrelak Park. 

I love the idea but can't afford it.

We appreciate you taking the time to learn about our new endeavour. We also understand that it's not always possible to contribute financially to a new idea but that doesn't mean you can't help. If you like our idea of a new, locally sourced space in Hawrelak Park you can still show your support by:

- Sharing our campaign on your social media networks. (facebook, instagram, twitter, etc)

- Signing up for our newsletter to keep informed and sharing with your friends.

- Spreading the word. 

- Coming to check out the new space starting February for the Silver Skate Festival.

 

Press

https://edmontonjournal.com/opinion/columnists/david-staples-city-rejects-local-restaurateur-in-favour-of-multinational-at-victoria-golf-course

https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/restaurant-river-valley-1.5407293

https://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/new-restaurant-in-hawrelak-park-promises-fresh-and-local-fare-for-park-goers

https://edmontonsun.com/opinion/columnists/hicks-on-biz-edmonton-restaurateur-putting-restlessness-to-work

 

Thank you!

 We look forward to seeing you by, or on the lake in Hawrelak Park!

story:
Short Summary

I'm Steven L. Liebenhaut of steveNyou Presents. I've been organizing events and raising funds for local nonprofits in need for over 5 years and have raised over $30,000 so far. Recently some of my friends suggested I create a BOD and capitalize on the efforts of many instead of just mine, creating  a more vast, positive and meaninful effect on our community.

After learning of The FARM CAFE.org in Boone, NC and meeting with them and Denise Cerrera of One World Everybody Eats Foundation, we decided to research the possibilities of opening a nonprofit restaurant here in Asheville offering volunteer opportunities within our community to learn a new skill, and help create more jobs in our ever growing city. We plan to provide a full service, fresh cooked meal, at an affordable price. 

We need to attend the The 4th Annual One World Everybody Eats Nonprofit Food Summit in New Brunswick,NJ on January 18-21, 2013. There we'll meet over 150 people from around the country who have either already opened nonprofit restaurants or will be, like us, in the near future.  We're just now to the beginning stages of our fundraising campaign but now we need your help in getting to New Brunswick, NJ next month.

     

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We'll need to raise $500 for fuel and a rental car to attend The One World Everybody Eats Nonprofit Restaurant Food Summit January 18-21, 2013 in New Brunswick, NJ. When you donate $10, we'll send you a bumper sticker from a nonprofit restaurant in another city, and ours once we pick our name.

The funds are going toward our trip, and if we fall short, we'll use the money toward working our goal.

 
 

THE IMPACT:

We have a dream of opening a non-profit restaurant in  Asheville , a  place where people can learn job skills to help them find work in other  restaurants, while providing affordable meals to the public. At this summit will  be people from all over the country who already are running similar restaurants.  We want to go to this Summit to learn how we can make our venture a  success from people who have already done this work. The ability to talk and learn from these  people in one place is a unique opportunity for us, an experience that can not  be found anywhere else.

If you would like to know more about what a nonprofit  restaurant looks like and how it operates, please view these  videos

for Jon Bon Jovi's Soul Kitchen in  NJ.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lX1G6Zzwhes

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=43cC-xG5dnI

 

 

    What I've learned over these past 5 years of organizing events and raising funds is that, as Hillary Clinton wrote " It takes a village,"  And I'm asking you to be a part of our village.

    We need to get to The One World Everybody Eats Food Summit and we're asking for your assistance.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

     

    We're going to need a lot of help over the next year and it's going to take more than money. We'll need volunteers to help us on committees and to help us raise awareness around town. Please visit steveNyou Presents on Facebook to learn more.

    Please use Indiegogo's share tools so more folks will see our campain and help us to get to One World Everybody Eats Food Summit January 18-21, 2013 in Brunswick, NJ.

    Thanks for contributing to our cause,

    steveNyou

    And that’s all there is to it.  Well, now make a donation to our cause.

story:
Aidons Karine et les enfants dans ce moment difficile.

Les prochaines semaines, les prochains mois ressembleront à des montagnes pour notre amie Karine.  Elle devra poursuivre la routine familiale, veiller à ce que tous se portent bien , cajoler le petit à venir ... et surtout , penser à elle. 

Plusieurs d'entre vous se demandent comment apporter un peu de réconfort à cette jolie famille.  Des amies, des collègues et moi avons pensé à une levée de fonds... Cet argent ira à Karine et les enfants.  Il sera dépensé pour habiller les petits , pour se gâter avec un petit resto plutôt que de cuisiner ou même pour louer des films et les écouter dans le confort du salon (Karine je te connais ! )

Alors voilà ! Vous donnez le montant qui vous fait plaisir, qui vous rend heureux , qui vous apaise le cœur en pensant à cette dure épreuve que rencontre Karine, Edward, Henry, Adèle, Laurent et le petit coco à venir.

Karine, tu n'es pas seule. Beaucoup de gens pensent très fort à toi .

Nous t'embrassons xxx

Les prochaines semaines, les prochains mois ressembleront à des montagnes pour notre amie Karine.  Elle devra poursuivre la routine familiale, veiller à ce que tous se portent bien , cajoler le petit à venir ... et surtout , penser à elle.  
Plusieurs d'entre vous se demandent comment apporter un peu de réconfort à cette jolie famille.  Des amies, des collègues et moi avons pensé à une levée de fonds... Cet argent ira à Karine et les enfants.  Il sera dépensé pour habiller les petits , pour se gâter avec un petit resto plutôt que de cuisiner ou même pour louer des films et les écouter dans le confort du salon (Karine je te connais ! )
Alors voilà ! Vous donnez le montant qui vous fait plaisir, qui vous rend heureux , qui vous apaise le cœur en pensant à cette dure épreuve que rencontre Karine, Edward, Henry, Adèle, Laurent et le petit coco à venir.
Karine, tu n'es pas seule. Beaucoup de gens pensent très fort à toi . 
Nous t'embrassons xxx

story:
Why

We can't sell wine without constructing a small barn that can appropriately be licensed, but we've come a long way already planting a vineyard and setting up equipment. Please support us in getting across the finish line!

Background

Spotted cows dot the surrounding landscape, and, so do the grapes! It's a return to a way of life that's good and wholesome, and, Skaneateles otherwise seemed a bit left-out of the Finger Lakes Wine Trail. Our last six years of grape-growing and wine-making has involved unlimited workouts, experiments in every dimension, and an education in the complexity of sustainable agriculture.

Skaneateles Lake and the broader environment will appreciate our vine-nurturing, and ultimately, we think viticulture goes far beyond production efficiency. We hope you'll join the journey with us, and we think you'll enjoy the wine too.

Thanks especially to Betsy for her green thumb and gardening intuition, Bob for his creativity in vineyard equipment development, and Ange for her pruning artistry and energetic support.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Grapevines are especially needy. There's rarely a shortage of fun to be had- weeding, digging, pruning, stomping.. If you're ever in need of an outdoor challenge in the midst of the pandemic, let us know! If you have other ideas, we're all ears.

story:
All backers receive 10% lifetime discount on all products that Reset launches. Limted time only.

 

Introducing the recovery detox drink that ensures you will never miss a day.

Reset AfterDrink enhances the natural body and encourages it to recovery up to 5 times faster. Its complementary ingredients include various antioxidants and amino acids known to aid in faster recovery: 

  • Reset AfterDrink is a strong 2-components system that contains a unique recipe containing large amounts of Glutathione, Cysteine and Choline. By ingesting more of these components, Reset AfterDrink upgrades the natural body, allowing it to process  Acetaldehyde up to five times faster.
  • Use Reset AfterDrink after drinking alcohol and before going to sleep to eliminate the poisonous Acetaldehyde quickly, and be free of it the next morning.

 

 

We offer free shipping to the US, Canada and all countries in the European Union and Worldwide free shipping for 12, 30 and 90 packs.

 

 

 

The Business Manager:

Imagine yourself having to go to a 2-day conference where you know you are expected to drink at night with potential clients but also to operate at your fullest capabilities the next day. Take a Reset just before you go to bed the night before and increase your body's ability to break down the alcohol for you to be sharp the next day. Take a Reset Afterdrink and never miss a day!

The Holiday Traveler:

You find yourself located in Dubrovnik, Croatia with a group of friends. You know you want to go out but also have to be awake the next day for a scheduled city tour early in the morning. Take a Reset Afterdrink and never miss a day!

The Festival-Goer:

You know you will have an amazing time at Coachella but 9 days of partying will probably take a toll on anyone. Take a Reset along to give the body a boost and speed up its recovery. Take a Reset Afterdrink and never miss a day!

The pharmacist-developed detox drink designed to eliminate the effects of alcohol and restore the body overnight.

 

 

Dirk Zoutewelle: He is a nutrition expert and performance coach, with over 20 years of practice, who studied health science and orthomolecular medicine.

 

 

 


 

 

 
 
 
 
 

There are many products available that claim to remedy the adverse effects of alcohol overnight.

So, what makes Reset AfterDrink different? 

We have done our research! Our remedy was developed from the age-old tale that eating a raw egg after drinking would leave you waking up hangover-free.

We discovered that the active ingredient of the raw egg  - Cysteine, does in fact assist with defeating hangovers. The tricky part is getting it into the body in sufficient quantities and utilising its enhancing effect. This research led us into a unique two-component product,  Reset AfterDrink.

 

 

The most harmful substance produced by Alcohol is Acetaldehyde, too much of this can have the potential to damage brain cells, cause headaches and directly affect the stomach and intestines. Naturally our bodies can handle small amounts of Acetaldehyde, and will break it down to create Acetic Acid - this acts as fuel that provides energy. A problem only occurs when we supply our bodies with an abundance of Acetaldehyde from alcohol, leaving us with too much for our body to  break down naturally. 

 


Acetaldehyde breaks down in your liver more slowly than Alcohol itself, thankfully our bodies naturally produce our own Glutathione, this is an antioxidant that helps to create Acetic Acid. Unfortunately, we only have a small amount of Glutathione in our system. Although our bodies recycle this substance it takes a relatively long time to do so, meaning that there is likely to be a lot of Acetaldehyde left in your body the next morning.

 

 

 

 

Glutathione:
Your body converts alcohol first into acetaldehyde before it is converted into acetic acid, which is commonly used by your body. Acetaldehyde is toxic and should be removed as quickly as possible. To do this, glutathione is used, a peptide that is produced by your own body, but is only available in small quantities as reserve when it is not needed. When drinking alcohol, this reserve quickly runs out. For this reason, Reset added glutathione to give your body more of the required ingredients to quickly process the acetaldehyde.

Cysteine:
Glutathione can be recycled by your body, but not very fast. To help your body to get rid of the
acetaldehyde faster, your body can make more of the required glutathione. Therefore, amino acids are needed and cysteine is one of the three acids to do so. This amino acid, a nutrient, is not extensively available in your body and could only be obtained via consumption. For example, chicken eggs contain this nutrient, but not in the quantities that are required. Therefore, Reset added cysteine in this food supplement to help your body produce glutathione. By adding cysteine, the acetaldehyde can be processed up to five times faster.

Vitamin C:
Vitamin C is used by your body to make small modifications in the cysteine amino acid in order to use it in the right form. It is also commonly used by your body as an anti-oxidant to remove other radicles in your body.

Asparagine:
Asparagine is also an amino acid that your liver requires to process alcohol and other degradation products of alcohol. It stimulates the Krebs cycle, also known as the citric acid cycle.

Choline:
Choline supports the cleansing effect of the liver.

Thiamine B1:
Thiamine is an important vitamin that is also used to help breaking down the alcohol in your body and its waste products. It is also important in other cleansing processes in the liver.

Vitamin B6 and B10:
Both vitamins are also important for the cleansing effect of the liver. Drinking alcohol causes less absorption of these vitamins, which can cause a shortage in your body quickly.

Melatonin:
Melatonin is the body's sleep hormone which is important for natural sleep. Because your body
cleanses itself during your sleep, it is important that you sleep well. Melatonin is made by your body from serotonin. Drinking alcohol causes a greater consumption of serotonin, which means that less melatonin can be produced.

 

 

 

 

Reset AfterDrink was founded by renowned Dutch pharmacist, Jan Van Der Lende, as a hangover cure recovery detox drink designed to encourage naturally derived chemicals to develop faster. Unlike other anti hangover recovery drinks, Reset AfterDrink provides the body with a very large amount of Glutathion and Cysteïne, which will encourage your body to defeat all of the poisonous Acetic Aldehyde quickly and before waking up in the morning.

At its core, Reset AfterDrink encourages the body to produce extra hangover  fighting antioxidants. By incorporating ingredients that enhance and compliment each other, the body produces more energy to fight off headaches, stomach cramps and dehydration.

Three years after the original Reset AfterDrink concept was born, it has been reimagined with a refined recipe, a simplified consumption method and innovative package design.

 

 

 

For every backer that buys off your custom link, you will receive a 20% commission. By clicking the Kickbooster image below you will automatically be redirected to Kickbooster where your custom link will be generated!

 

 

 

Press kit or free samples:

press@resetlifestyleproducts.com

Cross promotion (Newsletter/Facebook/Twitter/Instagram):

marketing@resetlifestyleproducts.com

Questions about the product:

questions@resetlifestyleproducts.com

story:
Who are Zak's team?

We are happy, hungry eaters who want to change things

We want to change the choice we have of snacks to eat - to move from the deep-fried, carb-heavy snacks developed in the 1960s to more healthy, plant-based food.

We want to change how snacks are processed - we want our food to LOOK LIKE what it is, not turned into pastes and reformed into bars and chewy snacks.

We want to change the industry - snack companies are huge, safe and work as corporations do today - questionable social practices like paying suppliers low prices, or operating complicated tax avoidance schemes. We will never do that - we are part of society and want to give, not take.

And we want to change the world - 10% of every contribution goes to our microfinancing fund with Kiva to help kickstart environmental projects around the world. As entrepreneurs, we help other entrepreneurs. You can see our fund here.

 

HELP US TO BRING THE CHANGE TO LIFE

 

What is Zak's about?

We are creating a brand where the products are made using the best ingredients and we work hard to avoid products which are harmful to the environment. We focus on plant-based nutrition to provide a combination of non-animal protein and impactful taste - using pulses, beans and nuts. Our products are packaged to fit easily in bags and backpacks and eaten with one hand, for easy on-the-go consumption.

We run our business with fairness at the top of our minds. We will never run complex schemes to avoid paying tax. And we run a microfinancing fund to support entrepreneurs starting food businesses in areas of the world where financing is hard to obtain. (More on that fund later in Perks.) 

 

Tell me about Zak's Snacks

We are creating minimally processed mixes of grains, beans, nuts and seeds that are naturally high in protein. Flavoured to provide memorable and impactful flavors using natural ingredients, and packed in convenient shot-bag packaging, Zak's Snacks are designed to bridge the gaps between meals when you need a boost without relying on high sugar or highly processed alternatives.

So if you want a change from the heavy & pasty protein bars, Zak's will provide the protein, taste and energy you need.

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to take on the giants of the industry, we need some additional funds to get started. We have some funds already ourselves (about 25% of our requirements) but we need more if we are going to make this work.

 

We need backers for Zak's - We need Zackers!

 

We need your support to allow us to

  • Design and print the packaging
  • Buy the ingredients and packaging
  • Pay the people who are making the snacks
  • Create new jobs for sales teams

We are not going to use your money to

  • Pay ourselves
  • Pay influencers or expensive marketing campaigns
  • Pay large retailers to stock our products

If we truly want to change the way this industry works and produce real food for today's customers, we need to find a way to compete with a tiny fraction of their funds. Which means we need to spend EVERY PENNY WISELY.

 

The goals of this campaign

Involvement and change. It's clear that we need your financial backing to reach our goals but we want Zackers to be excited and follow us as we grow, and to be a creative resource for us as we develop products.

 

We will be offering

  • Unique numbered "street-art" style clothing specifically designed for Zak's (limited availability)
  • Your name to be added to our packaging design for the first year of production (limited availability)
  • An opportunity to contribute to our KIVA fund to help microfinance entrepreneurs (10% of every perk)
  • A discount code for our online store to purchase our products.
  • A place on the Zak's Creative Council to help choose flavours and snacks
  • Private social media account to follow us "behind the scenes" as we launch.

 

 

The Impact

By contributing to Zak's, you will help to create snacks for the 21st-century consumers, but also join us in building a small business run with the right principles for the world we live in today. You will help David take on the Goliaths and maybe we all win as a result. 

We see business as a social enterprise - your backing will allow us to not only shake up an industry but bring a positive impact to all our stakeholders.

 

Risks & Challenges

We are trying to change the business model of an industry and trying to compete with the deep pockets of global multinationals.

It's all a risk. And it's all a challenge.

But we are dedicated, passionate and focussed. We think that any challenge can be overcome with the right vision and the right team.

But we need your help.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everybody can help financially, but if you believe in our vision of supporting farmers, employees and our fellow entrepreneurs overseas - all while dragging the snacks market into the 21st century - we'd love you to get involved in one of the following ways

1. Share the project on your social media if you have family or friends who might want to get involved.

2. Follow us on Instagram and stay in touch - we'd love your support.

story:
Hey Backers,

We're Rachel Eva & Shawn Michael, and we design and make intentional barware.  Our newest project is to make the best 2-OZ measuring cup ever, whether you make cocktails, coffee, or chocolate cake (we make all three!).

We've been on the product development journey for the Napier Jigger for over a year, and in June began manufacturing the final iterations of our design.  Here's a close-up of one of our most popular options: The Industry Jigger.

We funded the first production run in November 2017 with a crowdfunding campaign, and are here on Indiegogo to officially launch pre-sales.  This is the time to pre-order one of these great tools and get your hands on one from the very first production run (before they sell out!)

Here's an UPDATE VIDEO to explain what's new & different (1:55):

 

And here's a quick look at styles and finishes (see "Options" section for details):

 

 

Why You’ll Fall in Love with the Napier Jigger  

Accuracy in cocktail making is essential for a well-balanced drink that tastes like it's supposed to. 

But we’ve noticed that most jiggers just aren’t easy to use (especially at a home bar). Many don’t have a good range of measurements, and we often find ourselves needing to use multiple versions and sizes to get that range.

For at-home bartenders without a sink nearby, double sided jiggers are sometimes very impractical. Pour simple syrup into the smaller side, and when you need to use the other side, sticky leftovers drip all over your hand and work surface. The Napier Jigger is one-sided, so you can make all your measurements without making a mess.  

The stepped design also means that it's easier to find half-measurements, even when it's dark. Try to estimate an in-between measurement on a v-shaped jigger, and you'll probably miss.  Many jiggers with internal markings are hard to read, and it's challenging to tell when your pour is at (or over) the mark you're aiming for. The Napier Jigger simplifies this by having major increments built into its physical construction.  

 

Our re-designed Napier also includes frequently used 1/4 and 3/4 ounce measurements. They are indicated by internal lines marked between the steps in the bottom two sections. Bravo!  Metric jiggers include additional common measurement markings for in-between the structured steps - see details below.

Quality jiggers are hard to find. Both home bartenders and professionals have to deal with cheap tools breaking all the time. This is a big challenge for manufacturing a two-sided jigger, which is why we decided to make it one-sided. It won’t break!   

Beautiful tools are breathtaking, and worth making. This jigger is absolute eye candy, and your guests will definitely take notice. Our Napier reproduction pays homage to an incredible vintage design, and looks absolutely stunning.   

Space is another issue we wanted to solve. Rather than having multiple versions on the bar-top, wouldn’t you rather have one go-to measure that does it all? Plus it’s hard to keep track of so many tools, and a real pain when one of your four jiggers is missing - and that’s the one you need.  

 

Industry Jigger - No Handle

We're also making a version of the Napier Jigger with no handle. We specifically had bartenders and baristas in mind, because it stacks! This saves even more space on the bar-top, especially when one station requires storage of multiple jiggers for making several drinks at once. 

The Industry 2-pack comes in stainless steel, which is durable and affordable for high volume use. We've also got a solid copper industry jigger, which is going to be amazing!

 

Product Design

Napier was a US jewelry company that began producing barware in the 1930’s. The original stepped jigger was silver-plated, and offered 4 measurements: ½ oz, 1 oz, 1 ½ oz, and 2 oz. If you’re lucky enough to find one of the originals, it will cost you $80 - $275, depending on what condition it’s in.  

The Original Napier Jigger (1930’s) 

When we set out to design our ideal jigger, we did a lot of research. We tested and prototyped a few designs, and just weren’t happy with them. One day Rachel came across an Instagram photo of a vintage Napier stepped jigger, and exclaimed - “THIS is exactly what we’ve been searching for!” Then Shawn said “Oh yeah, I’ve seen that jigger before - Jamie Boudreau uses one at Canon in Seattle.” 

Sometimes that’s the way brainstorming goes over here.  

We chatted with Jamie about it - he's been using a stepped Napier Jigger for years. He especially likes that since the walls are straight, it's easy to estimate half-measurements (as opposed to V-shaped jiggers), and that it means he now only needs one jigger, not 3. 

We were intrigued. It took us months to find and purchase just a few of the vintage pieces to use and test. When we started using them, we fell in love even more. We are so excited to make these available (and affordable) for you to own, use, and fall in love with yourself. 

Design Modifications

We have made a few modifications to the original design. Partly this is to increase functionality, and partly to prevent shady folks from passing our tools off as originals to unsuspecting collectors:  

  • Addition of Standard Spoon logo on underside. The original Napier Jigger has “Napier” underneath the handle. Ours will not, but will have our logo on the bottom of the jigger.
  • US (oz) Version: Addition of ¼ oz and ¾ oz internal measurements. We will be adding two lines on the inside to make it easier for you to measure these very common amounts. The original Napier Jigger does not have these markings. These markings will be on the inside ONLY and are functional additions - they will not be visible on the outside of the jigger.
  • Metric (ml) Version: This jigger has never before existing with metric measurements. We wanted to stick close to the aesthetics of the original design, but also make a useful metric jigger. Steps correspond to 15ml, 30ml, 45ml, and 60ml.  We've added 4 internal markings for 10ml, 20ml, 40ml, and 50ml.
  • Industry Version:  This is simply the Napier Jigger with no handle.  Some people find it easier to use without, especially when using them in a professional capacity.

 

And of course one of the biggest modifications we're making is to create different finishes of the Napier Jigger, which originally was only available as a silver plated item.  See your full options below:

 

Napier Jigger Options:

With so many beautiful choices, it might be hard to decide what to get!  Here's a breakdown of the different perks, your options, and some digital renderings to represent the different colors and styles (we don't have photos of each of these, since some of them are being made RIGHT NOW):

Which option is best for you?  Here are some considerations:

Handle or No Handle? 

You probably know right away if you're a handle or no-handle person. We love the handle because it's beautiful, fun to use, and pays homage to a stunning vintage design. We also love using the industry jiggers with no handle when we need speed, efficiency, and lots of utility. Added bonus of no handle: jiggers stack on the bar when you have more than one.

Special Note: if you know you want a copper jigger, be aware that the Industry Copper Jigger is solid copper, while the Napier Copper Jigger with handle is copper plated. 

Which Finish is Best for Me?

  • Stainless Steel is dishwasher safe, easy to care for, and super durable. It's a workhorse. Our stainless steel jiggers have a high-polish finish, so they are bright and shiny!  
  • Copper is beautiful. Copper will develop a patina (e.g. oxidation / tarnish) over time. Some of you want this to happen. If you want to avoid tarnishing, take care of your copper jigger by washing with a mild soap and always drying it off after use. If you're looking for a really durable copper jigger, the Industry version (no handle) is made from solid copper.  We aren't able to make a solid copper jigger with handle, so the handled versions are copper-plated (with REAL copper).
  • Gold Alloy - It's bright, shiny, flashy, and fun! This is a beautiful jigger that is more affordable and easier to care for than the 24K Gold Jigger. It's plated with a Gold Alloy (imitation gold), so it requires a little more care than stainless steel (don't use abrasive cleaning agents), but it's still dishwasher safe and not nearly as needy as the real deal.
  • Silver - The original Napier Jigger was a silver-plated measurer, so this is as close to the vintage design as you can get. Silver will naturally develop a patina (oxidation / tarnish), which many of you are eager to see.  If you want to keep it bright and shiny, take care of this jigger by washing with mild soap immediately after use, and drying it right away with a soft cloth. Don't use abrasive cleaning agents. You may need to periodically clean it with silver cleaning solutions to remove oxidation if not in use regularly.
  • 24K Gold - Luxury. This baby is plated in pure gold, so take care of her. She'll have a durable layer of gold, but real gold is softer than the Gold Alloy (and silver and copper), so don't toss her around behind the bar. Clean with mild soap and dry with a soft cloth, don't use harsh or abrasive cleaning things, and you'll hand her down to your grandkids in good shape one day.

Special Note: We make sure ALL our plated tools receive a durable coating of plating so they will last a long time with proper care.  Most "colored" barware is flash-plated, which means the thinnest amount of plating material is applied just to achieve the desired color, and it will rub off easily. While any plated object is susceptible to wear over time, ours will last longer than the other stuff. 

OZ or ML?

Usually this one is pretty easy: if you live in the US, Myanmar, or Burma, you probably use OZ measurements. Everyone else uses the Metric System. 

However, if you're a real cocktail nerd you may be trying recipes from all over the place. So you'll either need to memorize common conversions, or just get one of each (the Industry 2-Pack is a great way to do that).

Here are the measurements covered by each jigger (bold is for stepped measurements, italics are for measurements marked by internal lines):

Ounces (OZ): 0.25 oz, 0.5 oz, 0.75 OZ, 1 oz, 1.5 oz, 2 oz, 2.25 oz if filled to the top

Milliliters(ML): 10ml, 15ml, 20ml, 30ml, 40ml, 45ml, 50ml, 60ml, ~65ml if filled to the top

. 

For the Nerds:

The structure of the body of the jigger is the same for both the metric (ML) and imperial (OZ) jiggers. The ml and oz measurements that we have built into the body are so close to one another on a conversion basis, it didn't make sense to make two completely different body designs.  When we were doing our measurements (see below), human error alone is many factors larger than the discrepancy between oz and ml conversions.

However, we did build what we think is a neat little guide into the structure of the jigger.   Fill to the bottom of each step if measuring for ounces, without letting the meniscus of the liquid spill over the step. If measuring for milliliters, fill just until the liquid begins to buckle with surface tension and break into the section above.  That's about equal to the conversion discrepancy between oz and ml in this jigger.  Read all the details and see our extensive testing in our Kickstarter Update #13 - First Production Samples

Product Development & Manufacturing

We launched our initial crowdfunding campaign using the vintage jiggers as our design prototypes.  The jiggers represented in our main project video (above) are all design prototypes, using vintage jiggers like this one (below) to represent the concept we intended to create.

After our initial crowdfunding campaign (Nov 2017),  we began the process of re-creating and modifying that design.  We created 3-D files, 3-D prints, and lots of product specification documents, and sent them to the factory. 

We are making these in southern China with a contract manufacturer that we've been working with since 2014. They started working on tooling in December, finished the molds in March, and then sent us our first photo of the jigger-in-progress (below, left).  We immediately recognized that they'd transposed two of the measurements and the top lip of the jigger was almost martini-glass-large!  That's how manufacturing projects go, sometimes. 

We alerted them to this error, and they quickly sent back a corrected version of our Napier jigger, in-the-raw (below, right).

After correcting that initial issue, we received our first production samples in April, complete with measurement markings and handles, and all polished up and pretty. We spent time testing, measuring, and analyzing these first samples, and sent our feedback to the factory so they could incorporate it.

The biggest changes we had made to these first production samples were to correct the font (our desired font was not originally used), and to create a sharper angle on the lip of the jigger, so that 2oz/60ml measurement could be a little more discernible.

The jigger on the left is a production sample #1, with old font and weak upper lip (no pun intended).  The jigger on the right is a production sample #2, with corrected font and sharper top angle.  We MUCH prefer this font - it's got the character this jigger deserves. (Note that production sample on the right (#2) is before being polished - all jiggers will be polished, not brushed)

We ran into some more challenges and made some adjustments.  The factory incorporated our feedback, and we received the revised designs in June. We are proud to have final, vetted, approved designs that have been turned into beautiful production samples.

If you want to read up on our product development journey, you can find past updates on our Kickstarter project.  We'll be posting any new updates going forward here on Indiegogo as well.

We approved these revised production samples in June, and mass production for the Napier Jigger is currently underway!  

Why We're On Indiegogo

We've got about 2 months left in our production window, and you have been banging on our doors all over the internet to get your hands on Napier Jiggers - so here's your chance.  If you missed the initial Kickstarter Campaign, pre-order one here. 

This Indiegogo InDemand project lists all of your options in their final form, now that we've made changes, vetted designs, and added the Metric Napier Jigger for all you international backers.

By pre-ordering this baby, you'll help us manufacture a second round of jiggers to have inventory for the holidays. AND we'll be able to get started with the development of our next tool (woo hoo!). 

Risks & Challenges

Ok, we say this with all of our campaigns (we've done 4): all manufacturing projects face challenges during the product development lifecycle.  If making things were easy, everyone would do it.

The Napier Jigger was our MOST challenging product development project so far. The good news is that we've been through most of the hard stuff, and we came out on the other side with some incredible products.  But the project isn't over, and there is still the possibility that challenges will rear up during the production process, during quality control inspections, and with packaging and shipping logistics. 

If we do run into challenges or delays, we'll work to solve those problems. We have very high standards, and any changes are always evaluated in depth, and communicated thoroughly to backers.  Maintaining the quality and integrity of our products is always a main priority.  Maintaining excellent and clear communication with backers is always non-negotiable.  Check out our most recent Kickstarter Updates and Comments for how we demonstrated this IRL during our last campaign.

We also pair all challenging news with photos of beautiful cocktails, because it's helpful to remember why we're all doing this together!

Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you backed during the Kickstarter, or you're just fans (we love you!).  You don't really want another jigger (even though they'll make incredible gifts).  Or maybe you really want one, but you're broke.  Here are other ways you can get involved:

1. Be a Sharer

Just share the project - that's easy (and if you want some cool SWAG, do it in the style of #3 below).  Pin one of the beautiful photos. Take a pic of one of the other Standard Spoon tools you own and tag us on Instagram.  Shout it on Twitter if that's your thing.  We love interacting with you guys in the real world / virtual world, so let's show each other some love.

2. Hang out with Us

So, we're pretty active online these days. Here are a few ideas:

  • YOUTUBE - We've got a Standard Spoon YouTube Channel. We've also just launched another channel, The Round Chaos, with a weekly Vlog that will touch on a lot of the behind-the-scenes stuff we deal with when managing projects like this.
  • EXCLUSIVES - You can also Join our Cocktail Club - we'll be regularly emailing great stuff about cocktails, including a deep dive into classic cocktails: history, recipes, variations, techniques and other great culture tidbits.
  • READ/LEARN - We've got a BLOG 
  • INSTAGRAM - Shawn Michael's beautiful photography is always popping up on our cocktail and barware themed Instagram, @StandardSpoon.

3. Refer & Earn Rewards

Oh yeah - we're also giving away free stuff!  With Indiegogo, this is easy:

  1. Share the URL for this project (make sure you're logged in - when you share it (and you're logged in), IGG automatically creates a custom referral code for your shared post.)
  2. When people come to this project and pre-order jiggers, YOU get referral credit for bringing them here. 
  3. Rack up referral points by sharing some more.
  4. When your friend's contributions total:
  • $75 (about 1.5 friends), you’ll get some free SWAG - see that Napier Shirt below ($25 value)
  • $250, you’ll have earned a free Jigger in the finish of your choice!   
  • $500 or more: all of the above, plus a set of our cocktail spoons, and our brand new Hammered Mixing Glass. ($160 value)  
  • The first person to refer friends whose contributions total $1,000 will get one of our SUPER RARE Cocobolo Muddlers.

Visit www.standardspoon.com/refer for more information, reward photos, and a detailed FAQ.

Thanks for checking this out, and please send us messages / leave comments - we read and respond to them all!  Let's make some great cocktails (or coffee, or cake) together!

Cheers,

Rachel Eva & Shawn Michael
story_txt:
Hey Backers,
We're Rachel Eva & Shawn Michael, and we design and make intentional barware.  Our newest project is to make the best 2-OZ measuring cup ever, whether you make cocktails, coffee, or chocolate cake (we make all three!).
We've been on the product development journey for the Napier Jigger for over a year, and in June began manufacturing the final iterations of our design.  Here's a close-up of one of our most popular options: The Industry Jigger.

We funded the first production run in November 2017 with a crowdfunding campaign, and are here on Indiegogo to officially launch pre-sales.  This is the time to pre-order one of these great tools and get your hands on one from the very first production run (before they sell out!)
Here's an UPDATE VIDEO to explain what's new & different (1:55):

 
And here's a quick look at styles and finishes (see "Options" section for details):
 

 
Why You’ll Fall in Love with the Napier Jigger  
Accuracy in cocktail making is essential for a well-balanced drink that tastes like it's supposed to. 
But we’ve noticed that most jiggers just aren’t easy to use (especially at a home bar). Many don’t have a good range of measurements, and we often find ourselves needing to use multiple versions and sizes to get that range.
For at-home bartenders without a sink nearby, double sided jiggers are sometimes very impractical. Pour simple syrup into the smaller side, and when you need to use the other side, sticky leftovers drip all over your hand and work surface. The Napier Jigger is one-sided, so you can make all your measurements without making a mess.  

The stepped design also means that it's easier to find half-measurements, even when it's dark. Try to estimate an in-between measurement on a v-shaped jigger, and you'll probably miss.  Many jiggers with internal markings are hard to read, and it's challenging to tell when your pour is at (or over) the mark you're aiming for. The Napier Jigger simplifies this by having major increments built into its physical construction.  

 

Our re-designed Napier also includes frequently used 1/4 and 3/4 ounce measurements. They are indicated by internal lines marked between the steps in the bottom two sections. Bravo!  Metric jiggers include additional common measurement markings for in-between the structured steps - see details below.
Quality jiggers are hard to find. Both home bartenders and professionals have to deal with cheap tools breaking all the time. This is a big challenge for manufacturing a two-sided jigger, which is why we decided to make it one-sided. It won’t break!   
Beautiful tools are breathtaking, and worth making. This jigger is absolute eye candy, and your guests will definitely take notice. Our Napier reproduction pays homage to an incredible vintage design, and looks absolutely stunning.   

Space is another issue we wanted to solve. Rather than having multiple versions on the bar-top, wouldn’t you rather have one go-to measure that does it all? Plus it’s hard to keep track of so many tools, and a real pain when one of your four jiggers is missing - and that’s the one you need.  

 
Industry Jigger - No Handle
We're also making a version of the Napier Jigger with no handle. We specifically had bartenders and baristas in mind, because it stacks! This saves even more space on the bar-top, especially when one station requires storage of multiple jiggers for making several drinks at once. 
The Industry 2-pack comes in stainless steel, which is durable and affordable for high volume use. We've also got a solid copper industry jigger, which is going to be amazing!

 
Product Design
Napier was a US jewelry company that began producing barware in the 1930’s. The original stepped jigger was silver-plated, and offered 4 measurements: ½ oz, 1 oz, 1 ½ oz, and 2 oz. If you’re lucky enough to find one of the originals, it will cost you $80 - $275, depending on what condition it’s in.  
The Original Napier Jigger (1930’s) 
When we set out to design our ideal jigger, we did a lot of research. We tested and prototyped a few designs, and just weren’t happy with them. One day Rachel came across an Instagram photo of a vintage Napier stepped jigger, and exclaimed - “THIS is exactly what we’ve been searching for!” Then Shawn said “Oh yeah, I’ve seen that jigger before - Jamie Boudreau uses one at Canon in Seattle.” 
Sometimes that’s the way brainstorming goes over here.  
We chatted with Jamie about it - he's been using a stepped Napier Jigger for years. He especially likes that since the walls are straight, it's easy to estimate half-measurements (as opposed to V-shaped jiggers), and that it means he now only needs one jigger, not 3. 
We were intrigued. It took us months to find and purchase just a few of the vintage pieces to use and test. When we started using them, we fell in love even more. We are so excited to make these available (and affordable) for you to own, use, and fall in love with yourself. 

Design Modifications
We have made a few modifications to the original design. Partly this is to increase functionality, and partly to prevent shady folks from passing our tools off as originals to unsuspecting collectors:  

Addition of Standard Spoon logo on underside. The original Napier Jigger has “Napier” underneath the handle. Ours will not, but will have our logo on the bottom of the jigger.

US (oz) Version: Addition of ¼ oz and ¾ oz internal measurements. We will be adding two lines on the inside to make it easier for you to measure these very common amounts. The original Napier Jigger does not have these markings. These markings will be on the inside ONLY and are functional additions - they will not be visible on the outside of the jigger.

Metric (ml) Version: This jigger has never before existing with metric measurements. We wanted to stick close to the aesthetics of the original design, but also make a useful metric jigger. Steps correspond to 15ml, 30ml, 45ml, and 60ml.  We've added 4 internal markings for 10ml, 20ml, 40ml, and 50ml.

Industry Version:  This is simply the Napier Jigger with no handle.  Some people find it easier to use without, especially when using them in a professional capacity.



 
And of course one of the biggest modifications we're making is to create different finishes of the Napier Jigger, which originally was only available as a silver plated item.  See your full options below:

Silver will naturally develop a patina (oxidation / tarnish), which many of you are eager to see.  If you want to keep it bright and shiny, take care of this jigger by washing with mild soap immediately after use, and drying it right away with a soft cloth. Don't use abrasive cleaning agents. You may need to periodically clean it with silver cleaning solutions to remove oxidation if not in use regularly.

However, if you're a real cocktail nerd you may be trying recipes from all over the place. So you'll either need to memorize common conversions, or just get one of each (the Industry 2-Pack is a great way to do that).

.

story:
New stretch goal! Let's get to $5,000 to offer Maria 5x Fairtrade prices.

 

Maria's coffee has notes of juicy tropical fruits, caramel and a creamy body. 

Maria is a widow in her 60s living in a tiny town in northern El Salvador. 

This year her coffee was a National Winner in El Salvador's Cup of Excellence competition. (It's like the Oscars of coffee.)

 

 

When we spend $3 on a latte, Maria only earns 3 cents

Maria struggles to earn enough money to cover her costs because coffee prices are so low. 

And because her farm is small coffee middlemen don't waste their time helping her achieve higher prices. 

Learn more here: 

 

Let's buy Maria's coffee at financially sustainable prices

Maria typically sells her coffee for less than $1.50/lb to middlemen. This is not financially sustainable. We're going to pay a financially sustainable price of $4.50/lb, over 3x Fairtrade prices. 

This means she can continue giving her community the 10,000 avocados she also grows on her farm and continue employing Santos, her one full time worker. 

 

 

 

Choose how much coffee you want!

The bags are 250g each and will be roasted by one of Norway's best roasters and packaged in these beautiful boxes.

Postage is €5 flat around the world and you'll get your coffee in time for Christmas.

Consider getting an extra bag or two as Christmas presents. Each bag is flushed with nitrogen to preserve the roasted coffee all the way into January. 

 

Learn more about Maria's life on the Filter Stories podcast

Filter Stories reveals how the coffee you choose in the morning controls the lives of people like Maria. 

Listen to Maria's episode for free here: 

By joining this Indiegogo, you are also helping Filter Stories produce more of these investigative documentaries.

 

 

 

We need to raise €1,000 

We'll buy a big bag of Maria's green, unroasted coffee and ship it from El Salvador to Oslo. In Oslo, my friend Talor Browne will roast the coffee, package it up and ship it to you!

Talor (picture above) has roasted for some of the most famous specialty coffee roasters and now runs her own roastery, Talor Made.

 

Filter Stories is an investigative documentary podcast that's actually not about coffee itself

Nicknamed the 'This American Life of coffee', each thirty minute episode takes 100 hours to make.

Fan favourites include the story of a stateless barista stuck on a faraway island:

 

A woman who loves her barista job, but she doesn't know about her bosses' secret podcast  revealing the women they're having sex with in her community:

 

And a coffee producer who is almost murdered three times during a civil war:

 

It's been featured on the Front Page of Apple Podcasts UK, been listened to over 28,000 times, and featured in the media. 

You can listen to Filter Stories on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, Soundcloud or wherever you get your podcasts.

 

 

This is a low risk project

This is the second Filter Stories crowd-fund this year. Our last campaign focusing on a different coffee producer was over 280% funded. 

We are bringing in a professional - Valentina Moksunova, pictured above - to handle logistics. She runs a coffee trading company and has years of experience getting coffees from coffee growing countries to Europe.

She's also been tasting coffee professionally for over a decade and met Maria at the Cup of Excellence this year.  She described Maria's coffee tasting like "pineapple, white wine, juicy tropical fruits, caramel, with a remarkably heavy creamy body."

Depending on customs and shipping times, your coffee will arrive sometime between mid-November and mid-December. 

 

 

Let's spread the word!

Share this campaign and Maria's story with your friends! Use the 'Share this campaign' button on the Indiegogo page. 

Leave a review of Filter Stories on Apple Podcasts - this will help more people find the podcast so they can hear Maria's story and listen to the struggles of the hundreds of thousands of coffee farmers today in Central America. 

Thank you Ashley for your beautiful photos. Learn more about Filter Stories on her coffee blog The Little Black Coffee Cup.
