story:
Keeping Veggies Alive!

Something amazing happens when you keep your veggies out in the open instead of buried in your fridge. They get eaten! With VeggiDome™, your vegetables will stay fresh, hydrated and delicious – vital and alive – for up to six days. That means no more wilted, wasted vegetables buried in your refrigerator. And it means your family will eat a lot more vegetables. In this way, VeggiDome is keeping veggies alive, in more ways than one.  

 
 

 

 

Featured With:

          

      

        

                                     

                                

The Story of Our Design:

 

 

As a father, I always want my kids to eat more fresh vegetables for their health. I invented a way to let them have fresh vegetables anytime they came through the kitchen:

1. VeggiDome is easy. Kids (or anyone) can reach in and grab snacks and put the lid back on. It functions as a cookie jar for veggies. 

2.  VeggiDome is big. By adding vegetables in through the top, you can fit a ton of veggies inside VeggiDome. With a variety of vegetables on display, it's hard to resist grabbing something as you walk (or run) past.

3.  VeggiDome keeps veggies alive. The veggies' moisture remains in the dome, keeping the vegetables crisp, lush, delicious and irresistible.

 

 

Engineering The Perfect Shape:

Why this shape and size?

1. At 12 x 10 x 6 inches, VeggiDome is the perfect size to hold several days worth of veggies. You can keep more vegetables out in the open and waste less. 

2. The base plate is oval-shaped so that it takes up less surface space. Plus, we maximized the volume with a tall, 6-inch height.

3.  The oval hole on top is long. This shape makes it super-easy to place whole carrots, celery, and more, into the dome.

 

 

Safe & Environmentally-Friendly

My family is serious about health issues, especially in the kitchen. The VeggiDome is made of the same borosilicate glass used in Pyrex. No lead, no plastic, no BPA. And the design is smooth without lines or crevices, which makes cleaning easy.

 

 

Over A Decade In The Making

The VeggiDome has completed a 12-year process to get to this point. The design and materials for the prototype have been perfected, tested and approved. All that's left is to manufacture and deliver VeggiDomes to families everywhere. Together we can Keep Veggies Alive.

 

The VeggiDome will keep your vegetables:

     • Fresh - without refrigeration for 4 to 6 days.

     • Visible - on your table or counter top.

     • Accessible - Ready to Eat. Delicious.

 

 

VeggiDome can improve your quality of life by helping you:

     • Eat Healthier

     • Lose Weight

     • Save Money

     • Reduce Food Waste

 

 

                       

 
How VeggiDome Works
 

 

VeggieDome's three-dish combination protects the vegetables from losing moisture while emitting water vapor. It traps and maintains water in the air inside the dome, allowing veggies to “drink” the moisture. Ethylene gas which is produced by vegetables that have been harvested, escapes through the lid, leaving the veggies in a rare, life-supporting place. The result: vegetables stay hydrated and vital, without wilting or going bad. 

You waste 30% of the vegetables you buy. Here’s how to stop the madness. 

Admit it. You have veggies spoiling somewhere your refrigerator right now. On average, 30% of the vegetables we buy become spoiled, forgotten and are thrown out, ($100/month in most households). Nobody likes to see food go to waste. But the fact is, wrapping vegetables in plastic and putting them in the fridge just DOESN'T WORK. 

Here's what does: VeggiDome. Groundbreaking patented technology can keep 100% of your veggies in the Dome from going to waste. It's a simple addition to your household. But it creates a huge, positive change in your life. 

 

 

What people are saying about the VeggiDome!

"Thank you for pursuing practical strategies to get children to eat more fresh vegetables. We have a common mission. I commend you for your efforts to get people to eat more minimally processed fruits and vegetables." — William McCarty, Ph.D., Dept Health Policy and Management, UCLA
"The VeggiDome looks great. Makes total sense. We eat what we see." — Jeffrey Babcock, Author, Speaker, Consultant
"My nephew, who usually avoids vegetables, grabs a handful of carrots every snack time from the VeggiDome. It’s so much better for him than hitting the candy bowl." — Donald Moore, MHA

Get a VeggiDome today. We have achieved our first funding goal, and as we continue to raise money, we will solidify the launch of this company. A minimum manufacturing run of a few thousand units will be made from the molds that we have. We will then deliver the first couple thousand VeggiDome units to our customers!

When will I get my VeggiDome?

 

Our current manufacturing projection is in mid- March 2017. We want to make sure that you receive the best possible edition of our amazing product. 

 

 

 

The VeggiDome Mission:  

We strive to make veggies a bigger part of your family's life, by providing a healthy, elegant, and inexpensive way to store and display fresh, hydrated, delicious vegetables. In short, our mission is to Keep Veggies Alive!

 

 

                            

                                     Baby Bok Choi, 5 days in the VeggiDome

Testimonials

1. Diane Gilbert - Personal Wellness Coach, Nutrition, Weight Mangement 

2. Maureen Benoit - Nutritional Advocate, Raw Vegan Chef

3. Sistah Modupe - Raw Vegan Chef, The Sistah Modupe's Raw Vegan Soul Food Show

4. Abigail Steinberg - Author Recipe For Success

 

 

 

5. Chef, Author, Culinary Instructor Zel Allen describes her experiences and tells us how to use the VeggiDome in: 

"Advantage - VeggiDome with ZEL ALLEN"  

 

 

 

 

The Inventor: The Guy Who Brings Snap Peas To A Bowling Alley

What food would you bring to a bowling alley with a dozen 8-year-olds? Pizza? Hotdogs? I'm the dad who would haul in five pounds of washed, trimmed veggies. Yep, I'm that guy. To the embarrassment/pride of my kids. 

Say what you will. But that platter of fresh vegetables got eaten up faster than any bag of chips. That’s the surprising thing about veggies. Kids WILL eat them. The key is you have to have the vegetables out.

 

Meet Our Team:

Duncan Burns, Inventor and Founder

 

Duncan developed the VeggiDome over a ten-year period simply because he wanted his kids to eat more vegetables! His career background is in the film industry. Lead Editor and Post Supervisor, 30 years.  Now, he wishes to share the VeggiDome advantage with sustainable homes around the world!

 

 

Eddie Haddad, Co-Founder and CMO

A marketer and also musician, Eddie met Duncan when performing at an inventor's forum about two years ago. Eddie brings social media savvy, marketing prowess, as well as a solid understanding of integrity in business. 

 

 

Inventing at Lunch
I’m always interested in ways to help my two children stay healthy.  One day, 11 years ago, I was getting lunch ready in the kitchen and I thought I’d wash a whole pile of fresh vegetables to put on the table for the kids. “What the heck,” I boldly piled a large assortment of veggies onto a large plate. The kids smiled at this sight, ate one or two  pieces and scattered off. I was left with a whole plate of freshly washed vegetables.

Then I did something that changed the entire kitchen for years. Instead of scooping the fresh vegetables into a plastic bag (which would spoil later in the fridge,) I covered the pile with a clear glass. 

 

Something amazing happened. The kids came back and grabbed more veggies throughout the afternoon. We added new vegetables all week long. The more we added, the more the kids ate. We kept that glass lid on the table for years.

The bowl served a great purpose, but it had problems. Veggies spilled out when the cover was raised.  The cover was difficult to replace without carrots or beans sticking out, breaking the seal. Many years later, VeggiDome has finally been engineered to perfection. Now, it can hold more veggies, they are easy to grab, closing the cover is as simple as a lid, and the ethylene gas can escape. Your veggies will last a whole lot longer than three hours. More like 5-7 days! 

 

When you buy a VeggiDome, you're not merely purchasing a functional addition to your household. You're leading a movement. One that will lead to you and your family having healthier, happier lives. 

And when you buy more than one VeggiDome, you're giving the gift of health and wellbeing to friends and neighbors. You'll be joining us on our quest to Keep Veggies Alive.

story:
The Mid-Atlantic Gleaning Network links farmers who have crops that are edible, but not marketable with those who distribute food to the needy through the work of volunteer gleaners. Our staff organizes teams of people to go to local farms to harvest fresh nutritious fruits and vegetables to be given to low income individuals, families, as well as agencies or communities that serve the hungry.

What We Need & What You Get

 

When a farmer in our network calls with available produce to glean, our staff contacts one or more of our gleaning groups and they go to the fields for a gleaning event. These volunteers come from all walks of life and all are welcome to participate. They include church groups, service clubs, schools, college organizations, Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, 4-H Clubs, senior citizens, inner city public housing community residents, and interested individuals. In the fields gleaners harvest the produce that would otherwise be plowed under or left to rot. They fill the bags and other containers that the Gleaning Network provides. The gleaned produce is transported to agencies or neighborhoods to feed the hungry in low-income households.

 

The Impact

 

 

This program is booming because:

  • It brings together a very wide range of people

  • The goal of recovering food to feed the hungry has enormous appeal

  • It is a hands-on experience

  • It has an extremely low cost per pound of food

  • It has a favorable impact on the operating budgets of a large number of organizations that feed the poor

What We Do:

  • Find Farmers willing to give access to food

  • Organize gleaning teams

  • Recruit volunteers

  • Train leaders

  • Arrange gleaning events

  • Transport poor people to the fields

  • Supply produce containers

  • Supervise gleaning events

  • Transport gleaned produce

  • Distribute food to poor people

  • Host special events for hunger awareness

 

Risks & Challenges

 We have farms, orchards, fresh produce, trucks to transport it, and volunteers to distribute to those  who desperately need this food. "However" we do not have the funding to get this food from where it is available and to low income communities that need it.

Sponsor a loaded truck of produce

The Mid-Atlantic Gleaning Network purchases truck loads of non-commercial produce from farmers for distribution to our hunger network. We have established a project called "Sponsored Loads" to fund these costs of food gathered and gleaned from the farm to the community. 

 

Goals:

Collect and distribute 10 million pounds of food, 17 million servings (0.7 pounds per serving), 142,857 people served (70 pounds for the year) {54,000 Volunteers - 162,000 volunteer hours} 50 new Farms/sources of produce.  Retail value of produce $16,000,000 (est. avg cost/lb $1.60).

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  1. People  -- We need people in order to accomplish every aspect of what we do
  2. Drivers
  3. Warehouse help
  4. Office help
  5. Prayer – We need prayers that GOD would bless our efforts and send us the resources we need
  6. Boxes – We use close to 5000 boxes each month and our source of boxes has currently not been able to help us with boxes. Boxes cost average $1.50 each.
  7. New farm connections – We are always trying to increase our network of farms so we can have move produce available.

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign has ended but you can still 
pre-order Opal at: nuggetice.com




FirstBuild is a co-creation community that is changing the way products come to market by letting a community influence the product from the very beginning. Backed by GE Appliances, we have access to world-class engineering and design talent. Opal first showed up as an idea posted by a community member on our FirstBuild.com web forum. It was a simple idea, so why didn’t a residential nugget ice maker exist? We listened to our community, and now we are launching the product to the Indiegogo community, a group of early adopters who see into the future of technology.

Why are we doing an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign? Because we know that the best way to find out if people really want a product is to give them the opportunity to buy it. Crowdfunding on Indiegogo gives us the opportunity to validate that the product matches the needs of the market before we make hundreds of thousands of them.

Make sense? If you have any questions, visit us at nuggetice.com or email us at social@firstbuild.com.

What makes Opal different?

Opal is an icemaker designed for the enthusiasts: people who drop by their favorite restaurant on the weekend to pick up a bag of that special soft ice or have googled “nugget ice maker for home” only to find that home nugget ice makers start at $2000 - $3000.

What does it do?

Opal only does one thing: make chewable, craveable nugget ice. But it does a really good job at that one thing.

Why is nugget ice so important?

Ice doesn’t just keep drinks cold. Millions of Americans crave nugget ice for its chewability and its flavor retention properties.

How does it work?

Opal nugget ice is made by scraping the ice flakes off the inside of a chilled aluminum cylinder. The flakes are extruded through a round hole, compacting them into frozen nuggets of air and ice. Nugget ice is about 50% air by volume, and those tiny pinholes of air between the ice flakes are the secret to soft, chewable, flavorful ice.

How do I fill the Opal Nugget Ice Maker?

Simply add water to the filling reservoir under the bucket. 6 cups of water is enough to make 3 pounds of ice. The reservoir has a max fill line that indicates the amount of water to be added to the icemaker.

What happens if I unplug Opal while the bucket is full of ice?

We’ve thought of everything! Opal includes a reservoir large enough to contain the meltwater from the ice bucket, just in case you don’t finish your ice before it’s time to power down.

How smart is Opal?

Opal is smart enough to know when to start and stop making ice. It’s equipped with a sensor that will identify the fill level of the bucket to turn the ice maker on and off. Just like in any cooler, ice will slowly melt within the air-insulated bucket. Opal will automatically turn on to make sure that the bucket is refilling with ice.

What happens to the ice as it melts?

Opal recycles the melted ice water to ensure that your ice bucket is always full of fresh, cold nugget ice.

How fast does Opal work?

Your first nuggets of ice will be delivered in about 15 minutes. At a rate of 1 pound per hour, Opal outpaces all the residential refrigerator ice makers that we have tested. You should have a full 3 pound bucket in just over 3 hours, and every time you remove ice, more will be made.

Do you have more detailed feature information?

•  Stainless steel

•  Dimensions: 17.25" T x 10.5" W x 15.5" D

•  Capacitive touch user interface

•  Fits underneath most cabinets above the countertop

•  Opal can be plugged into any standard 120V outlet

•  Makes 1 pound of nugget ice per hour

•  Clear ice bin holds 3 pounds of ice

Where can Opal be shipped?

We will ship only to the US and Canada for this Indiegogo campaign. In the future, we hope Opal will be available worldwide.

When will you be shipping Opal?

Production of Opal units began on June 27, 2016. We expect the first units to start arriving at backers' homes near the end of July 2016. Orders will be fulfilled in roughly the sequence that they were purchased on Indiegogo.

What is the warranty for Opal?

Opal will include a one-year limited warranty.


Taylor has been developing and marketing products for 11 years. As FirstBuild's Product Evangelist, he interacts directly with early adopters to find ideas and create innovative products that wouldn’t have existed without the input of a community. His passion for nugget ice began when he noticed a dedicated group of nugget ice enthusiasts looking for an affordable way to get nugget ice in their homes.

Scott is a career engineer with 25 years of mechanical design experience in appliances, half of which were spent in R&D. A creative inventor with nearly 40 patents, he particularly enjoys making the impossible possible. During his long and fulfilling career, he has worked on nearly every appliance product, including some which never made it to the showroom. He has a particular love for the unique engineering challenges associated with products like Opal, and looks forward to bringing nuggetty goodness to the masses.

Matt’s love for marketing stems from a core fascination of rapid prototyping and lean manufacturing and extends to his firmly held belief in the Opal product. He  loves everything about how products are made, communicated and sold. He is a bourbon drinker, home renovator and Opal nugget ice lover looking to share drinks with friends next summer on the back deck.

Wilberto tells the story of FirstBuild, including its products. He is responsible for making sure that FirstBuild is as transparent as possible; showing the process of product development from beginning to end. He is also notorious for eating several cups of nugget ice a day.

Tomas is a passionate engineer who enjoys developing cool new products. An advocate for open innovation, Tomas challenged the FirstBuild community to develop a beautiful and functional new product that would meet the needs of consumers. Through his own experimentation, Tomas has come to believe that Opal nugget ice will completely redefine iced coffee.

Jarvis leads the industrial design team at FirstBuild. He spent his early career hand-making furniture for galleries and individual clients. For the last twelve years he's worked in every category of appliances, bringing innovations into the home. Opal is a great opportunity to create a better experience for entertaining.

Opal could not have been possible without countless contributions from community members who share our vision for superior ice. FirstBuild’s development of Opal started with an idea submission by Alan Mitchell. Ismael Ramos’ challenge entry made Opal into a beautiful and functional product that real people will use.

story:
Press kit or news@ponix-systems.at

Herbert is a hydroponic vertical garden, which means that plants grow directly in water and no soil has to be used. This technology is also used by e.g. NASA for producing food crops on space exploration missions. This way planting needs less space, is clean and much more efficient. 

Step 1: Put a seed into one of our biodegradable sponges, which are also used by NASA, and place the sponge in a little pot.

Step 2: Place the pot in Herbert, put one of our special seed caps on it until you can see a little seedling sprouting. Up to 15 plants can grow at the same time. 

 

Step 3: Add water and organic fertilizer.

Step 4: Watch your delicious salads, herbs and fruits grow.

We have tested and analyzed various systems that are available on the market. There are many low cost countertop solutions but all of them lack the energy and size to be really productive.

Therefore, we created a true vertical farm with a strong LED light to save you space and let you grow, even in the coldest of winters. You can easily set the time when the light should be switched on and off. 

Our specialized designers and prototype engineers put a lot of effort into designing a unique system, that saves you space while producing tasty and colorful vegetables, herbs, and fruits like strawberries faster compared to anything else available. 

40% faster compared to traditional farming methods. You can grow a fresh head of lettuce within 4-5 weeks compared to 2-3 months. Making it possible to harvest 80-90 lettuce heads each year – every 4 to 5 days one!

Growing at home gives you full transparency of your food. You know what is in it: no GMO, no pesticides, no herbicides, all fresh and organic. Harvest it when you need it. This way you can reduce your food waste too. 

These are some examples of greens that we offer to grow in Herbert. Herbert comes with a starter kit which includes 30 sponges, seeds and fertilizer. More sponges and seeds can be easily delivered to your home. 

Our free app for Android and iOS will guide you through the growing process and will allow you to adjust the light settings to suit your needs.

Herbert: 

  • Materials: Front: beechwood or poplar wood finish; Frame: white powder coated aluminium plate; Growing Modules: food safe Polypropylen (PP) 
  • Space for up to 15 plants 
  • Total weight (including light, water and plants): 12 kg/ 26,5 lbs 
  • Measurement: 820 x 560 x 115 mm/ 32.3 x 22.0 x 4.5 inches 
  • Patent pending 
  • Included Power adapter: 110Volt/230Volt 

LED Light 

  • 28 high quality LEDs 
  • 60 Watt 
  • special developed light concepts enable best growth 
  • Measurement: 200 x 300 x 500 mm/ 2.8 x 11.8 x 19.7 inches 

App

  • Available for iOS and Android for free
  • Low energy Bluetooth connection 

The Team

Since 2014 Alexander Penzias and Alvaro Lobato-Jimenez are working on combining modern, smart technology with hydroponics to minimize the land, water and energy used in farming. Our ultimate goal is to make indoor farming simple, clean and enable everyone to do it at home. For three years we have been installing and optimizing hydroponic systems for restaurants and offices. Now we want to turn everyone’s thumb green with Herbert!

Testimonial

In 2016 we installed this 10m² beautiful customized hydroponic system at top chef Leo Wrenkh's restaurant and cooking class studio. The Wrenkh family well known as vegetarian food pioneers, have their restaurant hearted in the city center of Vienna. 

The Development

We have been working on Herbert for almost two years to make this product as easy to use and as clean and safe to work with, as possible. With our team of experts in their respective fields we have developed something new and beautiful, a product that will change your food consumption tremendously. 

We have our suppliers and production partners ready to produce in the required quality and quantity. To guarantee quality and shorten communication channels we decided to fully rely on European partners, mainly in Austria and Hungary. After the last adjustments for mass production after the campaign has finished, we are looking forward to start production in July 2017. 

We are here not just to pre-sell Herbert, but rather to expand our passionate community of urban farmers. We believe that you play an integral role in the development of Herbert. By supporting us you help to build the basis for the next generation of food production. Because we want to engrain food farming into our everyday lives. 

If you are ready to join this exciting journey with us, please support our campaign and spread the word! A few clicks for you make a big difference for us.

story:
There's Nothing More Simply Decadent Than A Brownie

For as long as I can remember, I've loved baking from scratch. Baking always brings family and friends together - especially at the holidays and special occasions. Baking is also great therapy. And among the simplest-to-make, most decadent baked goods are brownies.

Over time, I've developed countless recipes for these soul satisfying treats: with nuts and without, chewy and fudgy or moist and cakey, with raspberry liqueur or salted caramel or other flavors that are sure to delight. Now, those favorites which have earned the most brownie points will be collected inBaked Chicago: The Simply Decadent Brownies Cookbook. 

FABQs (Frequently Asked Brownie Questions)

What kinds of brownie recipes will be featured in the book? I've got hundreds of unique recipes, and supporters will have a voice in which recipes are featured. Donors who pledge $50 or more will get to vote for the recipes they'd like to see included. Here's a sampling of my more popular brownie recipes:

  • Dark Chocolate Fudge Brownies
  • Peanut Butter Chunk Brownies
  • Gingerbread Brownie Bites
  • Key Lime Brownies
  • Triple Chocolate Peppermint Crunch Brownies
  • I Want S'Mores Brownies
  • Dark Chocolate & Raspberry Liqueur Brownies
  • PB&J (Peanut Butter & Jelly) Brownies
  • Pumpkin Holiday Spice Brownies
  • Mint Chocolate Chunk Brownies
  • Gooey Marshmallow Crunch Brownies
  • Salted Caramel Brownies
  • Chocolate Espresso Brownies
  • Banana Chocolate Chunk Brownies
  • German Chocolate & Coconut Brownies 
  • Marbled Cheesecake Brownie Bites
  • Breakfast Brownie Bars
  • Taste-Full, Yet Gluten-Free Brownies
  • and even Carob Brownies safe to share with your furry family members

How many recipes will be featured in the book? There will be at least 30 brownie recipes in the cookbook. Recipes will be easy-to-follow and the 4-color cookbook will be approximately 60 pages on 8.5x8.5 paper. 

Is shipping included? All reward levels include free shipping anywhere in the United States. For rewards shipped outside of the US, please email harvey@bakedchicago.com for a shipping quote.

When will perks ship? Cookbooks will ship in mid-December. For the qualifying fresh-baked brownies rewards, you'll have the option to select a delivery date range. For the brownies-on-demand reward, you’ll be able to choose when you receive them, beginning in January and anytime up until December, 2013. The book launch party will be held in mid-January in downtown Chicago. 

How will the funds raised be used? The money raised will be used for designing and producing the cookbook. Hard costs will include editing, designing, formatting, photography and licensing, book production and distribution. The funds raised will also cover the production and delivery for rewards fulfillment.

What inspired the Baked Chicago name? As a proud Chicago resident, I love the city's energy and appreciate its history of innovation. The skyscraper, zipper, Twinkies, Cracker Jacks and toaster are just a few of the inventions born in Chicago. Most people don't know that the brownie also got its start in Chicago. A chef at Chicago's Palmer House Hotel created the confection after Bertha Palmer requested a dessert for ladies attending the World's Fair in 1893. I've always liked tinkering with recipes and creating my own, focusing on simple, high-quality ingredients. So in 2007, when I launched a recipe blog I called it Baked Chicago in homage to the city I call home and a place where creativity flourishes.

story:
The idea is simple: Culinary experiences, by the worlds best chefs, delivered to you on a subscription box basis. 

Picture: Flave's Beta Box

Flave's Philosophy

The story of a Flave Box doesn't begin in our storage room, and neither by a phone call to a supplier. 

It begins by meticulously selecting a Chef with a philosophy worth sharing. Through the Chef, Flave is able to connect with the history and tradition of a specific region. We only partner with micro-producers that take special care in respecting biologic, non-intensive procedures - to bring out the products' genuine flavours.  For this crowdfunding box we have partnered with Francesco Gasbarro, Owner and Head Chef of the 1 Michelin Star restaurant: La Bottega.

We also pick superior quality kitchen tools, so that you can receive a lasting souvenir for your home kitchen. This is aimed to improve your cooking, by delivering a useful object directly linked to suggested preparation techniques. This will enable you to fully exploit the box's ingredients, and prepare mouth-watering dishes. After all, what truly distinguishes a professional kitchen from the one you have at home, is the presence of specific tools.

Furthermore, the Flave Team will provide you with a detailed description of each ingredient and its history, as well as fun & tasty recipes suggested both by the Chef and Flave. This way, you will be able to fully understand the story behind each and every product of the box.

Bottom line... You will receive a brand new experience every month so that YOU can see the beauty of our earth through the unique eyes of the most talented culinary artists. Don't forget to share it with your Family & Friends!

 

Chef Francesco Gasbarro & La Bottega

Born and raised in the charming city of Florence, Chef Gasbarro finds his culinary inspiration from a spectrum of traditional Italian and Tuscan dishes expressed in a modern language. His strict dedication towards the utilisation of seasonal and organic high-quality ingredients, is mirrored in the simple yet lively expression of his dishes. 

La Bottega, the Chef’s Italian gastronomic adventure is rapidly becoming Geneva’s preferred dining venue, after being awarded the first Michelin star just 5 months after their opening. The restaurant is inspired by Italian tradition whilst reinterpreting dishes and flavours in a contemporary approach.

 

What YOU Will Receive:

Spaghetti - Cavalier Cocco

Today, we offer you one of the finest interpretations of Italian Spaghetti by the Pastificio Cavalier Cocco. Founded by Domenico Cocco in 1916, a small producer situated in Fara San Martino, Chieti. Cocco follows the strict rules imposed by the “Pasta Masters”, which argued that to make a good pasta 3 ingredients were needed: grain coming from the mountains, spring water and pure fresh air for the drying process. All characteristics native to this region, resulting in truly special pasta.

 

Riso Carnaroli - Acquerello

Carnaroli rice, also known as “The Kings’ Rice”, can be dated back to 1945. This variety of rice is traditionally used to prepare risotto, as it offers different characteristics compared to common rice. In fact, its organoleptic structure enables it to remain firm throughout all the cooking process, whilst absorbing the flavours of the liquids and fats with which it is prepared.

Acquerello, situated on a meadow that was first built in the 1400s, is the home of the highest quality Carnaroli rice produced in Italy. The Rondolino family introduced a 1-year long aging process of the grain, in order to enhance its characteristics. Yes, its as amazing as it sounds!

 

Olive Oil - La Bottega (500ml) & Marchionni (250ml)

Both varieties were produced on the hills in the vicinity of Florence, one of Italy’s favourite regions the for the production of olive oil. The two were made with a blend coming from 3 strains of olives, all native to the region - The Frantoio, The Leccino and The Moraiolo. Each strain was thoughtfully combined so to create 2 unique products. These olive oils are characterised by an aromatic and fruity profile, distinguishing themselves by a sweet impression followed by a spicy & bitter ending – ideal both for cooking and raw usage.

 

Pelati Tomatoes – Italianavera

With Chef Gasbarro, we decided to bring you this wonderful product of the Italianavera farm, because we consider it the flag carrier of excellence when it comes to Italian tomatoes. These incredibly authentic products are entirely organic, with processing systems that take into account the most important safeguards of the product and its organoleptic characteristics. Bringing to your table a truly healthy product. This is a must if you want to cook the best tomato sauce!

 

Alici di Cetara - Acquapazza

Anchovies are arguably one of the most loved and used products by Italian families. Flave selected Acquapazza as it is a small artisan company consisting of only 5 members, which every year transfer their love and passion towards the making of this phenomenal product. Their work ethic is based on the full respect of the raw material, its seasonality, and fermentation process. They will melt in your mouth!

 

Pantelleria Capers

The caper plant grows throughout the Mediterranean basin, however, its only in Sicily that it finds its ideal environment. On the wonderful island of Pantelleria, capers have been cultivated since the Greek times, providing an exceptional flavour concentration, thanks to the peculiarity of the volcanic soil and to the very favourable climate: moderate windiness and low humidity. These unique climatic and geomorphic circumstances, result in capers that are naturally organic as they do not require any type of treatment or fertilization.

 

Panforte - Forno di Pianella

Panforte, is a confection that holds all the history and tradition of the charming city of Siena. First written documentations of the “special bread” date back to 1206. They were prepared with care by the nuns of the Montecelso convent, situated in Fontebecci. The Flave Team chose to bring you the Panforte produced by the Forno di Pianella, for their great history and tradition in making this unique product. The dough is made out of flour, candied fruits, toasted almonds, 11 spices and honey – to bring you the real Christmas feel!

 

Box Design 

Our mission is to deliver culinary experiences to your doorstep - in our opinion, this begins with the Box. Since the ingredients represent the Chef's cooking philosophy, we decided that the cover should picture our interpretation of the Chef. For this reason, we decided to dedicate our front cover to Dante Alighieri, Founding Father of modern Italian. Just as Chef Gasbarro, Dante had lived all his life in Florence, and until today its one of the city's key symbols. As a matter of fact, the Chef named his 2 menus "Hell" & "Paradise" as a tribute to Dante's ever dying poem: La Divina Commedia. 

Box Design by Timmy Vilhelmsson

 

Beta Testers 

We are sure you will love the boxes, just as our Beta Testers did:

 

Social Media 

Fb: https://www.facebook.com/helloflave/

Insta: https://www.instagram.com/flavetheworld/

 

Time Line

 

The Team

Flave's founding team is made up of Giovanni, Chris & Pascal. All 3 of us met during our university studies at the École hôtelière de Lausanne - the world's leading Hospitality School. Our friendship began during the practical cooking classes and grew stronger during the management courses. The strong passion for the culinary world brought us together, to create something special, dedicated to food lovers. We hope that our Vision has inspired you, and we wish you the best for the upcoming Year! 

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

The Flave Team

 

Shoutout to the video crew!
story_txt:
The idea is simple: Culinary experiences, by the worlds best chefs, delivered to you on a subscription box basis. 

Picture: Flave's Beta Box
Flave's Philosophy
The story of a Flave Box doesn't begin in our storage room, and neither by a phone call to a supplier. 
It begins by meticulously selecting a Chef with a philosophy worth sharing. Through the Chef, Flave is able to connect with the history and tradition of a specific region. We only partner with micro-producers that take special care in respecting biologic, non-intensive procedures - to bring out the products' genuine flavours.  For this crowdfunding box we have partnered with Francesco Gasbarro, Owner and Head Chef of the 1 Michelin Star restaurant: La Bottega.
We also pick superior quality kitchen tools, so that you can receive a lasting souvenir for your home kitchen. This is aimed to improve your cooking, by delivering a useful object directly linked to suggested preparation techniques. This will enable you to fully exploit the box's ingredients, and prepare mouth-watering dishes. After all, what truly distinguishes a professional kitchen from the one you have at home, is the presence of specific tools.
Furthermore, the Flave Team will provide you with a detailed description of each ingredient and its history, as well as fun & tasty recipes suggested both by the Chef and Flave. This way, you will be able to fully understand the story behind each and every product of the box.
Bottom line... You will receive a brand new experience every month so that YOU can see the beauty of our earth through the unique eyes of the most talented culinary artists. Don't forget to share it with your Family & Friends!


 
Chef Francesco Gasbarro & La Bottega
Born and raised in the charming city of Florence, Chef Gasbarro finds his culinary inspiration from a spectrum of traditional Italian and Tuscan dishes expressed in a modern language. His strict dedication towards the utilisation of seasonal and organic high-quality ingredients, is mirrored in the simple yet lively expression of his dishes. 
La Bottega, the Chef’s Italian gastronomic adventure is rapidly becoming Geneva’s preferred dining venue, after being awarded the first Michelin star just 5 months after their opening. The restaurant is inspired by Italian tradition whilst reinterpreting dishes and flavours in a contemporary approach.

 
What YOU Will Receive:

Spaghetti - Cavalier Cocco 
Today, we offer you one of the finest interpretations of Italian Spaghetti by the Pastificio Cavalier Cocco. Founded by Domenico Cocco in 1916, a small producer situated in Fara San Martino, Chieti. Cocco follows the strict rules imposed by the “Pasta Masters”, which argued that to make a good pasta 3 ingredients were needed: grain coming from the mountains, spring water and pure fresh air for the drying process. All characteristics native to this region, resulting in truly special pasta.

 
Riso Carnaroli - Acquerello 
Carnaroli rice, also known as “The Kings’ Rice”, can be dated back to 1945. This variety of rice is traditionally used to prepare risotto, as it offers different characteristics compared to common rice. In fact, its organoleptic structure enables it to remain firm throughout all the cooking process, whilst absorbing the flavours of the liquids and fats with which it is prepared.
Acquerello, situated on a meadow that was first built in the 1400s, is the home of the highest quality Carnaroli rice produced in Italy. The Rondolino family introduced a 1-year long aging process of the grain, in order to enhance its characteristics. Yes, its as amazing as it sounds!
 
Olive Oil - La Bottega (500ml) & Marchionni (250ml)
Both varieties were produced on the hills in the vicinity of Florence, one of Italy’s favourite regions the for the production of olive oil. The two were made with a blend coming from 3 strains of olives, all native to the region - The Frantoio, The Leccino and The Moraiolo. Each strain was thoughtfully combined so to create 2 unique products. These olive oils are characterised by an aromatic and fruity profile, distinguishing themselves by a sweet impression followed by a spicy & bitter ending – ideal both for cooking and raw usage.

 
Pelati Tomatoes – Italianavera
With Chef Gasbarro, we decided to bring you this wonderful product of the Italianavera farm, because we consider it the flag carrier of excellence when it comes to Italian tomatoes. These incredibly authentic products are entirely organic, with processing systems that take into account the most important safeguards of the product and its organoleptic characteristics. Bringing to your table a truly healthy product. This is a must if you want to cook the best tomato sauce!

 
Alici di Cetara - Acquapazza 
Anchovies are arguably one of the most loved and used products by Italian families. Flave selected Acquapazza as it is a small artisan company consisting of only 5 members, which every year transfer their love and passion towards the making of this phenomenal product. Their work ethic is based on the full respect of the raw material, its seasonality, and fermentation process. They will melt in your mouth!
 
Pantelleria Capers
The caper plant grows throughout the Mediterranean basin, however, its only in Sicily that it finds its ideal environment. On the wonderful island of Pantelleria, capers have been cultivated since the Greek times, providing an exceptional flavour concentration, thanks to the peculiarity of the volcanic soil and to the very favourable climate: moderate windiness and low humidity. These unique climatic and geomorphic circumstances, result in capers that are naturally organic as they do not require any type of treatment or fertilization.

 
Panforte - Forno di Pianella 
Panforte, is a confection that holds all the history and tradition of the charming city of Siena. First written documentations of the “special bread” date back to 1206. They were prepared with care by the nuns of the Montecelso convent, situated in Fontebecci. The Flave Team chose to bring you the Panforte produced by the Forno di Pianella, for their great history and tradition in making this unique product. The dough is made out of flour, candied fruits, toasted almonds, 11 spices and honey – to bring you the real Christmas feel!
 

Box Design 
Our mission is to deliver culinary experiences to your doorstep - in our opinion, this begins with the Box. Since the ingredients represent the Chef's cooking philosophy, we decided that the cover should picture our interpretation of the Chef. For this reason, we decided to dedicate our front cover to Dante Alighieri, Founding Father of modern Italian. Just as Chef Gasbarro, Dante had lived all his life in Florence, and until today its one of the city's key symbols. As a matter of fact, the Chef named his 2 menus "Hell" & "Paradise" as a tribute to Dante's ever dying poem: La Divina Commedia. 

Box Design by Timmy Vilhelmsson
 
Beta Testers 
We are sure you will love the boxes, just as our Beta Testers did:

 
Social Media 
Fb: https://www.facebook.com/helloflave/
Insta: https://www.instagram.com/flavetheworld/
 
Time Line

 
The Team

Flave's founding team is made up of Giovanni, Chris & Pascal. All 3 of us met during our university studies at the École hôtelière de Lausanne - the world's leading Hospitality School. Our friendship began during the practical cooking classes and grew stronger during the management courses. The strong passion for the culinary world brought us together, to create something special, dedicated to food lovers. We hope that our Vision has inspired you, and we wish you the best for the upcoming Year! 
 
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
The Flave Team

story:
WILDE is the only beer in the world to be CERTIFIED FODMAP FRIENDLY!

And if you don't know what that is, be glad.......But there are
millions of people in the world who unfortunately do know! (FODMAPs
are a group of sugar compounds to which 14% of Australians appear to
be intolerant and that can trigger inflammatory reactions in the
gut, like bloating, abdominal pain, irritable bowel syndrome,
diarrhea or constipation.)

We didn't realise at first just how important it would be to
people with IBS and other digestive issues to have our beers on
their "safe foods" list. Whilst Wilde beers are enjoyed by many
craft beer lovers across Australia, to the coeliac or IBS sufferer
we are more than just enjoyable...We are LIFE CHANGING. Our first
two beers have given their quality of life a massive boost. Now they
_can _enjoy social events, dine out with a beverage, or celebrate a
special occasion without the uncomfortable repercussions.

And next you asked us for another choice to improve your lifestyle.

We think you deserve it!

In response to the many requests we have received from our
customers we had been making experimental batches with the goal of
releasing a gluten free dark beer in 2017. But what if we could
produce a dark beer that was also certified as FODMAP friendly?
It's never been done before.

The Wilde Beer Team Wilde Beer is proudly a family owned and run Australian business. We have been able to enhance the lives of many thousands of people, as they can now safely enjoy a beer when previously they could not, due to serious digestive issues caused by others beers which contained gluten and FODMAPS. It gives us a thrill to receive the thousands of thank you messages and accolades from grateful drinkers who rave about the taste of our beers. 

"Just wanted to say thankyou to the awesome people at Wilde for bringing this beer into my life. Have been diagnosed with celiacs for 2 years now and the other day had seen your flyer so i went out same day and bought myself a six pack of Wilde pale ale to try and to my suprise it is the best gluten free beer i have tasted in 2 years that actually taste like an awesome beer and not watered down whine pilsner so thankyou so much for giving me something back that i have missed out on for so long (being a beer lover). You will be in my fridge until i die"


The idea of an alcoholic beverage that can align with the health
and wellness industry is such an exciting concept, and we are so
passionate about pursuing this. We are on the forefront of something
that has never been done before. Continuing to develop our unique
range of Gluten free + FODMAP friendly beers is our goal.

So now we need YOUR SUPPORT to keep the #wellbeering flowing.

It requires a substantial financial commitment to do the research
and development for a dark beer that has almost no residual sugar
while maintaining a good flavour profile. Juggling this unique
combination will be challenging, but it's what makes this project so
exciting.

You can take part in the development of a truly unique,
never-been-done-before beer.  Be part of the team as we all progress
towards our common goal.

Help WILDE go wild.............Let's make WILDE DARK BEER together
for all to enjoy!

Cheers

The Wilde Beer Team

story:
What is Cerealism you ask?

Well, let us tell you!  Cerealism is a handcrafted CEREAL CAFE! 

Yes, I said it! An actual place full of your favorite go-to cereals!  It's a place to come and enjoy your very own signature bowl and relive the memories of Saturday morning childhood every day! College students, millennials, families, or wanting to fulfill that late-night craving, we are the spot for you!

                  

So Many Options... So Little Time

Over 75 cereal options | 50+ amazing toppings | Different milk types & flavors 

  

 

Rather Eat Healthier?

Don't worry, we didn't forget about you!  We will have an array of overnight oats with fresh toppings as well.  Don't forget about our line of keto cereals and oat milk!

 

Great Vibes

We will have an energetic atmosphere designed with a modern nostalgic feel. Take a picture next to our selfie wall or a photo op on the indoor swing.

 

Stop In To Enjoy Saturday Morning Everyday

Family Friendly |  Vintage Cartoons Playing | Gamer Stations | Board Games | Wi-Fi

  

  

Our Journey Thus Far

         

  

We had the amazing opportunity to be selected as one of the Top 5 Finalists in Sacramento's 2019 Calling All Dreamers Contest.  Although we were not select as the winner we learned so much and grew as a company.  We received tons of support and have outlined a few things from the feedback the panelists gave us:

  • We need more capital in order to be successful
  • We need to branch out into a different area of Sacramento other than the parameters given by the competition
  • We overwhelmingly won the popular vote so Sacramento is excited about the addition of a cereal bar!  (Thank you Sacramento for voting for us! ) 

             

IMPORTANT STUFF FOR THE HEAVY READERS!  

Cerealism's mission is to bring back the feeling of the Saturday morning you experienced as a kid.   Our cafe will focus on serving cereal for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. Not only will we carry popular brands, but limited edition, seasonal, and cereal favorites from all across the world. When you enter our doors, you will be able to choose one of our signature creations or concoct your very own mix with endless individually priced add-ons such as fresh fruit (sourced from the local farmers market), chocolate drizzle, Nutella or crumbled Oreos.   

Cerealism’s customized milk options will be one of the highlights of our offerings.  Customers will be able to add strawberry, or chocolate to their 2% milk, non-fat, soy, oat, almond, coconut, lactose-free or even hemp milk.  Good old-fashioned plain whole milk will also be available.  

We are looking to open our first location in Sacramento Summer 2020 and eventually expanding into franchisable locations throughout the country.  

                             

 

Investor Relations & Other Ways You Can Help

Some people are just unable to  contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing and posting!          If you know of any partnership opportunities, please let us know!

If you are looking into an opportunity to invest in our idea, please reach out to cerealismsac@gmail.com

IG: @CEREALISMSAC

story:
Bent Brewstillery is on a mission to change the state law to allow Minnesota brewery distilleries — or a combo brewstillery, as we like to call ourselves — to have a brewery taproom and distillery cocktail room under the same ownership and same location.

But just like the battle to allow Sunday sales in Minnesota, this is going to be a fight that needs the support of many of the craft drink community. That’s why we’re asking for you to help us by donating now so we can lead the charge for the change and improvement to state liquors laws. We will be working with a paid lobbyist to write a new law and approaching state law makers to get them onboard to vote for this new law.

“We’re not trying to change the world — just Minnesota,” said Owner and Head Brewstiller Bartley Blume.

According to MN Statute 340A.22 Subd. 2 (e), “No single entity may hold both a cocktail room and taproom license, and a cocktail room and taproom may not be co-located.” 

As you may already know, Bent Brewstillery is a brewery and distillery in Roseville, Minn., and the first single-entity brewery distillery to operate in Minnesota. With being the first comes many challenges, including changing irrelevant laws and working with a powerful liquor lobby that fights to keep these laws unchanged.

This liquor control group fails to realize that changing laws has led to great expansion of their industry. The cocktail rooms fuel the demand for the products in bars, restaurants, and liquor stores. Customers try it at the cocktail room, and then seek it out at their favorite retailer. We noticed this phenomenon first-hand with our beer. Once our taproom opened, demand for our beer grew exponentially. It’s really a harmonious relationship set on getting customers the beer and spirits they want.

All Minnesota distilleries are allowed to have a cocktail room to serve their hand-made spirit products.

Why not Bent Brewstillery too?

Your generous donation will help fund our endeavors to change these laws and give you the right to enjoy a delicious Bent Brewstillery cocktail along with your tasty Bent Brewstillery beer. Patrons such as yourself should have the choice to have one or the other at one location — or both, if you’re the adventurous type.

Join our fight to create The Brewstillery Tap-Tail Room Law for us and all other brewstilleries to come later.

Besides backing our endeavor with a generous gift, if you live in Minnesota, please also consider writing to your state representative.

Click Here (https://www.gis.leg.mn/iMaps/districts/) and type in your zip code to find your state representative. Click to that representative's page to find contact info. Phone calls are great; letters are great. 

The easiest way is to click on the email link and write them an email. Write from the heart, in your own words. Tell your representative you would like to enjoy a locally-crafted cocktail, made from locally-crafted spirits at your locally-crafted Brewstillery source — just like the micro-breweries, wineries, and micro-distilleries offer. Feel free to copy and paste any text you find here.

Thank you for your support!

Join our fight to create The Brewstillery Tap-Tail Room Law for us and all other brewstilleries to come later.
Besides backing our endeavor with a generous gift, if you live in Minnesota, please also consider writing to your state representative.
Click Here (https://www.gis.leg.mn/iMaps/districts/) and type in your zip code to find your state representative. Click to that representative's page to find contact info. Phone calls are great; letters are great. 
The easiest way is to click on the email link and write them an email. Write from the heart, in your own words. Tell your representative you would like to enjoy a locally-crafted cocktail, made from locally-crafted spirits at your locally-crafted Brewstillery source — just like the micro-breweries, wineries, and micro-distilleries offer. Feel free to copy and paste any text you find here.
Thank you for your support!

story:
What's the deal?

We are on the road to creating our own brick oven pizza concept that has been in the works for many years.   The Brick Oven will be the premiere Downtown Salem destination location for signature, Brick oven pizzas, chicken wings, cauliflower "wings", salad, mac and cheese,  relaxed indoor atmosphere,  and more.  We will be located in Salem's first and only food hall at ForkForty.  We will be surrounded by other amazing local restaurants and a full bar with communal seating and in the basement there will be Escape Rooms, Break Rooms & more.  We are able to bring high quality healthy eats tot he downtown community and provide a fun and positive atmosphere for everyone and their friends and family!

Who am I?

I (Amanda) have been in the restaurant business most of life and always have had a soft spot for scratch made pizza.  Eating at many styles of pizzerias, I always knew my all time favorite was brick oven pizza!  Doesn't get much better than that crispy crust that also has that perfect chew.  Feeling like you were in Italy and enjoying the real deal.

After opening a mac and cheese shop I ended up choosing to be a full time mom to my new baby so I could give him 100% of my focus.  After moving to Oregon to raise our son, I was itching to get back into the food business.  I decided to open a dessert food cart.  Unfortunately my health declined and I had a death scare, so ultimately we had to let go of that business.  After healing and our son being older, it was time to get back into this industry and ROCK IT!  So we opened Jefferson Bakehouse in our small town of 3k.  We specialize in cinnamon rolls, but we are a full bakery as well.  This opportunity to open a new concept has happened so organically that we cannot ignore the signs to pursue this amazing dream.  I am more than ready to tackle brick oven pizza.  My vision is detailed and full of amazing scratch made foods including wings, cauliflower bites, mac and cheese, baked cauliflower and cheese & salads.  And I am ready to bring them to the town of Salem.  There is nothing like this concept and we are ready to feed everyone this delicious high quality healthy food.

Why is it important to me?

This campaign is not only important to me, but also our family.  My son Kade aspires to be a chef and own a restaurant some day, and we are able to provide these experiences for him as he grows up.  He is able to learn so much from this business from the food all the way to the numbers.  Having these opportunities for him are similar to the training I had growing up.  I was able to learn both the food and the business side.  For Kade to have the option to have hands on learning as he grows up will really help him in life, even if he pursues other passions.

By donating, you are helping provide high quality food for the community and helping us be able to give an experience and you are supporting a family to be able to open a small business.We are proud to provide jobs for people and are passionate about donating to our community through fundraisers. 

Thank you for reading and helping us get to our $15,000 goal!

Where will the money go?

With my husband Adam and I learning over the years how to do carpentry, electrical and so much more, we are able to use a lot of the campaign money to buy supplies and save on labor because we will be doing a lot of the construction on our own.  But to get a large commercial brick oven and the rest of the equipment, that will cost a lot of money.  With your help we will be able to achieve getting the best quality equipment to make the best quality pizza and food!

The rest of the money will go to permits, licensing and money to pay labor so we can hire an amazing team to run the shop!

The food!

What makes us different.  We will have farm to plate, chef inspired pizzas using the best ingredients like San Marzano Tomatoes, brick oven roasted garlic and chicken, scratch made pizza dough hand stretched to order & so much more.  Check them out:

The New Yorker – Scratch made marinara, mozzarella & fresh grated Parmesan

Vegan Margherita - Scratch made marinara & fresh basil

Margherita - Scratch made marinara, mozzarella, fresh basil 

The OG – Scratch made marinara, mozzarella, cupping pepperoni

The Butcher – Scratch made marinara, mozzarella, cupping pepperoni, sausage & bacon

Fun Gi - Scratch made marinara, mozzarella, crimini mushrooms, fresh basil & truffle oil

Mediterranean Chicken (No chicken for vegetarian) - Pesto, scratch made marinara, mozzarella, crimini mushrooms, brick oven roasted chicken, red onion, kalamata olives, fresh basil, feta cheese and roasted garlic

Pizza salad - your choice of salad on top of our scratch made dough baked with mozzarella

Build Your Own

We LOVE pizza and we need YOU!

Pizza is about good food, good times and good people. That is the experience we want to give our customers. With your help, we're going to be that much closer to our dream of finally opening a brick oven pizza restaurant like no other.

Starting a business, finding amazing employees, creating an amazing line up of pizzas is no easy task. It requires capital, determination, work space, and more.  We are ready to tackle this challenge and everything that comes along with it.

Overall we just want to bring amazing quality and healthy ingredients to our community giving them an experience that makes them happy and brings them back for more.

Opening a restaurant is one of the hardest ventures a person can do.  However, the fact that we have shown that we can successfully operate food businesses like our first restaurant, the food truck and the bakery, shows that we know how to overcome challenges and make smart decisions.

With all of our other concepts, we have used our own capital to fund our operations.  This is going to help so much, raising $15k will get us to the goal line with enough operational capital to finally get the doors open. The funds we raise here will be used for staffing, equipment, building improvements and operations.

We are asking for less than we actually need, but we can start out small and grow in our space, as this will surely grow into a well-established location and serve our community and visitors for years to come.

Our team has worked hard to bring us to where we are right now and Adam & I have put all of our chips into this venture because we believe in it, deeply.  Help us save the world from boring pizza!

This is NOT an all or nothing campaign.  Whatever is donated, we get to use it for opening our pizza shop.

WE THANK YOU!

story:
Hi, I’m Craig, and I’m a knife maker.

Here in my little French knife studio I make knives for the best restaurants, chefs and home cooks all around the world. 

Why use a steak knife?

Most people use either a standard table knife, or a serrated ‘steak knife’ when eating a steak. These knives simply aren’t designed for that purpose. A table knife just isn’t sharp enough and a serrated knife, well, they just tear at the grain of a steak which sucks. 

A great steak deserves a great knife. 

What I'm doing about it

Over the past few months I have spoken with dozens of chefs and home cooks to discover what makes for a perfect steak knife. I have come up with something special. More than 100 processes are normally involved in making my knives, each knife taking around 14 hours to produce. This time has been reflected in the price, putting them beyond the reach of most people. 

With your help, I can speed up some of the processes by performing them in bulk, still by hand, but far more cost effectively, meaning I can offer them at a lower price. As these are handmade to order, each customer can choose from a range of handle materials, making them truly unique.

What makes my knives different?

Made from the highest grade stainless steel and ethically-sourced wood, these knives cut through steak like butter and will look amazing on any table.

By ordering the finest steel from my lovely Swedish supplier and getting it cut using high pressure water jets (yes, water!), I can cut down the time and therefore the cost to produce a knife tremendously. The knives are still hand-ground, sanded and finished, then heat-treated in my small studio in tiny batches. 

I stabilise ethically-sourced wood in a vacuum chamber and make my own custom mosaic pins. Basically, I’m still handmaking each knife, but thanks to modern technology I’m cutting down on the initial upfront work with laser focused water jets.

Let me show you the process which will allow me to put these beautiful knives into production:

 

Blade
 

 

Handle
 

 

Pins
 

 

 

Finish
 

 

 

The result is a beautiful handmade knife that will be razor sharp and last for generations. A guaranteed way to be the envy of your dinner party guests for years to come.

They also make great, bespoke personal gifts, as I can laser-etch a name or short message onto the knife for you.

Take a look at the rewards to see how you can get these fine, high-quality steak knives, at a greatly reduced cost and let's give every steak something that it really deserves - a great knife.  Help me make the best steak knife you will ever own. 

About me?
 
I am a proud Welshman who now lives in rural France making bespoke knives for customers all over the world. My little French village has one of the oldest working forges in Europe and has a long history of producing knives. Each year, knife makers from all over the world come to my region for the Fête du Couteau, a festival showcasing the art of knife making to thousands of visitors. 
 

“A good meal should never be ruined by bad cutlery and with this campaign I hope to bring down the costs of my knives - making them more affordable to everybody”
- Craig Lockwood

www.chopknives.com | www.instagram.com/chopknives

story:
What is Ghost Hawk?

Ghost Hawk Brewing Company is a collaborative effort between partners Tom Rachelski and Steve Bauer, two Clifton natives with a dream of opening a craft brewery in their hometown.

To realize our vision and ensure an offering of high-quality, locally-crafted beer, we moved on to contract our veteran, award-winning Brewmaster - Chris Sheehan.

The name Ghost Hawk is a tribute to Dan Bauer - brother of Steve and childhood friend of Tom - who passed away in 2016. You can read the full story of our journey, inception, inspiration, and startup at https://www.ghosthawkbrewing.com/about-us/

 

We've hit a few unexpected snags, and need a bit of help.

We did all of the research you could imagine before diving full-force into this project. But some situations have come to light, deep in the final hours, that are specific to our building and were impossible to plan for in advance.

 

Our seemingly endless saga with the utility company.

During our planning stages, we discovered early on that our equipment would require a power upgrade from PSE&G. Some of our equipment requires three-phase power to operate, and our building is currently only equipped with single-phase power.

After many months of discussion with their team, we were informed by PSE&G that we would need to contract an independent Electrical Engineer to provide them with a calculated load study. This study required coordination on the part of our contracted engineer, our equipment manufacturer, our equipment supply house, our electrician, and the Ghost Hawk team. After many weeks, we were finally able to provide them with the required data.

Once that was sent over, their engineer visited our location to determine what we needed to move forward. After his review, we were informed that due to our building's specific location, this upgrade would require a new pole and transformer to be installed on our property.

Additionally, it would require the closing and detouring of a busy road with multiple businesses receiving deliveries, along with an access ramp to a major highway. It's a huge logistical project that will involve hiring traffic controllers, planning detours, hiring off-duty police to sit behind utility trucks, materials, and labor costs.. And since our unit is the only one in our building requiring this type of power, the entire upgrade is ALL on our dime.

As if that wasn't enough, they would not work out any type of payment plan with us. We were informed that we would need to pay UP FRONT and IN FULL, or no work would begin. Essentially, we have absolutely no choice but to pay the bill, as we can't operate our business without their upgrade. In late September, they sent us an invoice for $21,000. Yes, you read that correctly. Twenty-one thousand dollars that we could have never planned for.

Between this completely unexpected expense and its related additional costs, we have found ourselves a bit off on our projected start-up costs.

We explored the options of taking on another investor, but we have already funded all equipment purchases, secured our lease, and done all of the legwork involved in our startup. So we put our heads together, and decided that a crowdfunding campaign with some really special offerings might just be able to give us the final push that we need.

 

The Impact

This brewery is very important for many reasons. As the first brewery in Passaic County, we will certainly be making history here in Clifton. Beyond making beer, Ghost Hawk plans to use it's presence and facility to foster local artists, musicians, small businesses, local culture, and we plan to work with local charities and non-profits.

The Ghost Hawk namesake is a dedication to a fallen brother and friend, who was a very talented and loved member of the local community. We plan to make him proud, and make a positive impact in our area. Your contributions not only earn you some really cool and exclusive offerings, they also allow you to become part of a very special new adventure that is embarking here in Clifton and Northern New Jersey.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially. Just spreading the word about our brewery and campaign on your social media, and amongst neighbors, friends, and family is a help as well!

story:
The Remodel

Beast & Cleaver has been a four-year journey and labor of love. Our family-owned shop is completely bootstrapped and self-funded. We are excited to be taking over the location next to Larsen's Bakery and the Fresh Fish Company in the Loyal Heights neighborhood of Ballard.

We are currently remodeling and turning a former hair salon into a butchery and small restaurant but we are running tight on funds. You can help us get our shop open on time by pre-buying products, classes, meals, and experiences at exclusive prices. Dinners and classes for the first six months the shop is open will only be available to campaign contributors.

What We Need & What You Get

We are blown away by your generosity in helping us reach our goal in 11 days! Thank you for all your support.

While we’ve reached our stated “goal,” we still have a ways to go to cover construction costs for the shop. You can continue to pre-buy products, classes, meals, and experiences at exclusive prices. Dinners and classes for the first six months the shop is open will only be available to campaign contributors. Thank you for your help to get us open this fall - we can’t wait to celebrate with you!

  • Budget overages from construction
  • Fixtures & furniture
  • Meat & deli cases
  • Drying & curing chambers
  • Rotisserie for large meats
  • Serving and smallwares 

 

In exchange for your help, we've got some great perks planned, including exclusive access and experiences at discounted rates. Please check out how you can contribute on the right side of this page. 

If you would like to buy an item that is already sold out, please contact us at info@beastandcleaver.com and we'll work to accommodate you.

Delivery

Once the shop opening date is known, we will send you an email inviting you to schedule any purchased classes, dinners, and special experiences. These will be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis and are valid through 2020. All classes and dinners for the first six months after opening will be exclusively available to campaign contributors.

We will honor any requested refunds, per Indiegogo policies, until the end of the campaign. If you are unable to redeem your purchased item after the shop opens, we will issue you a gift card for the amount of your purchase, which you can spend at the shop in any way you like.

About Us

Beast & Cleaver is made possible by the talents of Kevin Smith. An Englishman turned Seattleite, he brings a distinctly European aesthetic and whole animal discipline to the unique bounty of the Northwest. He has worked for Rain Shadow Meats, The Butcher's Table, and Seven Beef.

You can follow Kevin on Instagram at @The_English_Butcher

You can check out some of our early media coverage from EaterSeattle, MyBallard, and The Stranger. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of your contribution, you can help build buzz for us by:

  • Liking our Facebook page
  • Following us on Instagram
  • Signing up for our email newsletter, and
  • Sharing our Indiegogo campaign with friends!

 

If you'd like to financially contribute to our campaign in a different way than what we have listed, please send an email to info@beastandcleaver.com. We are open to hearing your idea!

These will be scheduled on a first-come, first-served basis and are valid through 2020. All classes and dinners for the first six months after opening will be exclusively available to campaign contributors.
We will honor any requested refunds, per Indiegogo policies, until the end of the campaign. If you are unable to redeem your purchased item after the shop opens, we will issue you a gift card for the amount of your purchase, which you can spend at the shop in any way you like.

About Us
Beast & Cleaver is made possible by the talents of Kevin Smith. An Englishman turned Seattleite, he brings a distinctly European aesthetic and whole animal discipline to the unique bounty of the Northwest. He has worked for Rain Shadow Meats, The Butcher's Table, and Seven Beef.
You can follow Kevin on Instagram at @The_English_Butcher
You can check out some of our early media coverage from EaterSeattle, MyBallard, and The Stranger. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Outside of your contribution, you can help build buzz for us by:

Liking our Facebook page

Following us on Instagram

Signing up for our email newsletter, and
Sharing our Indiegogo campaign with friends!

 If you'd like to financially contribute to our campaign in a different way than what we have listed, please send an email to info@beastandcleaver.com. We are open to hearing your idea!

story:
Avocados are brimming with energy – full of valuable nutrients like unsaturated fatty acids and vitamins. Primarily native to subtropical regions, they may as well be cultivated in colder parts of the world. Well, as long as they’re given proper fostering; the seed has to be kept wet all through the germination. AvoSeedo has been developed to facilitate the germination process. It has never been easier to grow your own avocado trees!

 

The avocado: Usage and cultivation

Avocados are being grown as a crop plant since ancient times. Originating from Latin America, the enormous nutritive value of ahuacatl was well known amongst the indigenous population. But it was only a century ago that the avocado found a new home in (southern) Europe. Nowadays, the pear-shaped, alligator-skinned fruits are a common sight in pretty much every supermarket – and on our table. Being outright tasty when consumed fresh and raw, they can also be refined with spices (resulting in the popular guacamole) or stuffed with any filling that pleases your tongue. Needless to say, avocados make a perfect addition to a vegetarian or vegan diet.

Although avocado trees like it warm and cozy, they can handle lower average temperatures (as in central Europe, the US or Canada) quite well. Basically, the seed of every “common supermarket avocado” can be made to germinate and grow to full size (up to 15 meters!). However, simply putting the seed in the ground usually won’t work. Rather, the “pointy” end should be facing the sun (without being exposed to permanent, direct sunlight). At the same time, the flattened end should be kept wet all the time.

There are two common methods to make an avocado seed germinate. You can just place the seed inside a biodegradable pot and leave it at a bright, warm place. After one to two months, the first small roots will begin to show.

A more sophisticated alternative is the so-called toothpick method. Three or four toothpicks are inserted into the outer layer of the avocado seed. They prevent the seed from sinking when it is placed on a glass of water in the next step. As a result, the seed’s “behind” will be kept wet as required, while the “pointy” end can receive the proper amount of sunlight. The germination will also take between one and two months.

In both cases, however, a great deal of attention has to be paid to guarantee a permanent water supply for the “flat” end. This is the main challenge when growing an avocado; if the seed is left high and dry at any time, there’s a chance that the germination process will stop permanently. And this is where AvoSeedo comes into play.

Our small, elaborate tool builds on the idea behind the toothpick method. AvoSeedo is a small plastic bowl that features an indentation with a hole in it. A single avocado seed can be inserted with the “flat” end facing down. Afterwards, AvoSeedo can be placed in a sufficiently large, water-filled pot. Due to its low weight and high displacement, AvoSeedo will remain at the surface all the time; as the water level lowers, AvoSeedo will sink accordingly. 

As long as some water remains in the pot, there is little chance that the seed will dry out – thanks to the “ground hole”. It also allows the developing roots to grow and to expand freely. By the way, the hole is not simply round, but has the shape of a blossom instead. While this may as well add to the aesthetical appearance of AvoSeedo, it is also a functional feature. It makes sure that the avocado seed will be held firmly in its cradle – even if the seed cracks open during the germination process, it won’t sink.

With AvoSeedo, you can significantly raise the success rate when it comes to avocado germination. Without any risk, you can decrease the watering intervals drastically. Only from time to time you will have to check the water level of the pot containing AvoSeedo plus avocado seed. Compared to the original toothpick method, there’s another advantage: the avocado seed doesn’t need to be perforated, reducing the risk of damage (and thus, failed germination efforts).

 

All in all, AvoSeedo is simply the perfect tool for you to grow avocado trees at home. The demanding germination period can now be mastered with almost no effort – giving your new trees an edge right from the beginning!

Risks and challenges

The risk is very limited as we are already producing the product and it’s ready to ship.
