story:
BARBAR

 

Hello everyone! Who doesn’t know us, we are BARBAR. We are small bar in the very heart of Chisinau, the capital of Moldova. For the last three and a half years we have cheered up and brought joy to many people from our community. The bar is a place where you leave all you bad thoughts, negative vibes and other stuff that bothers you, with us, we take care of you here. We have mastered the art of having fun, healing everyone's social needs, getting to know new people every day of the week. It is a very known place in town amongst people of literally all ages 18+! 

 

Because of the unpleasant world wide COVID-19 situation, we as a small business have been very affected and now more than ever we need your support for reopening after this crisis. Unfortunately our government isn’t handling it’s on problems quite well and because of that, the only ones that we can rely on is ourselfs! In this case particularly, we need your financial support to reopen after the pandemic outbursts throughout the world. 

 

We need 5200$ to open up again. This amount will cover the next expenses: 

Rent (that we still pay during all the quarantine period)

Salaries (that still have to be paid to our employees)

Taxes (no support from the government)

Inventory for the summer terrace

Grocery shopping for the opening

Bar shopping for the opening

Additional expenses that pop up all the time no matter what

No matter if we reach or not our goal, all the funds will go for supporting BARBAR. Any sum that we will gather will be a immense step forward for us!

Plus we would like to make it very clear that we are not seeking charity, think about this as a pre-sale for some good and services that we provide our guests and those who will contribute! In the list below you will see the things that we can offer you conversely:

An entry subscription for parties for a certain amount of time

Branded clothing BARBAR (T-Shirts, hoodies, hats, etc)

Branded accessories (phone cases, lighters, pens, key chains, etc)

Branded jars, glasses and other bar stuff

Prepaid birthday and ceremonies with super deals

And other stuff that will make you feel good!

 

If we reach our goal with your help, you become our saviours! Your impact upon us will be very benefic for the entire BARBAR Family. You will help us stay united with our staff and will help us to keep on going!


BARBAR is a place worth saving! Yes we are relatively young, but we have made so many people happy through our parties and even more other people forgot about their weekly needs and concerns that bugged them all days long till the weekend came and the ended up at the bar. We have had even weddings within the bar and they we’re so amazing. People got united for a common life journey in BARBAR! can you imagine that ?! Another thing that we love to do in BARBAR is help the ones that are in need, and we help the teens organise seminars, gatherings, acting classes by offering them for free the space during day time for all their activities that they need. 


We want to open up for you! And everything we do is for YOU! So as soon as we gather some finances, we can continue preparing the reopening of the bar and managing the summer terrace after the quarantine period is over. 


We are very thankful to each and everyone of you that read this and showed any kind of interest towards our cause. If you can contribute financially, we will be more than grateful, but a Share for our cause, a like on our page or  a follow on our instagram is already a huge step ahead! 

These are our links:

 

Facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/barbarmd/

 

Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/bebarbar/

 

Thanks for your time and patience reading this ;)

story:
Morsel is part spoon, part fork, part spatula, resulting in the world's first... Sporkatula? Foonula? We couldn't decide, so we decided to call it Morsel. 

We wanted to design a better utensil that solved all the shortcomings we saw in conventional sporks and camping utensils. And after a year of serious sporking, we think we've succeeded.

 

Eating should never be the crux of an adventure, so our goal is to make eating just a little bit easier, no matter what you're eating out of.

 

Scrape every last bit of food, every single time. More food in your stomach, less cleaning, and less waste.

 

Morsel's long length is perfect for scraping every last bit of food from your Mountain House meal without getting your hands dirty.

 

 

Morsel is designed to be more versatile and useful than other utensils. Simply put, it's designed to work better.

 

By supporting Morsel's Kickstarter, you are helping us fund the injection molds and food-grade materials needed to order our first batch and make Morsel a reality.

But more than that, you're helping support a couple of freelance inventors who have spent an entirely unfathomable amount of time and energy designing... a really cool spork.

Morsel Spork is just the start. We want to continue creating innovative and functional culinary contraptions - ones that work equally well for the discerning outdoorsy person, the family picnicker, or the van-dwelling vagabond.

We're here to shake up the spork industry, and you're invited.

 

We're two Portland-based product designers trying to bootstrap our way into spork production. We've already collaborated on a bunch of cool freelance design projects, and as individuals we've each successfully launched and fulfilled crowdfunding campaigns. Over the last decade we both worked in product engineering and creative design environments, and are experts at turning napkin sketches into real things (for realsies).

Zac | Website

Alex | Portfolio | Website

It started with a simple idea: to make a spork with a rubber edge.

Zac just wasn't satisfied with the sporks on the market. He vented to Alex about how camping sporks were all basically the same, and they all sorta sucked at being used as eating utensils. He wanted something that would fit any shape - which led to the idea of having a soft, rubbery spoon.

This was probably the first of Zac's countless silly product ideas that had genuinely piqued Alex's interest. The whole product could be simple, elegant, and functional - and they felt that previous attempts at reinventing the spork had fallen short of what a spork could truly be.

They agreed to tackle the Ultimate Spork Project, and set to work. Following a traditional product design process, they began by examining all the things they did and didn't like about current spork tech. They started dreaming of all the ways they could impove the spork. And they spent beer-fueled nights sketching concepts on post-it notes, sorting ideas, and evaluating manufacturing risks and feasibilty for different concepts.

After a lot of heated discussion, emotions, and coffee, they started to focus in on a general design plan. From there, they spent countless hours sketching and hand-carving sleek models out of foam, creating 3d-printed concepts, and working on the design's functionality and manufacturability.

The quest for a better spork was on.

 

We started making a list of all the other little things that annoyed us about conventional sporks. Things like...

  • Tiny, barely-functional fork tines
  • Spoons that drip liquids
  • Handles that break too easily
  • Handles too short for deep food bags

We wanted to address all these common spork complaints, while blending the solutions into a single, elegant utensil. One that functioned as well as any normal kitchen cutlery, and one that didn't feel like a compromise.

Our designs evolved, literally, into a complex asymmetric shape that allows for continuous contact, whether digging into tight corners, or scraping along the surfaces of big bowls.

 

We've crafted countless prototypes from clay, foam, and plastic, and we've bought fancy 3d-prints to validate and test our design.

Morsel is the result a year and a half of spork-centric obsession. A quest to create the rad, versatile utensil that we always secretly wanted, and you never knew you needed - until now.

As a couple of product design perfectionists, we're proud of what Morsel has become - an expression of form that makes no sacrifices in function.

Or, in the words of a random internet person...

And after a year of serious sporking, we think we've succeeded.Squishy but not sticky, for easy scraping on any surface.

Choose whatever combination of Morsel shapes and colors you want!
 

(The real-life colors will look even snazzier than the image above)
(Seriously - Alex spent weeks obsessing over real-life color chip samples)
 
 
Pro Tip: Morsel is a perfect gift for anyone who eats food.

We're already rolling down the path to production, so here are our anticipated ship dates:
Morsel Spork and Morsel Spoon: August 6
Morsel Mini: September 3

We still need your help to spread the word. If you think Morsel is a cool product, please, tell your friends, and share Morsel on social media.

story:
Our Story

Fog Eater Cafe was born out of a years-long dream between Haley and Erica to open a business together, formed after discovering how well they worked together and how closely their business plans and philosophies aligned. Erica moved to Mendocino in the summer of 2016, and Haley moved back the following spring to her hometown of Fort Bragg. The two of them, along with Haley’s husband, Nathan, began writing a business plan and hosting a series of dinner parties at local farms utilizing the magnificent bounty of Northern California. Our new location on Albion Street is right in the heart of Mendocino, in a charming historic building with a beautiful garden patio!

The Fog Eater Cafe will feature ingredient-driven cuisine, exploring the essence of Southern food and drink through the rediscovery of local, organic, and heirloom products. Our menu will be inspired by rich Southern food traditions, but will offer vegetarian fare as an environmentally sustainable and healthy alternative to conventional options. Fog Eater will celebrate the harvest bounty to its fullest, using traditional Southern preservation techniques such as pickling, jam making, and fermenting to offer fresh flavors year-round. Fog Eater will also have a comprehensive baking program, offering such delights as biscuits, cornbread, pies and pastry, with exciting options for allergen-sensitive customers. Simple, straightforward culinary practices will allow the purity of our ingredients to shine through, allowing the bold flavors and comfort of home-style cooking to stay with the customer long after they leave the cafe.

The beverage program will complement the food program. Locally produced wines and beers will be showcased alongside non-alcoholic and  low-octane cocktails made with wild foraged herbs and produce from our Mendocino County farms. Organically grown and naturally produced wines will be prioritized, and the huge array of outstanding local wineries will make for a diverse menu of high quality wines to suit all tastes. Avant-garde techniques such as fat-washing, herbal infusions, and clarification will make the cocktail program shine and perfectly compliment the food. We will have drink specials to draw in a scope of customers, from happy-hour beer specials to cocktails designed to suit an individual’s tastes or mood, and exciting alcohol-free options for our teetotaler guests.

What We Need & What You Get

Last Summer, we began to host a series of pop-up dinners, collaborating with local farms to put on four-course farm-to-table dinners with cocktail pairings. The dinners have been extremely well received by the community, selling out upon announcement each time. Now it is time to enter the next phase: a permanent home in the town of Mendocino. We have successfully raised funds for all of the permits, licenses, deposits, furniture, operating costs, dish ware and fixtures. We need an additional 30,000 dollars to cover the remaining cost of the refrigerators, prep tables, freezers, a three-compartment sink, the installation of a zinc-topped bar and... a beautiful hanging sign on Albion Street hand-crafted by the local sign shop.

To sweeten the deal, we are offering a wide range of perks and gifts, from stickers, tote bags, & t-shirts with our logo to free appetizers, desserts, homemade jams and pickles, and private tasting menus specifically catered to you!

The Impact

Fog Eater Cafe will be a destination on the northern California coast, offering farm-to-table comfort food and delicious, innovative shim cocktails at prices approachable by tourists and regulars alike.

The Mendocino Coast has seen an incredible revitalization in the past few years. New farms are opening up, cultivating vegetables and herbs that haven't been present locally for years. Seasonal festivals celebrate the gorgeous bounty of the forest and ocean. The farmer's markets grow substantially each year. The Fog Eater Cafe will showcase this local produce, foraged or grown, proudly sharing to tourists why this place is special while keeping it accessible to the residents of Mendocino County. This restaurant will breathe new life into the community while carrying on the cultural heritage that makes it unique. We need your help to make this dream a reality.

    Risks & Challenges

    The running of a small restaurant that relies heavily on tourism and a niche market at first seemed an obstacle, but the local support has been quite impressive. Out of the hundreds of people to frequent our events, perhaps a mere 10% have been vegetarian or vegan; the food is just that good.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We are looking for support big and small! Anything you can do to help us on our way to opening in September is appreciated. Have cute old plates you want to donate? Want to work our next event? Have an extra chunk of change you want to invest, but you are looking for a different perk?Want to hire us to cook for your next party? We are amazed by how supportive our community has been and can't wait to see where it will take us! Help spread the word and share our vision with friends and families.

    Email haley@fogeatercafe.com to get involved.

Fog Eater will celebrate the harvest bounty to its fullest, using traditional Southern preservation techniques such as pickling, jam making, and fermenting to offer fresh flavors year-round. Fog Eater will also have a comprehensive baking program, offering such delights as biscuits, cornbread, pies and pastry, with exciting options for allergen-sensitive customers. Simple, straightforward culinary practices will allow the purity of our ingredients to shine through, allowing the bold flavors and comfort of home-style cooking to stay with the customer long after they leave the cafe.
The beverage program will complement the food program. Locally produced wines and beers will be showcased alongside non-alcoholic and  low-octane cocktails made with wild foraged herbs and produce from our Mendocino County farms. Organically grown and naturally produced wines will be prioritized, and the huge array of outstanding local wineries will make for a diverse menu of high quality wines to suit all tastes. Avant-garde techniques such as fat-washing, herbal infusions, and clarification will make the cocktail program shine and perfectly compliment the food. We will have drink specials to draw in a scope of customers, from happy-hour beer specials to cocktails designed to suit an individual’s tastes or mood, and exciting alcohol-free options for our teetotaler guests.

What We Need & What You Get
Last Summer, we began to host a series of pop-up dinners, collaborating with local farms to put on four-course farm-to-table dinners with cocktail pairings. The dinners have been extremely well received by the community, selling out upon announcement each time. Now it is time to enter the next phase: a permanent home in the town of Mendocino. We have successfully raised funds for all of the permits, licenses, deposits, furniture, operating costs, dish ware and fixtures. We need an additional 30,000 dollars to cover the remaining cost of the refrigerators, prep tables, freezers, a three-compartment sink, the installation of a zinc-topped bar and... a beautiful hanging sign on Albion Street hand-crafted by the local sign shop.
To sweeten the deal, we are offering a wide range of perks and gifts, from stickers, tote bags, & t-shirts with our logo to free appetizers, desserts, homemade jams and pickles, and private tasting menus specifically catered to you!

The Impact
Fog Eater Cafe will be a destination on the northern California coast, offering farm-to-table comfort food and delicious, innovative shim cocktails at prices approachable by tourists and regulars alike.
The Mendocino Coast has seen an incredible revitalization in the past few years. New farms are opening up, cultivating vegetables and herbs that haven't been present locally for years. Seasonal festivals celebrate the gorgeous bounty of the forest and ocean. The farmer's markets grow substantially each year. The Fog Eater Cafe will showcase this local produce, foraged or grown, proudly sharing to tourists why this place is special while keeping it accessible to the residents of Mendocino County. This restaurant will breathe new life into the community while carrying on the cultural heritage that makes it unique. We need your help to make this dream a reality.


Risks & Challenges
The running of a small restaurant that relies heavily on tourism and a niche market at first seemed an obstacle, but the local support has been quite impressive. Out of the hundreds of people to frequent our events, perhaps a mere 10% have been vegetarian or vegan; the food is just that good.

Other Ways You Can Help
We are looking for support big and small! Anything you can do to help us on our way to opening in September is appreciated. Have cute old plates you want to donate? Want to work our next event? Have an extra chunk of change you want to invest, but you are looking for a different perk?Want to hire us to cook for your next party? We are amazed by how supportive our community has been and can't wait to see where it will take us! Help spread the word and share our vision with friends and families.
Email haley@fogeatercafe.com to get involved.

story:
Mocola is a superfood powder blend made with cacao and kola nut, a caffeine-containing fruit, native to West Africa. Enjoy the cozy hot chocolate taste with a balanced, sustained energy boost. 

Benefits of Mocola

  • Pick-me-up - The kola nut packs the caffeine punch in Mocola. Each serving contains about 85 mg of natural caffeine, similar to a cup of coffee.
  • Healthy, dairy-free ingredients - In addition to cacao and kola nut, Mocola contains coconut milk and coconut sugar. Sip it hot, just like hot chocolate, and enjoy the warm, cozy feeling.
  • Nutritious - Mocola is packed with nutrients (magnesium, calcium, fiber among others) and antioxidants that will help keep you nourished and help rid your body of free radicals.
  • Instant and on-the-go - Mocola comes in a box of 14 individual sachets. Mix the powder blend into a cup of hot water.  Add some milk if you want to. Stir and enjoy!

 

Nutritional Label

 

The Kola in Mocola

Kola nut is native to West Africa, where it is chewed as a stimulant and revered among the Igbos of Nigeria as a symbol of hospitality, respect and friendship. Each kola nut contains more caffeine than two cups of coffee. Like cacao, it contains a fair amount of theobromine, which is a much milder but longer lasting stimulant than caffeine.

 

Kola nuts

Fun fact: Kola nut extract was a key ingredient in the original Coca Cola recipe. That's the reason for the "cola" in "Coca Cola".

Mission

Let's put kola nut on the map! We aim to source our kola nut by working directly with kola nut farmers in our home country, Nigeria. We hope to establish a relationship that not only benefits them financially, but also empowers them to cultivate the highest quality product under sustainable conditions. First, we would like to know what you think about Mocola, so we decided to test our first version of Mocola with this campaign, prior to launching an online store. We are excited to receive your pledges and feedback. Thank you.

Ties to home

My name is Valentine Ugo Ezenwa. As a proud Nigerian, based in the US, Mocola is my way of sharing a part of my culture with the world. In this video, I touch on the cultural significance of kola nut to people of my ethnicity, the Igbos of Nigeria. Thank you for supporting this campaign. 

Start your day with Mocola!

 

Stay cozy

story:
We'll get through this together

The staff at The Last Word is dedicated, unique and hardworking.  Through their work they provide the community with a place to gather for great conversations, food, cocktails and live music.  With the recent mandated closure, they are no longer able to do that.  Financial hardships are an inevitable result.

You Can Help

  •  Perks such as merchandise and private cocktail classes.
  • Funds will be distributed among the Last Word staff.

The Unknown

We can't be sure when we will re-open.  Even one week will have devastating affects on people that live paycheck to paycheck.  Best case is re-opening in the beginning of April, but obviously it changes hour by hour, day by day.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share the heck out of our campaign!
  • And that's all there is to it.

 

We at the Last Word miss you so hard.  We know you are struggling as well.  Let's get through this the best we can.  Stay safe and be well.

Peace, love and cocktails,

The Last Word

story:
We are wanting to expand the Barkery Fleet and need your support to finish the Barkery Treat Trailer! Our newest member to the team is a 1960, "canned ham" style Trailer, that we have lovingly named, "Hammy."  Hammy will be remodeled in the same style & colors as the Treat Truck, Buster! 

Once finished, Hammy will be permanently parked at the front entrance of Magnuson off-leash dog park (7400 Sand Point Way NE).  We will be serving up fresh treats Tuesday-Sunday, morning to night, for all the two AND four legged park goers.  We are so excited to have another permanent place to treat all the Seattle pups we love so much! We will serve the same menus that are on Buster, one for Dogs and one for Humans!

We have Hammy, we have the plumbing done, we have the parks department agreement but we still need a number of things and that is where your support comes in! Here's the to do list:

1. Electrical Work
2. Fridge/Freezer
3. Display/Service Window 
4. Generator 
5. Paint Interior/Exterior, Flooring, Ceiling
6. Point of Sale, Tablet, Register, Safe
7. Construction at Magnuson spot & Hammy maintenance 
8. Misc: Coffee Makers, display pieces, curtains, shelving, printed menus, logos
9. Security System 

TOTAL: A LOT! 

Ben and I had this little weird idea to take my treats mobile......6 years ago! and now as the Barkery works to expand again entering our 4th year in business we can't believe it! We truly appreciate each and everyone of you that support the Barkery each year big or small! Thank you!

Team Barkery,

Dawn, Ben, Jackie, Kathy, Bee, Emerson, Bernie & Sherman!

story:
Hello!

My name is Elena and I am an attorney, entrepreneur, wife, and a mother of two boys and one cat named Kuzma.  For years, I struggled to find a balance between my career and family life.  After a long day at work, I would return home and my kids would want to play with me, but my brain would be completely fried.  I looked for an energy boost but all the products out there looked scary and tasted disgusting. 

I felt so guilty for being unable to be there for them, I left my career and spent two wonderful years as a mom, making life-long memories exploring the world with my family.  The above photo is me with my youngest son on a carousel in Paris.  

After returning home, I started a small business with my childhood friend and it unexpectedly blew up. Suddenly, I became very busy again.  Again, I searched for a natural energy product but again came up short.  That's when I decided to create it for myself and others like me.  I collaborated with a company that develops beverages for many major brands.  And I sourced the highest quality matcha green tea from the leading tea experts to create a formula that is powerful, but natural and healthy.

Why matcha?

L-theanine

Matcha is rich with a rare amino acid, L-theanine, which promotes brain relaxation and alertness. Over a thousand years ago, Japanese monks would drink matcha to remain alert yet calm during long hours of meditation. 

L-Theanine creates alpha waves, which counteract stress and lead to a state of relaxed alertness. And while L-Theanine is common in all tea, the highest grade of matcha which powers MommyGO contains up to five times more of this amino acid than regular teas. Also, L-Theanine may help memory and learning while inhibiting caffeine's side effects.  A recent study found that matcha even improved physical endurance by 24%. 

Thus, MommyGO promotes concentration, increase in energy, and clarity of mind without any of the nervous energy and jitters of coffee and energy drinks. However, not all matcha is the same: there are cheaper varieties that are bitter and far less effective.  Our tea experts made sure that only absolutely the best and the purest ceremonial-grade matcha was used for MommyGO.

Antioxidants

Matcha tea has many other health benefits. It is packed with far more antioxidants than any other ‘superfood’. (Antioxidants are the body’s defense agents that prevent aging and chronic diseases.) Experts at Tufts University concluded that matcha has an amazing 20 times more ORAC (oxygen radical absorbance capacity) than pomegranates or blueberries. Its ORAC rating is an astonishing 1573 units per gram, compared to pomegranate's 105 or blueberries' 93:

Other benefits

In more good news, matcha boosts metabolism and burns fat.  At the same time, it doesn’t raise blood pressure or heart rate like most energy beverages. 

What is the money for?

Because MommyGO has zero artificial preservatives, we faced a dilemma: produce thousands of bottles of natural energy shots and take months to sell them while their power slowly fades away.  Or, essentially pre-sell them via Indiegogo to people who need the energy boost and produce and distribute it all at once, while it's fresh, bristling with antioxidants, and at the peak of its calming energy power.  

The money will go directly to co-packer in Tampa, FL which will order all ingredients and supplies, mix MommyGO and bottle it.  I will be there in person, to make sure the quality what it should be!

Perks for donating

We are so grateful to our backers that I will do a little happy dance wearing a kangaroo costume - it's epic because I have never been observed dancing before!  Of course, you'll receive our amazing natural energy shot and - most importantly - reclaim hours of your time that you can spend on quality time with your family or on building your dreams.

We will also donate to a global non-profit supporting moms and babies called HealthySunrise Foundation: a Baby Pack (onesie, blanket, and baby hat) and Mama Pack (basic medical supplies for birth, diapers, clothes, educational brochures):  

At a higher level, we will be happy to accompany you at a tea ceremony here in Las Vegas.  Or - tour of the tea farm where our matcha comes from in Japan.

AS SEEN IN

 

OUR PARTNERS

Tealet - premium tea sourcing innovators.

Healthy Sunrise Foundation - global maternal-child healthcare non-profit.

Orange Daisy - Adorable clothes for kids and mommies.

One World Healing by Jodi Friedman - Organization of healers created in response to Route 91 shooting.

Superb Maids - The award-winning house cleaning company, #1 in Vegas.

The House of Vegas - premier home staging agency.

BuddyFX - Collective of videographers, graphic artists, and illustrators.

ISI Group - Progressive Art Agency which created this amazing mural to support our cause of women empowering and uplifting women.

story:
Cooking good food isn't a trivial activity. But for those who like to cook, it's a labor of love. The satisfaction of controlling what goes into the food you and your family eats is worth every minute of effort. What you can make with the Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron is only limited by your creativity.
 

 


 

 


 

 



 


 

The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron has a modular form factor that provides a superior cooking experience, portability, and ease of cleaning and storing.

The design consists of identical top and bottom pans attached by a hinge attached to handles by which the cook flips the entire unit during cooking.

Between the top and bottom pans rests the scissor assembly which adds additional thickness to the waffle, allows the waffle to be removed without touching by hand, and gives the waffle its unique look with the indentions along thickness.

The scissor assembly is so named because the cooked stuffed waffle is released by pulling the handles apart with thumb and fingers in a scissor-like fashion.

 

 

Here are just some examples of the kinds of waffles possible with The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron. These recipes will be available on wonderffle.com. You're welcome!
 

Bacon Cheeseburger Stuffed Waffle

The patty is stuffed in a bacon and cheddar cheese waffle "bun", giving you the taste of everything included with each bite. Yum away!
 

Pickle-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Stuffed Waffle

A new take on chicken and waffles. Southern fried chicken in a classic buttermilk waffle.
 


Palak Paneer Stuffed Waffle

East meets West with the Indian dish Palak Paneer (spinach and cheese) in a naan-inspired savory waffle.
 


Sausage and Egg Stuffed Waffle

Your typical American breakfast. Now in a waffle.



Prosciutto and Mozzarella Stuffed Egg Waffle

This flourless stuffed waffle is made from eggs, heavy whipping cream, and chopped onions and bell peppers.



Caramelized Apple Stuffed Waffle

Thomas Jefferson would say that the waffle is more American than apple pie. So here's to caramelized apples in a classic buttermilk waffle.



Collard Greens and Smoked Turkey Stuffed Waffle

Ain't nothing dirty about this take on a Southern favorite: collard greens and smoked turkey legs in a buttermilk cornbread waffle.



Turkey, Ham, and Cheese Stuffed Waffle

A Monté-Cristo-inspired waffle stuffed with turkey, ham, cheese, and a dollop of cherry jam for good measure.




Greens, Feta, and Sun-dried Tomato Stuffed Waffle

This Greek-inspired waffle is stuffed with Spinach, Kale, Arugula, feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and sliced almonds in a savory waffle

 


Banana and Strawberry Stuffed Waffle

Bananas, strawberries, and whipped hazelnut chocolate in a classic buttermilk waffle.

 


Chicken Fajita Stuffed Waffle

Chicken fajita, onions, and bell peppers in a masa harina, black bean, and jalapeño waffle.

 


Chicken Fajita Stuffed Waffle

Chicken fajita, onions, and bell peppers in a masa harina, black bean, and jalapeño waffle.

 


Peanut Butter and Jelly Stuffed Waffle

PB & J for grownups and kids alike. The batter is made with peanut butter powder and cooked around a real-fruit jam filling.

 


Red Velvet Stuffed Waffle

This red velvet waffle has the icing on the inside! Stuffed with a sweet cream cheese glaze and roasted walnuts.


 

MATERIALS

The photos above are from the original aluminum prototype. However, the actual production model will be made from cast iron.

Coming pre-seasoned from the factory, The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron has all-natural nonstick surface right out of the box. At an approximaty weight of 8 lbs (4 kg), it is both sturdy and durable.

It cooks on virtually any heating surface including gas, electric, and induction cooktops, ovens, outdoor grills, campfires, and solar parabolic cookers.

Its handles are one piece with the pans, which causes them to get hot during cooking. Therefore, it comes with custom-fitted removable silicone handle sleeves to prevent the cook from coming in direct contact with the hot surfaces. In addition, the scissor handles will have a permanent silicone overmolding rather than removable sleeves. The silicone coverings can handle temperatures up to 450 °F (232 °C).

DIMENSIONS

Approximately 14.27" L  x 5.83" W x 2.5" H



 

 

With your pledge, you will join the nascent group of culinary aficionados fighting to feed hundreds of famished souls with their next chef d'œuvre gastronomique. Self-important, you say? Well, it sounds more interesting than, "Impress all your friends with the latest kitchen gadget to take the world by storm!" Although, the latter would be no less true.

Anyway, here's what you'll get in return for backing us!

 










 

 

In August, working with a manufacturing partner who liaises between entrepreneurs and Chinese factories, we began the process of soliciting factories to build our initial production run. In October, we chose a factory that specializes in pre-seasoned cast iron cookware. In fact, the first waffle maker I ever owned is an old-fashioned cast iron one built there.

The plan is for the factory to deliver production samples by the end of November. Once we approve the samples, the factory will begin production immediately. Production will take approximately 30 days. From there, the assembled and packaged units will be shipped via ocean freighter to a port in Houston, Texas. This will take another 30 days, which brings us to late February when we will begin making deliveries to campaign backers.

 

Anyone who has recently worked in China is likely familiar with WeChat. It's the Chinese counterpart of WhatsApp. Here, I'm having a WeChat video chat with my manufacturing partner during his recent trip to Beijing. He's showing me how the silicone handle sleeve works using a 3D printed model.

3D prints reflecting the exact size, shape, and assembly of the production model. The sleeve fits snuggly on the pan handle.

(Left) The first attempt by the factory to build a sample unit resulted in additional design tweaks. (Right) An example of what the pre-seasoned cast iron surface will look like.



 

 



 


How long does it take this to cook a stuffed waffle?

Times vary slightly depending on the batter or interior ingredients, but typically you want to cook your waffle for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. A rule of thumb is to estimate between 5 and 6 minutes of total cook time per waffle.

Have you tried using gluten-free flours to make stuffed waffles with this? If so have you found one kind of flour to be better than another?

Yes, I have used gluten-free flours to make chicken stuffed waffles, palak paneer stuffed waffles, and my kale, feta, and sun-dried tomato stuffed waffles. Most gluten-free flours should work just fine on any kind of stuffed waffle, but the two brands I've used in particular are Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free All Purpose Baking Flour and King Arthur Gluten Free All Purpose Baking Mix, both of which are sold at my local grocery stores. I have only had success with the all-purpose flours. I haven't tried rice or almond flours, but I once tried with a batter made from coconut flour and could never get it to coagulate.

Do I need to use cooking oil?

Even with the natural nonstick pre-seasoning, your waffles may stick to the pan. If this happens, you may not have enough fat or too much sugar in your batter. To avoid sticking, you will want to apply a small amount of cooking oil (either spray or with a brush) before cooking. Repeat this application before every third waffle cooked in succession.

Can I make regular waffles on this?

The waffles made by The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron do not necessarily have to be cooked with other foods inside. You can use only waffle batter. The waffles, however, will be larger than your typical flat waffles, having a thickness of about 2 ½ inches.

Can't I just use my conventional waffle maker to make stuffed waffles?

The Internet and blogs abound with pictures and recipes for "stuffed waffles" or "waffle sandwiches" made on a conventional waffle maker. While the cook's skill and creativity are ultimately responsible for a great dish, there are physical limits to today's waffle makers, namely, they're meant to cook something with very little thickness. Try cooking a fried chicken stuffed waffle in your waffle maker at home. Not happening.

Because the Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron makes 2 ½-inch thick waffles, you can fit a substantial amount of food between the batter. It's even better at keeping more liquid ingredients like whipped chocolate or even ice cream inside the waffle without running.

Will this work on my induction stove?

Absolutely!
story_txt:
Cooking good food isn't a trivial activity. But for those who like to cook, it's a labor of love. The satisfaction of controlling what goes into the food you and your family eats is worth every minute of effort. What you can make with the Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron is only limited by your creativity. 

 
 
 



 



 




 


 
The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron has a modular form factor that provides a superior cooking experience, portability, and ease of cleaning and storing.
The design consists of identical top and bottom pans attached by a hinge attached to handles by which the cook flips the entire unit during cooking.
Between the top and bottom pans rests the scissor assembly which adds additional thickness to the waffle, allows the waffle to be removed without touching by hand, and gives the waffle its unique look with the indentions along thickness.

The scissor assembly is so named because the cooked stuffed waffle is released by pulling the handles apart with thumb and fingers in a scissor-like fashion.

 

 

Here are just some examples of the kinds of waffles possible with The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron. These recipes will be available on wonderffle.com. You're welcome! 
Bacon Cheeseburger Stuffed Waffle
The patty is stuffed in a bacon and cheddar cheese waffle "bun", giving you the taste of everything included with each bite. Yum away! 
Pickle-Brined Southern Fried Chicken Stuffed Waffle
A new take on chicken and waffles. Southern fried chicken in a classic buttermilk waffle. 
Palak Paneer Stuffed Waffle
East meets West with the Indian dish Palak Paneer (spinach and cheese) in a naan-inspired savory waffle. 
Sausage and Egg Stuffed Waffle
Your typical American breakfast. Now in a waffle.
Prosciutto and Mozzarella Stuffed Egg Waffle
This flourless stuffed waffle is made from eggs, heavy whipping cream, and chopped onions and bell peppers.Caramelized Apple Stuffed Waffle
Thomas Jefferson would say that the waffle is more American than apple pie. So here's to caramelized apples in a classic buttermilk waffle.Collard Greens and Smoked Turkey Stuffed Waffle
Ain't nothing dirty about this take on a Southern favorite: collard greens and smoked turkey legs in a buttermilk cornbread waffle.Turkey, Ham, and Cheese Stuffed Waffle
A Monté-Cristo-inspired waffle stuffed with turkey, ham, cheese, and a dollop of cherry jam for good measure.
Greens, Feta, and Sun-dried Tomato Stuffed Waffle
This Greek-inspired waffle is stuffed with Spinach, Kale, Arugula, feta cheese, sun-dried tomatoes, olives, and sliced almonds in a savory waffle
 
Banana and Strawberry Stuffed Waffle
Bananas, strawberries, and whipped hazelnut chocolate in a classic buttermilk waffle.
 
Chicken Fajita Stuffed Waffle
Chicken fajita, onions, and bell peppers in a masa harina, black bean, and jalapeño waffle.
 
Chicken Fajita Stuffed Waffle
Chicken fajita, onions, and bell peppers in a masa harina, black bean, and jalapeño waffle.
 
Peanut Butter and Jelly Stuffed Waffle
PB & J for grownups and kids alike. The batter is made with peanut butter powder and cooked around a real-fruit jam filling.
 
Red Velvet Stuffed Waffle
This red velvet waffle has the icing on the inside! Stuffed with a sweet cream cheese glaze and roasted walnuts.




 
MATERIALS
The photos above are from the original aluminum prototype. However, the actual production model will be made from cast iron.
Coming pre-seasoned from the factory, The Wonderffle Stuffed Waffle Iron has all-natural nonstick surface right out of the box. At an approximaty weight of 8 lbs (4 kg), it is both sturdy and durable.
It cooks on virtually any heating surface including gas, electric, and induction cooktops, ovens, outdoor grills, campfires, and solar parabolic cookers.

Its handles are one piece with the pans, which causes them to get hot during cooking. Therefore, it comes with custom-fitted removable silicone handle sleeves to prevent the cook from coming in direct contact with the hot surfaces. In addition, the scissor handles will have a permanent silicone overmolding rather than removable sleeves. The silicone coverings can handle temperatures up to 450 °F (232 °C).

DIMENSIONS
Approximately 14.27" L  x 5.83" W x 2.5" H


 

 
With your pledge, you will join the nascent group of culinary aficionados fighting to feed hundreds of famished souls with their next chef d'œuvre gastronomique. Self-important, you say? Well, it sounds more interesting than, "Impress all your friends with the latest kitchen gadget to take the world by storm!" Although, the latter would be no less true.
Anyway, here's what you'll get in return for backing us!
 

 

 
In August, working with a manufacturing partner who liaises between entrepreneurs and Chinese factories, we began the process of soliciting factories to build our initial production run. In October, we chose a factory that specializes in pre-seasoned cast iron cookware. In fact, the first waffle maker I ever owned is an old-fashioned cast iron one built there.
The plan is for the factory to deliver production samples by the end of November. Once we approve the samples, the factory will begin production immediately. Production will take approximately 30 days. From there, the assembled and packaged units will be shipped via ocean freighter to a port in Houston, Texas. This will take another 30 days, which brings us to late February when we will begin making deliveries to campaign backers.

 

Anyone who has recently worked in China is likely familiar with WeChat. It's the Chinese counterpart of WhatsApp. Here, I'm having a WeChat video chat with my manufacturing partner during his recent trip to Beijing. He's showing me how the silicone handle sleeve works using a 3D printed model.


3D prints reflecting the exact size, shape, and assembly of the production model. The sleeve fits snuggly on the pan handle.

(Left) The first attempt by the factory to build a sample unit resulted in additional design tweaks. (Right) An example of what the pre-seasoned cast iron surface will look like.
 

 

 

How long does it take this to cook a stuffed waffle?
Times vary slightly depending on the batter or interior ingredients, but typically you want to cook your waffle for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. A rule of thumb is to estimate between 5 and 6 minutes of total cook time per waffle.

story:
Media Attention

 

Broadcasted in the major TV Program in Japan "TV Tokyo, World Business Satellite"

 

Introduced in an article of "Tribunnews.com"!

Tribunnews.com is a subsidiary of KOMPAS which is the most famous newspaper in Indonesia.

Up until now, food vacuum packing devices have always been big and bulky which was a huge deterrence. It was thinking about this that gave us the idea to create a device that was not only smaller and lightweight but one that looked good as well.

Using Piccola is super simple!

Step 1: Place your ingredients into the special Piccola bag.
Step 2: Set up the Piccola device onto the hole on bag.
Step 3: Finally, just press the button on top of the device and you're done!

Piccola's features

Preserving the freshness of your food over long periods of time, take it and your vacuum packed food along with your vacuum packed clothes together when you go on trips.
You can vacuum pack a collection of your favourite foods, this product has a ton of various uses!

  • Compact
  • Lightweight
  • USB charging ＋ cordless use
  • Powerful suction
  • 3 different colour variations (Blue, white, black)
  • Powerful suction with just the touch of a button

Product specifications

Size: 85mm Tall, 52mm in diameter
Product Weight: Approximately 140g
Battery: Lithium-ion battery 800mAh
Charging time: Approximately 2 hours
Colours: Blue, Black, White
NOTE: There are times where we will have improved the product's exterior appearance as well as specifications without prior notification. We ask for your understanding in advance.

Long Lasting Freshness

Effects

Oxidization prevention - through taking out and preventing all oxygen from entering into the package, germs become unable to multiply, and it prevents both mould and discolouration.
Protects against pests - prevents pasts that attach to things such as rice or breadcrumbs.
Prevents nasty smells - Prevents food drying up in the freezer or fridge and helps stop the smells from getting all over your things.
Reduces the time needed for freezing - you're able to place the vacuum packed things into some water to defrost them, our product decreases the time needed to defrost the items inside.
Space effective - since our product is very good at what it does, it's very space efficient.
NOTE: Just a note, when freezing these packs of food, ice water works better than regular water for keeping the flavour of food for longer!

You can use our device when going on holidays and trips to pack your other items!

Do you have any experiences like this?

  • Your suitcase is completely full when going on holidays or business trips
  • The smell from the clothes you used during your trip gets all over your suitcase and other items

Piccola will solve all of those kinds of worries!

  • Create space through shrinking your clothes and suits
  • In the vacuum packed form, they are prevented from the spread of nasty smells, breeding of bacteria and mould.

Lightweight and rechargeable

We've designed this product so that it's wireless and chargeable, you can carry it wherever you need it in its compact form factor and only have to charge it when needed.

J-World Inc.

We would like to deliver our products and services to all different parts of the world and work towards allowing our customers and partners a more happy and convenient lifestyle.
Through having a global outlook we are looking to become an organisation that contributes to all different parts of the world.

Representative Director: Masahiro (Nikki) Horiguchi

story:
The Beginning of Snake Oil

This isn’t a love story, exactly, but there are parts of that here. We met in August of 2019, and we both knew immediately that this was setting us up for something different. Within a month of meeting we were already dreaming up business ideas together that united our shared passions. We both loved old and unique buildings, both yearned to build and engage in community, both had mild-to-severe addictions to coffee. We bounced several ideas around; looked at properties in Indianapolis, Elkhart, and Ft. Wayne. Coffee has been a part of these ideas from the beginning, and within a few iterations (and after a short Michigan elopement) we landed solidly on starting a coffee roastery near South Haven, Michigan. 

What we’re doing, here, is building not only our future live + work space, but our future, period. We each traversed two distinctly different paths to get to where we are today: Kiki has collected a wide variety of knowledge and skillsets from a myriad of jobs over the past twenty years. She brings to this endeavor a strong understanding of accounting, business management, design and creativity. I (Luke) have meandered my way through most of my adult life, drinking coffee all the while and seeking to build and foster community. For nearly 6 years I've done that in the classroom; now, I aim to do that with coffee. I started roasting coffee a little over 10 years ago on a thrifted Mr. Popper air Popcorn Popper, and in 2014 sent an email to a guy in Maumee, Ohio that I read about in the newspaper that started a business roasting out of his garage. 6 years later I bought that same roaster from that same guy, and Kiki and I rented a minivan and drove up to get it. 

 

What We Need (hence the 15k)

With your help, we’ll not only finish building our live + work space up in Michigan, but we’ll be able to avoid seeking traditional investors for our business. This means we’ll be able to pursue our dream the way we want to, and the fruits of our hustle will be ours to harvest. It also means we’ll be able to keep our loans as low as possible (currently 50k), which in turn increases our odds of success. We know this is a gamble, and it’s one we’re willing to go all in on. Any donations that we raise from this campaign will go directly into the business and build. We’ve made a lot of sacrifices and progress to get to where we are today, but we still have another big push ahead of us. Your donations will allow us to move forward with insulation, interior finish of the roastery, and running the electric throughout the building.

That's where we stand - staring squarely at the last three obstacles:

- Insulation: Complete insulation of the live + work space. We are still gathering quotes, but will likely hire the majority of this task out to a local professional. This is an essential step so that we can begin completing the interior buildout (which includes the following).

- Electric: This will include everything from purchasing and installing the panel to screwing on the last light switch face plate and everything in between: Romex, conduit, circuit breakers, you name it. An electrician friend of ours is going to help us with this step (we're really embracing this community aspect, here), but we'll be lending a hand (adequately gloved, I promise) at every junction (box). 

- Interior Finish: This is everything from the drywall and paint to light fixtures and sanitization sinks (here we come, Habitat Restore!) to the inspection and certification of the food-safe roastery. We anticipate spending the majority of our weekends from here on out working on this aspect of the build. It'll be our most hands-on part of the project to date, and we are not only ready (tetanus shots pending), but eager - literally counting down the days. 

 

The Stretch Goal (if we go above the 15k)

If we go above and beyond these immediate needs (fingers crossed), we’ll be putting donations towards:

- Green Coffee Inventory: Really the sky is the limit here. We’ve been purchasing small amounts of green coffee so far due to the limitations we currently have (money, namely, and storage space - they are currently stored in our landlord’s guest bedroom), but we’d love to get to a point where we can store and roast more varieties and in larger quantities. 

- An espresso machine for the roastery (and/or our coffee truck?!) so that we can develop espresso roasts

- A commercial range for the roastery so that we can offer vegan croissants and donuts right off the bat instead of waiting around. After all, who wants to wait for vegan donuts? 

 

What You Get

As a thank you gift for your contribution, we’ll be roasting up some special beans just for you! Additionally, you’ll be among the first core group of folks that get their hands on our new packaging (complete with new label and branding!). For a little more, you can score a Founding Supporter T-Shirt, designed by our newest English mate, a tattoo artist hailing from the UK, and printed by hand here in Indianapolis by the fine folks at Cat Head Press. Also up for grabs is a yearly coffee subscription, a 2-night stay in our future digs, and your very own signature roast. Each gift will come with a hand-written thank you note and a lifetime’s worth of our appreciation, gratitude, and humility.

 

But what if you don’t meet the goal?

We’ll figure it out and get there regardless. One of the reasons we chose this platform over one of  the many others out there is that we get your donations even if our overall goal is not met. So, regardless of wether or not we meet that goal, your contributions will go toward all of the projects above (minus, perhaps, the green coffee inventory and espresso machine). We’ve learned a lot of things throughout this process so far, and one of those things is the value of adaptability and dedication. We sold our home, my prized motorcycle, took on summer jobs, and are hustling our wares around Indianapolis as often as we can. For us, it’s just a matter of time until it all works out.

 

The Impact

I think it’s pretty easy to understand why this project is valuable to us - the creators - but what about the community and world more broadly? For starters, we’re a small business that consistently wants to help support and bolster other small businesses. That’s why we’ve partnered up with our local print shop here in Indy for our T-Shirts, and why we sought out pins and pendants that were made in the good ole’ U.S. of A. We believe in what we’re doing, and we believe in the way we’re going about it. Already, less than 6 months into officially starting the business, we’ve worked directly with a farmer in Honduras to get our hands on some of his crops. Already we’re sacrificing profit margins for the greater good of both our local community and the coffee industry. From the beginning we’ve used environmentally friendly packaging - and our new bags are even more environmentally conscious. We want to help create sustainable businesses and sustainable communities, communities that encourage, challenge, and push one another. A few of our immediate community-centric goals when we move up to Michigan: Start a running club (caffeinated, of course, by Snake Oil Roasters), bring some delicious vegan baked goods to our pop-ups and events, and collaborate with other local businesses on projects that we care about (we’re coming for you, Three Blondes Brewing Company!).

 

Risks, Challenges, and Covid-19

Oh, we’re certain there will be (more) risks and challenges, and we’re ready for ‘em. We’ve already encountered a few obstacles along the way, and so far we’ve made it past them. (Who knew, for example, that it would cost us nearly $7,000 to get water to our property? Or that our structure would be ineligible for most new construction loans? Or that Covid-19 would dismantles so many of the traditional retail options for small startups like us?) Additionally, we are both acutely aware that there is an inherent risk, here. How many small businesses make it these days, anyways? But to us, it’s all about the mindset (and opportunities to brainstorm together, and, sure, a few moments of panic and frustration). Again, we’re counting on those past experiences and skillsets to get us through this. Kiki has helped several small businesses find their footing, and has successfully operated her own. I’ve spent the last 3+ years as a founding teacher at a new high school, and sure, while there is a difference between teaching high school students and starting a coffee roastery, there is a lot of overlap, too. We know more challenges are coming, and we’re eager to meet them, hopefully while barefoot standing on the shores of Lake Michigan with a coffee cup in hand.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Listen: we understand that we’re launching a fundraising campaign in the middle of a pandemic. We know that millions of people have lost their jobs and incomes during this global catastrophe. And while we’re daily thankful for our own jobs and security, we’re also reminded that nothing in life is certain - nothing guaranteed - and that life is too short for us not to step every day toward our dreams. That said, maybe you’re not in a position to donate. That’s okay, there are loads of other ways that you can help us out, each one as meaningful and important to us as the last. Here are just a few ideas: 

Spread the word! Maybe you know someone that likes specialty coffee, or is a vegan, or lives in Michigan near our future roastery, or takes summer trips to South Haven and might be interested in joining the running club some Sunday morning - the more people that are aware of us and what we’re doing, the better!

Share our story! Again, the more the merrier! Share our campaign, our Instagram, our coffee, emails, phone numbers - anything! This is a grassroots affair, and we need all the help we can get!

Know your way around HVAC systems? Are you an expert painter? Want to help us get those new fence post holes dug? If you’ve got the heart and willingness to come and aid in some of these labor intensive projects, let us know!

Did you recently upgrade an appliance? Is your old one sitting in the garage? We’re starting from scratch, here, so that 4 year old washer with the broken knob and finicky sensor looks pret-ty damn good to us! *Note: if your church is getting rid of their old commercial range and you can get us the hook-up, I will cook you elaborate vegan meals literally whenever you want!

Have a big truck and want to help us move in the Spring? (Or, have a 4x4 beater that would make a great driver for Michigan Winters?) We’ll be making frequent trips, I’m sure - just hit us up!

After all, who wants to wait for vegan donuts?  What You GetAs a thank you gift for your contribution, we’ll be roasting up some special beans just for you! Additionally, you’ll be among the first core group of folks that get their hands on our new packaging (complete with new label and branding!). For a little more, you can score a Founding Supporter T-Shirt, designed by our newest English mate, a tattoo artist hailing from the UK, and printed by hand here in Indianapolis by the fine folks at Cat Head Press. Also up for grabs is a yearly coffee subscription, a 2-night stay in our future digs, and your very own signature roast. Each gift will come with a hand-written thank you note and a lifetime’s worth of our appreciation, gratitude, and humility. But what if you don’t meet the goal?We’ll figure it out and get there regardless. One of the reasons we chose this platform over one of  the many others out there is that we get your donations even if our overall goal is not met. So, regardless of wether or not we meet that goal, your contributions will go toward all of the projects above (minus, perhaps, the green coffee inventory and espresso machine). We’ve learned a lot of things throughout this process so far, and one of those things is the value of adaptability and dedication. We sold our home, my prized motorcycle, took on summer jobs, and are hustling our wares around Indianapolis as often as we can. For us, it’s just a matter of time until it all works out. The ImpactI think it’s pretty easy to understand why this project is valuable to us - the creators - but what about the community and world more broadly? For starters, we’re a small business that consistently wants to help support and bolster other small businesses. That’s why we’ve partnered up with our local print shop here in Indy for our T-Shirts, and why we sought out pins and pendants that were made in the good ole’ U.S. of A. We believe in what we’re doing, and we believe in the way we’re going about it. Already, less than 6 months into officially starting the business, we’ve worked directly with a farmer in Honduras to get our hands on some of his crops. Already we’re sacrificing profit margins for the greater good of both our local community and the coffee industry. From the beginning we’ve used environmentally friendly packaging - and our new bags are even more environmentally conscious. We want to help create sustainable businesses and sustainable communities, communities that encourage, challenge, and push one another. A few of our immediate community-centric goals when we move up to Michigan: Start a running club (caffeinated, of course, by Snake Oil Roasters), bring some delicious vegan baked goods to our pop-ups and events, and collaborate with other local businesses on projects that we care about (we’re coming for you, Three Blondes Brewing Company!). Risks, Challenges, and Covid-19Oh, we’re certain there will be (more) risks and challenges, and we’re ready for ‘em. We’ve already encountered a few obstacles along the way, and so far we’ve made it past them. (Who knew, for example, that it would cost us nearly $7,000 to get water to our property? Or that our structure would be ineligible for most new construction loans? Or that Covid-19 would dismantles so many of the traditional retail options for small startups like us?) Additionally, we are both acutely aware that there is an inherent risk, here. How many small businesses make it these days, anyways? But to us, it’s all about the mindset (and opportunities to brainstorm together, and, sure, a few moments of panic and frustration). Again, we’re counting on those past experiences and skillsets to get us through this. Kiki has helped several small businesses find their footing, and has successfully operated her own. I’ve spent the last 3+ years as a founding teacher at a new high school, and sure, while there is a difference between teaching high school students and starting a coffee roastery, there is a lot of overlap, too. We know more challenges are coming, and we’re eager to meet them, hopefully while barefoot standing on the shores of Lake Michigan with a coffee cup in hand. Other Ways You Can HelpListen: we understand that we’re launching a fundraising campaign in the middle of a pandemic. We know that millions of people have lost their jobs and incomes during this global catastrophe. And while we’re daily thankful for our own jobs and security, we’re also reminded that nothing in life is certain - nothing guaranteed - and that life is too short for us not to step every day toward our dreams. That said, maybe you’re not in a position to donate. That’s okay, there are loads of other ways that you can help us out, each one as meaningful and important to us as the last. Here are just a few ideas: Spread the word! Maybe you know someone that likes specialty coffee, or is a vegan, or lives in Michigan near our future roastery, or takes summer trips to South Haven and might be interested in joining the running club some Sunday morning - the more people that are aware of us and what we’re doing, the better!Share our story! Again, the more the merrier! Share our campaign, our Instagram, our coffee, emails, phone numbers - anything! This is a grassroots affair, and we need all the help we can get!Know your way around HVAC systems? Are you an expert painter? Want to help us get those new fence post holes dug? If you’ve got the heart and willingness to come and aid in some of these labor intensive projects, let us know!Did you recently upgrade an appliance? Is your old one sitting in the garage? We’re starting from scratch, here, so that 4 year old washer with the broken knob and finicky sensor looks pret-ty damn good to us! *Note: if your church is getting rid of their old commercial range and you can get us the hook-up, I will cook you elaborate vegan meals literally whenever you want!Have a big truck and want to help us move in the Spring? (Or, have a 4x4 beater that would make a great driver for Michigan Winters?) We’ll be making frequent trips, I’m sure - just hit us up!

story:
Our knife series has been hugely loved by our backers and after developing the older versions of our knives, we have now developed this series in Titanium coatings for you.

We cook each day in our homes and restaurants and great tasty meals deserve the big part to the sharpest tools that take part in preparations to it.

interducing, the sharpest ever knife series with titanium coatings to extra speedy cuttings

 

We have been consistantly trying to improve the experiance of your cuttings by looking deeply, how much the force and the Slide factor plays up a role. Unlike other proclaimed sharp knives, this series has a proven record of being only the sharp and simply robust.

Our newly developed titanium coated series, has been the only answer to the most sharpest knives sofar.

For monster cuts & hours of unlimited speedy Prep. preperations.

 We have taken an extra step forward to give our blades an added glossy affect that acts like a repellent to its steel surface.

Steel used:  Japanese Steel  ( 440 C Steel )

Handle :     Layered  colourfull handle

Coating: Special  Titanium coating for the extra razor cuttings

HRC or Hardness of steel:  58-60 HRC

Handle :   Layed rings handle with micarta wood

weight :  260 g 

The layerd handle is an eye catcher ( see above )

 

 

 

The Naga small

You get a small Nagasaki Paring knife.

 

The Naga Santoku

You get the Nagasaki Santoku knife.

 

The  Naga Knife  /  chefs knife

 

The Nagasaki Nakiri Knife

 

The complete Set

The Naga Galaxy

 

The Naga Star

 

The Naga Tripple

 

The twin Pack

story:
Risks & Challenges

At We, the many* we love the planet, and we love the humans that occupy it - it's just that we keep messing it up...

We* really want people to LIVE. There is only one planet we occupy (for now) so the biggest risk to all humanity isn’t funnel web spiders, bad drivers, alien invasion, or even an overabundance of hipsters, it's climate change. This is the greatest challenge of our time, our greatest risk, and we want to do something about it.

If you want to know more about business type risks, please see below (but remember what we said above - thats the important bit).

There are of course risks associated with starting any new business, especially one with a new model like We, the many*.
That being said we are serious about this project and feel strongly that this is a transferable way forward for not only food, but for integrating what we do with an environmental benefit. There has been a significant amount of due diligence completed to ensure that we can deliver this campaign in full, even if we miss our goal.

In the uncertain times created by COVID-19 there can be delays in shipping our product to you, examples of this could be in procuring ingredients and packaging post campaign, or in the physical shipping of the product. In terms of shipping, depending on your location there may be a delay in your breakfast getting to you, rest assured we will do everything we can to get it to you asap. As our product is on the way to you it may suffer some bumps, but we will do all we can to ensure your breakfast arrives to you unscathed.

There are many potential opportunities for investment that must hit our specific requirements, the scale of this investment will depend on the reach and success of the Kickstarter campaign. Investing is always a risk, however at We, the many* we will be sure to place our funds only into business that show good business health while being climate positive and reducing carbon from the atmosphere.

story:
Hi and thank you for visiting our campaign page! I’m Aya Okale-Weeks, owner and lead curator at Meat & Graze. We are a fully licensed and insured specialty catering company offering artisan 'Cheeseperiences' to the wonderful folks in North Carolina’s Triangle, and surrounding areas. A ‘Cheeseperience’ is what we call an appreciation of cheese. 

 

Meat & Graze Cheeseperiences range from mini boxes up to elaborate grazing tables. Meat & Graze is a proudly black and woman-led company, supporting farmers and artisans while making it easier to enjoy aesthetically pleasing artisan cheese and charcuterie arrangements.

 

After using cheese as a catalyst for healing following the murder of my baby brother Joshua, I went on to merge 7+ years of hospitality experience, an entrepreneurial spirit, and everything I've learned about artisan cheese to share these Cheeseperiences with our local community. It is so warming, especially now, to be a part of meals and celebrations through this business.

 

We are COMMITTED to providing the highest quality service and the best-tasting products. Our goal is to open a cheese bar to offer customers a more convenient option for purchasing and enjoying delicious cheese and charcuterie arrangements while getting more connected with our local community.

Redefining how we shop, dine, and play, Boxyard RTP is a 15,000 square-foot cargotecture development putting shipping containers to work for small businesses. With 300+ companies, the historic park is home to some of the world's many breakthroughs, inviting ideas, connections, and the next big thing. The unique development will also be home to a rich program of events, providing social, educational, and health-oriented opportunities to patrons.

 

Covered spaces for seating, special events, and performances will be located throughout Boxyard RTP, creating an indoor/outdoor shopping and dining experience to enjoy year-round. This sustainably constructed complex will also be people and dog-friendly.

With your help we will be retrofitting a 320 sq ft. shipping container to move from a shared kitchen to our new home, along with inventory, and equipment. Surpassing our goal will allow us to reserve funds for working capital.

 

-OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT-

  • Follow us on Instagram @meatandgraze

  • Share our campaign

  • Reserve a Cheeseperience

story:
Sprinkles = Happiness

It's really easy.  I started a week ago making cookies for strangers.  I've been leaving them on doorsteps, wandering around and handing out little packages of them to people shopping or just wandering around.  Let's be honest, everyone has something that makes them sad or stressed and the holidays can amplify that.  Knowing someone cares? Sprinkles? Buttery Cookies? Those make people happier, so really, this is a campaign to try to make a very small cross section of humans just a little happier in the name of holiday cheer.

Cheer is free. Butter is expensive.  Really expensive, so a little help would go a long way,  We need more butter (and pretty little ribbons and bows)

What We Need & What You Get

Whatever this raises will buy butter, sugar and flour (along with little pretty bags and ribbon).  I'll bake them, package them, and hand them out to everyone I run into.

I can bake 8-10 dozen every hour and I am willing to bake (with helper elves) from the time I finish work till about 1am.  That's 4 hours of cookies per weeknight, so at least 32 dozen.  That's a lot of Christmas cheer.  Each package contains 6 cookies.  That's 16 happier people a night.

Each dozen costs about $4.50 to make with sprinkles and the little baggies. So $10 = 2 dozen or 4 happier people.

For anyone who donates $10 or more, I'll send you pictures of the cookies you handed out.

$20 or more and I'll put whatever you want on one of the pretty little tags on the back of the cookies (which currently say: A little holiday magic)

$25 or more and I'll mail you a little package of cookies (I don't know how well they travel, but I'll try)

The Impact

You'll make people really happy (sprinkles make people happy).

Other Ways You Can Help

Share us on social so more people can have pretty sprinkle cookies.

Update!

We got our first donation! 20 happy little packages to be baked tomorrow!

story:
KEEP GRINDING

 

Designed and tested by skateboarders in Austin, Texas who were looking to escape the clutches of junk food marketing, FLATBAR is a no-nonsense fruit, nut and seed bar designed to fuel your perfect session.  Whether on the board, in the gym or blazing your own trail, FLATBAR uses only real ingredients to help you keep grinding.

Vegan / Gluten Free / GMO Free / No Added Sugar

LEARN MORE: www.flatbarenergy.com / @flatbar_energy

 

FLAVORS

 

INGREDIENTS

Our rules are simple: only recognizable ingredients; no added sugars or artificial sweeteners; no unnecessary fillers.  Each of FLATBAR’s ingredients has been carefully chosen to create an energizing product that will help you keep doing what you love:

  • Blueberries (organic)
    • A quintessential superfood, blueberries are high in antioxidants and have been shown to have anti-inflammatory effects on the body.
  • Bananas
    • High in potassium, which helps maintain blood pressure and brain function, bananas have the power to help you keep grinding.
  • Dates (organic)
    • Nature’s candy; not only are dates high in potassium, but their sweetness packs a punch of iron and B vitamins. 
  • Sweet Potatoes (organic)
    • A delicious inflammation fighter chock-full of beta carotene and fiber.  Sweet!
  • Papaya
    • Another orange inflammation fighter, papaya adds tropical flare to a savory mix.
  • Mangos (organic)
    • Ripe with antioxidants and fiber, the delicious taste of mango is the proverbial cherry on top of a nutrient-dense sundae.
  • Goji Berries (organic)
    • Used in Chinese medicine for centuries, goji berries are a good source of antioxidants and have been shown to have anti-inflammatory effects on the body.
  • Almonds
    • Laden with good fats, protein, magnesium and vitamin E, adding almonds for that extra energy boost is a no-brainer.
  • Cashews (organic)
    • Almonds can’t steal all the glory; cashews are also packed with good fats, copper, zinc and iron.
  • Pumpkin Seeds (organic)
    • More than just a salad topper, pumpkin seeds are a powerhouse of magnesium, omega-3 fats, and complete protein. 
  • Quinoa
    • You already know that quinoa is loaded with fiber and complete proteins; the better question is why it’s not in more bars. 

Additional ingredients:

  • Flaxseeds (organic) / Hemp Protein (organic) / Cherries / Almond Butter (organic) / Cashew Butter (organic) / Sunflower Seed Butter (organic) / Pea Protein / Coconut Oil (organic) / Sea Salt / Himalayan Pink Salt / Cinnamon

NUTRITION

FLATBAR provides a 4:1 to 5:1 carb:protein ratio (depending on the flavor) for optimal pre-, during- and post-session fuel.  By keeping a steady balance of carbs from the fruit plus protein and healthy fats from the nuts and seeds, FLATBAR provides the immediate energy you need for high levels of intensity, as well as long-lasting energy to keep your perfect session going until the wheels fall off.  

 

About the Creator

JOHNNY LOZANO: Writer of the Berrics’ weekly cooking blog, Salad Grinds and Bean Plants, Johnny started designing FLATBAR out of the desire to optimize his limited time on the board.  Though Johnny had been skating for 20 years and had no plans to slow down, careless diet and an 80+ hour work week led him to realize that staying on the board longer started with eating well.  After leaving his career as an attorney, he began to design the ultimate on-the-go bar for skateboarders looking to make every minute count and beta-tested it in skateparks across Texas and California, as well as in the gym, during hikes and everywhere in between.  After getting rave reviews from both skateboarders and other weekend warrior athletes, it was time to make the dream a reality.

Who Tested It?

In addition to being tested locally, some of skateboarding’s gnarliest rippers were instrumental in making sure that FLATBAR was an optimal source of pre-session fuel.  The following crew put FLATBAR through the wringer: Dave Bachinsky, Walker Ryan, Sebo Walker, Shawn Hale, Will Flores, Tom Rohrer, Cody McEntire, Mark Appleyard, Steve Berra, Aaron “Jaws” Homoki, Tyler Peterson, Chris Wimer, Mikey Whitehouse, Karl Watson, Ryan Lay, Ryan Curtis, Matthew Thompson, Lars Frazer, Kerry Webber, Ruby York, Victoria Taylor, and Nick Dompierre.  The bars were also tested by other athletes including OC Brakeless team and the Texas Beach Volleyball Tour.

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

What’s up with the name?  Why FLATBAR?

If you’re a skateboarder, you already know.  If you’ve never skated, a flatbar is simply a flat metal rail used for grinds and slides.  To a skater, however, a flatbar is more than a mere rail; it is a shining beacon of progress and an obstacle entertaining enough to fuel a session that lasts for hours in blistering heat or freezing cold.  Because it’s both a widely-recognized fixture in skateboarding and a physical description of the product, we believe there’s no better namesake for the bar that keeps you grinding.

Fair enough, what’s with the flavor names? 

Rather than offer a simple recitation of salient ingredients, we wanted to pay homage to skateboarding.  Check out the inspiration here:

  • Banana Berrial Flip: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gEJlz-vhOdo
  • Goji Berry or Go Home: https://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=go%20big%20or%20go%20home
  • Switch Mango Push: https://www.muckmouth.com/swongo/a-detailed-analysis-of-switch-mongo-pushing-and-the-polarising-effects-it-has-on-our-community-by-alexander-james-dyer-aged-375

How many bars are in a box?

Each box contains a dozen bars of a single flavor.

I have a nut allergy – can I eat FLATBAR?

Both Banana Berrial Flip and Switch Mango Push contain nuts and nut butters.  While Goji Berry or Go Home uses pumpkin seeds and sunflower seed butter instead of nuts and nut butters, it does contain coconut oil and is manufactured in a facility that also processes peanuts, milk, soy, eggs and wheat.

How long will FLATBAR last?

FLATBAR has a shelf life of 6 months.  Because FLATBAR uses whole, natural ingredients, we recommend keeping FLATBAR in dry, room temperature conditions.  Once first production is funded, FLATBAR will begin lab-testing to determine if shelf life extends beyond six months.  Lab testing can take anywhere from six months to a year, so we expect to know whether or not shelf life can be extended by early 2019.

Can FLATBAR be shipped internationally?

International shipping standards require all food products to have an expiration date longer than six months from the date of shipping.  For this reason, FLATBAR cannot be shipped internationally until our lab testing is complete and we can confirm that shelf life is longer than six months.  We are working as quickly as possible to confirm this and will do everything in our power to ship internationally as soon as the shelf life is confirmed.

McEntire, Mark Appleyard, Steve Berra, Aaron “Jaws” Homoki, Tyler Peterson, Chris Wimer, Mikey Whitehouse, Karl Watson, Ryan Lay, Ryan Curtis, Matthew Thompson, Lars Frazer, Kerry Webber, Ruby York, Victoria Taylor, and Nick Dompierre.  The bars were also tested by other athletes including OC Brakeless team and the Texas Beach Volleyball Tour. FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONSWhat’s up with the name?  Why FLATBAR?If you’re a skateboarder, you already know.  If you’ve never skated, a flatbar is simply a flat metal rail used for grinds and slides.  To a skater, however, a flatbar is more than a mere rail; it is a shining beacon of progress and an obstacle entertaining enough to fuel a session that lasts for hours in blistering heat or freezing cold.  Because it’s both a widely-recognized fixture in skateboarding and a physical description of the product, we believe there’s no better namesake for the bar that keeps you grinding.Fair enough, what’s with the flavor names? Rather than offer a simple recitation of salient ingredients, we wanted to pay homage to skateboarding.  Check out the inspiration here:
Banana Berrial Flip: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gEJlz-vhOdo

Goji Berry or Go Home: https://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=go%20big%20or%20go%20home

Switch Mango Push: https://www.muckmouth.com/swongo/a-detailed-analysis-of-switch-mongo-pushing-and-the-polarising-effects-it-has-on-our-community-by-alexander-james-dyer-aged-375
How many bars are in a box?Each box contains a dozen bars of a single flavor.I have a nut allergy – can I eat FLATBAR?Both Banana Berrial Flip and Switch Mango Push contain nuts and nut butters.  While Goji Berry or Go Home uses pumpkin seeds and sunflower seed butter instead of nuts and nut butters, it does contain coconut oil and is manufactured in a facility that also processes peanuts, milk, soy, eggs and wheat.How long will FLATBAR last?FLATBAR has a shelf life of 6 months.  Because FLATBAR uses whole, natural ingredients, we recommend keeping FLATBAR in dry, room temperature conditions.  Once first production is funded, FLATBAR will begin lab-testing to determine if shelf life extends beyond six months.  Lab testing can take anywhere from six months to a year, so we expect to know whether or not shelf life can be extended by early 2019.Can FLATBAR be shipped internationally?International shipping standards require all food products to have an expiration date longer than six months from the date of shipping.  For this reason, FLATBAR cannot be shipped internationally until our lab testing is complete and we can confirm that shelf life is longer than six months.  We are working as quickly as possible to confirm this and will do everything in our power to ship internationally as soon as the shelf life is confirmed.
